* With Guide of Wisdom being the new hell dungeon in level 100 cap, the more you farm it the more you can progress in your RNG journey.
* Here I outline various way to to farm epic souls so you can roll your chances at this dungeon.
* How Many Souls Would I Need?
+ On minimum, full 156 fp will get you 20 runs.
+ Which translate to 18
+ So about 126  per week.

* How Can I Cough Up That Many ???
+ Raids
- You can get 40  from buying  from the raid shop using  per week
- 100  =
- Each Prey-Isys Raid clear = 200
- Each Fiend War Raid clear = 150
- ChewyTheGoon in his stream talked about how can you cap 40  / week doing raids. TL;DR, get 6 characters geared enough to do both raids.

+ Okay, what about the other 84 ?
- Short answer, Dawning Crevice and Assault Mode.
- In my gold farming guide, I talked about this method in details.
- Using the same farming strategy, on average, you can get 1.4  /character/week.
- Soo.... for 84  you would need 62 characters running DC every SINGLE day.
- Worth noting that this doesn't include , , Epic Drops refunds along with other means of getting  such as events or Cursed Ruby.

* How Much Time Would It Take?
+ DC/AM
- Try to aim for 30 sec/DC run and 1 min/AM run.
- With 14 DC runs/week and average 8 AM runs/week --> 15 mins/character/week.
- 62 alts would take ~15.5 hours/week. Or 2.2 hours/day.
- AND that doesn't take into account for reload screen, switching characters, and teleporting them to dungeon. I wouldn't be surprised if it take 3 hours per day to do this.

+ Raids
- Will need to do 12 Fiend War and 11 Prey raids to cap
- Would be hard to tell how long it would take to do all that raids.
- In a perfect world where you have a static group of geared people, and each raid takes ~5 mins.
- That would take about 2 hours/week, but I highly doubt anyone can get this.
- My guess would average 5 hours/week
- AND that's if you have a static group.

* Does It Worth in the Long Run?
+ Personally, absolutely NOT.
+ Switching 62 characters is a tedious task, and EVERYDAY? and running 23 raids? I'd burn out. I won't last a week.

* Are there any other ways?
+ 💳💳💳💳 my friends.
+ 20 runs would cost you 360 , that would translate to 360
+ And right now (June 16, 2020) each  costs ~111,000
+ Grand total ~40 million  / day.
+ So about ~$30 USD/character/day.

  
And that's for 156 FPImagine having Neo+ and FP pots  
  
  
Could You? YESShould You? NO

* So you followed my gear progression guide but still got wrecked in Legendary dungeons. Does it take you 8 minutes and 3 life tokens to clear?
* This beginner guide aims to take your time down to sub 2 minutes and potentially zero life tokens by showing you ways to increase critical chance, along with other tips to increase your damage while using my Male Mechanic as an example.
  
Critical Cap* Critical rate differs when in town and in dungeon. The best way to know your critical rate is to go to Training Center in Hendon Myre. Once in, just cast your buff still and see what the crit rate is.
* For example: While in town, my crit rate is 76.6%. In training center, my crit rate is 96.6%. With my buff skill, it's 100.6%, which is plenty.
* Refer to this spreadsheet to see where your class stands (credit to u/freecomkcf)

Ways to Hit Critical Cap* There are 4 equipment slots that can give you Critical Chance through enchantment: Head/Shoulder, Beat, Shoes, and Sub Equipment. With proper Enchants, you can get up to 22% Critical Chance increase.

* With new players, for Head/Shoulder, Beat, Shoes I used Noblesky Green Bijou Bead , which gives 5% magical crit chance for each slot (aka. +15%). For Sub Equipment, I used Noblesky Blue Bijou Bead , which gives me 2% magical crit chance. So in total, I got 17% through enchants.
* Avatars and Emblems are another great source of Crit Chance. Here you can get Crit from Red and Green Emblems. Below are my example:
+ For Red Emblem slots, I used multi-colored Rare Red-Green (Int + Magic Cri) . Each one gave me 1.1% crit. Therefore   are 4.4% Crit.
+ For Green Emblem slots, I used Rare Green (Magic Cri) . Each one gave me 2.2%. Therefore   are 8.8%. I used those rare green for the aura  too, so that's another extra 4.4% for a total of 13.2%
+ On top of that, the Aura itself  gave me an extra 10%.

* Other source you can look out for are Pet and Tittle. For my example, the Pet  gave me 5%, and the Title  gave me 3%.

Other Damage Increase Tips* Use appropriate Enchants on other equipment slots. This part depends on the class you're playing. DFO classes can be divided into 4 damage categories:
+ Fixed Physical - so look for Independent Att and/or Strength cards/beads
+ Fixed Magical - so look for Independent Att and/or Int cards/beads
+ Percent Physical - so look for Physical Weapon Att cards/beads
+ Percent Magical - so look for Magical Weapon Att cards/beads

* Really the easiest way to know which one is your class is though the DFO class roles Excel Sheet. Here's an example of what I used for my Male Mechanic. NOTE: Always use Elemental Damage when you can, those trump other damage type.
+ Grim Seeker Fighter  for   (Weapon Magical Attack)
+ Officer Mercel  for    (Elemental Damage)
+ Hound Cyrus  for  (Elemental Damage)
+ Anje Wane for  for  (All Stat)
+ Heat Researcher Zadracon  for  (Elemental Damge)

* For your convenience, I have indexed the recommended enchants for each equipment slots.
* Reinforcement/Refinement on weapon is another huge damage boost.
+ For Percent Class, Reinforce the weapon (+10 should be enough)
+ For Fixed Class, Refine the weapon (+6/+7 should be enough)

* Insignia is another easy way.
+ Fixed Physical, use  Perfect Insignia of Punishment
+ Fixed Magical, use  Perfect Insignia of Spirit
+ Percent Physical, use  Perfect Insignia of Protection
+ Percent Magical, use  Perfect Insignia of Blessing

* Gems to go along with your insignia
+ One     (element type of your choice)
+ One   (physical/magical crit)
+ The other 2 slots can be whatever, usually hit rate and attack speed

* Where can I get them? The easiest way is to joint a guild, then you only need to log in weekly to get Guild Coin . Then walk to the Guild Hideout, talk to the NPC to buy your goods.

* Swap Set is also huge, NEVER forget about them. You can get your set from Operation: Hope dungeon. You can read more in this Swap Set: The Essential Tool for Damage post.
* Cube contract is absolutely a must. You need to make your weapon inflict an element to DO elemental damage and Level 100 legendary/unique weapon can't do that. Therefore you will need , which can be bought with gold in Cera shop (500,000  for 7 days).
+ Once you get the contract, you can select the type of element inflict you want by clicking on the cube in your "Material" tab in your inventory. When you see a color cube at the bottom, you're good to go.

* Automated Player Characters (APCs) is one of the last resort if you really need to. These are synergy classes that can give you damage boost. They're very cheap and can be bought from auction hall. The common ones are Number 28  and Soldoros .

* As the update is just around the corner, I (director's Yoon) think it's time to tell you a little bit more about the direction of this max level expansion.
* First of all, the main purpose of this max level expansion was to create a first step back to the basic fun of an action game. I think the genre of action games is different from the hack and slash genre.
+ If hack and slash is a pleasant way to sweep away monsters, action game is suppose to use the right skills at the right time, focusing on the battle with the monsters, and to lead the battle advantageously by avoiding or destroying the pattern in an appropriate way when a dangerous situation comes.
+ In recent years, Dungeon & Fighter has been continuously maintained without any major changes or challenges in terms of system or gameplay. As a result, I felt like the fun in the game was diminishing little by little.
+ If we focus only on creating content in the same way as before, we could have released more content at a faster time, but it is too old to keep piling up the same things, so repeating the same actions no longer makes sense. Before, I thought I had to try new things.
+ Since we thought that it was impossible to simply add one or two systems or dungeons to try these changes, we integrated and added related systems while expanding the max level.
+ Of course, some people will find it difficult to make a sudden change, and some would like to start with a small change. We ourselves had a lot of such concerns and worries. And even now, I still have a lot of fear of change, but nevertheless, I decided that it would be more efficient to carry out overall innovation in line with the opportunity for max level expansion than to proceed while modifying the past one by one. I thought it would be more comfortable for adventurers to adapt.

* Of course, forcing too big a change on you is also not a desirable direction, so we tried to make it possible for those who want to play similar to the previous one to enjoy DnF without major changes.
+ For example, elements that are helpful for dungeon capture, such as the neutralization gauge and enhanced backstep skill, have been added, but don't worry too much about those elements, and you will not have any problems dealing with monsters in the same way as before.

* To recap, I can say that there are two things that I thought most important this time. The first is the action, the second is the equipment.
+ The biggest direction of the action is that it is about to start a change from the existing hack and slash genre of killing monsters with powerful skills to a direction that strengthens the action, which places importance on fighting with monsters.
+ Accordingly, it was thought that the character could be adjusted accordingly by reducing the monster's harshness first, and the monster's attack power that ignores the character's defense was deleted. After deleting all of them, those patterns were changed to be used only partially in essential situations.
+ Second, to talk about the equipment, the existing equipment up to level 100 had their own characteristics but basically the equipment has a lot of similar options. I thought that the playstyle that was too uniform without any character distinction.
+ Although the damage is a bit lacking, there are equipment that you can play without thinking much, while there are settings that can create more powerful damage even if you embrace some penalties. we hope that adventurers will be able to enjoy the game in a way that they find enjoyable.
+ And since all of these equipment shouldn't be swayed too much by RNG, we've increased the drop rate of epic gear significantly more than before.

* So, in the 105 gear situation, I think it will be a time when balance becomes more important than ever, and I will continue to do my best to update balance. The direction of action and equipment mentioned above is expected to create a very big change that encompasses the game as a whole.
+ We made efforts to lower the play hurdles by strengthening the in-game guide, but nevertheless, as I said at the last festival, in the case of this max level expansion, we are prepared to have more modifications.
+ If there is still an excessively i-frame or unreasonable pattern, or if you have equipment with a strange balance, there is a high probability that we missed it because there are too many things to worry about. If you do, we will always keep our eyes and ears open, so please let us know. We will continue to do our best to improve the game.

* After a long period of preparation for the update, it is finally available to adventurers, but I can't guarantee that this update will be a success. The evaluation is not made by us, but by the players. However, after time has passed, this level cap was a necessary update to walk on the right path to make Dungeon & Fighter more interesting in the future.

* Dev's Note: An overall reorganization has been carried out so that you can use and enjoy the creature system more meaningfully, as opposed to only used as a piece of equipment for damage. As expected, there's a problem with re-acquiring old creatures. Also the problem with the concept of creature growth being meaningless, and the problem of artifacts being used only for a small increase in fame will be resolved.

Creature Revamp

New Items* Creature Soul:
+ This is a new Account-bound material that are stored in your Creature tab (just like your cube fragments and souls). You can use this soul for various new functions at Grandma Oran NPC such as Creature Summon, Send Creature, Creature Awakening, Creature Awakening Skill, etc.
+ You can get 1 Creature Soul for every 30 Loyalty points spent on any creature.

* Creature Growth Capsule:
+ This is a untradable capsule that increase creature's EXP by 100.
+ You can get this capsule though the "Send Creature". Here you're basically dissembling unwanted creatures. This will also give you extra Creature Souls as well (100~300 souls).

  


Creature Summon* This is another function from Grandma Oran. Each summon requires 400  and 300k gold. The system will give you a list of summonable creatures and their rates.
* At the bottom of the window is the Prestige bar. Each summon will give you 1 Prestige point. Get 200 point will give you  Prestige Creature Selection Box.
* You can choose 1 of 4 Prestige Creatures. Here are the stat:
+ +65 STR / INT / SPI / VIT
+ +3% Physical / Magical Critical Rate
+ +2 % Attack / Casting / Movement Speed
+ +1 Level Designated Class Skill
+ +18% Physical / Magical / Independent Attack
+ +18% All Damage
+ +731 Fame

  
  


Creature Awakening* Creature awakening and skill acquisition are available for all creatures except for temporary creatures. Creature awakening is possible after reaching Level 50.
* Awakening creature requires 300  and 750k gold.
* The effects applied when awakening a creature are as follows.
+ Creature max level increase to level 100.
+ One creature awakening skill can be acquired (This awakened creature won't have the skill though, you can apply the skill using another NPC function).
+ 2 creature awakening abilities (not to be confused with skill) are given at random.
+ +10 Fame.
+ ⨉3 Loyalty consumption speed.

  


Creature Awakening Skill* When awakening a creature, Grandma Oran NPC <Creature Management - Awakening Skill> menu allows you to acquire or convert creature awakening skill according to each probability.
* Acquiring or converting Creature Awakening Skill require 200  and 150k gold.
* The acquired Creature Awakening skill can be used by pressing the Left Shift (L\_Shift) key, and Creature Soul is consumed when using the skill.
+ For characters who have custom used the left shift key (L\_Shift), you can set the shortcut key in [Settings → Hotkey Settings → Dungeon].
+ Awakening skill cooldown information has been added to the interface UI in the dungeon.

Artifact Revamp* All artifacts that were previously obtainable will be discontinued.
* When killing monsters, you can acquire new rare artifacts.
+ You can acquire level 10-50 artifacts in level 1~60 dungeons.
+ You can acquire level 60-110 artifacts in level 60~max dungeons.

* New artifacts are divided into rare grade and unique grade. The characteristics of each grade are as follows.
+ Rare:
- One or two option for each color of red, blue, and green are given at random
- The option stat increases in proportion to the artifact's level, but the option stat may be different even for equipment of the same level.

+ Unique:
- Will have1 fixed option according to the name.
- One or two option for each color of red, blue, and green are given at random. (Look like you can have up to 3 lines with unique?)
- The option stat increases in proportion to the artifact's level, but the option stat may be different even for equipment of the same level.
- One or more unique exclusive options may be granted.

Artifact Deconstruction* Artifact Raw Material
+ This is an account-bound material that are stored in the same spot as Creature Soul.
+ The number of artifact raw materials that can be acquired is affected by the artifact's rarity and equippable level.
+ All artifacts that were previously obtainable can also be dissembled

  


Artifact Creation* Artifacts can be crafted through the pop-up menu of Grandma Oran NPC <Create Artifact>.
+ When creating artifacts, you can obtain rare to unique artifacts of level 50 or higher depending on the probability.

* A total of 4 artifacts can be crafted at the same time.
* Artifact crafting takes a total of 8 to 16 hours, and the longer the crafting time, the higher the probability of creating an artifact of higher rarity.
* The materials required to craft 1 artifact are 100  and 100k gold.
* Artifact production cannot be canceled while in progress, and consumed materials will not be refunded.
* While creating an artifact, you can shorten the production time by clicking the <Reduce Time> button.
+ 5 Creature Souls are required per 1 hour of reduced time.
+ If less than 1 hour is left, you will consume 5 Creature Souls to complete Artifact Crafting.

  


Creature Collection* A creature collection system is added. The collection is activated the first time you connect to the character with the creature.
* In the Creature Collection, you can check the name of the acquired creature and the basic motion of the creature.
+ Temporary creatures and some package hidden creatures are not included in the list.
+ Creatures with the same appearance but with different options are registered in the collection as the same slot but have alternative name.

* When Level 110 hit, how does one progress from previous cap? What about starting from scratch? No worries, I'll explain this level expansion for you.
* Before we get to progression, it's important that you understand how the gear meta have changed and how these 240+ new epics works. Below is my plan of progression when 110 cap hit DFOG. If you see any error, let me know.
* To read detail info about this cap, see this Season 8: The Next Journey post.

Table of Contents* 110 Cap Summarized
+ New Meta
+ "New" Way to Get Epics
+ How 105 Epic are Organized

* How Do I Progress Now
+ Start From Scratch
+ Start as 100 Cap Graduate
+ Start at Guide of Wisdom Graduate
+ Final Milestones
+ Some Final Info

* References



New Meta* In previous level cap, all new epic equipment have a fixed stat. Whatever you get from dungeon and raids are that stat you're stuck with.
* In level 100 cap, you get to use Raid epic gear such as Sirocco and Ozma pieces to fuse with your current gear, thus giving you more damage. But at the end of the day, whatever piece you fused, that stat doesn't change.
* Until now, in level 110 Cap. These new epics can now levelled up and that piece will give you more stat. Along side what, damage mods (e.g. PMI, Bonus damage, Critical damage, etc.) are now merged into one called Damage Amplification.
* In the picture below, you can feed un-used epic to your main piece to level it up. It doesn't even have to be a duplicate, any piece of the same slot will work.

  


"New" Way to Get Epics* This is not really new because we have seen this method before with the Spectre release.
* Basically Spectre class had her own event dungeon. Here each of these sub event dungeons can drop epics at an insane rate, even mini-boss can drop level 100 epics. If you don't remember, there was even a website that guide you which dungeon drop which piece.

* Now apply that to level 110 cap, it's every similar, all 10 new dungeons (Normal and Advance) can drop epic at any difficulty.

* For the 8 normal dungeons, you now have 8 difficulties (Normal → King, then Heroes Normal → Heroes King). Each difficulty is progressively harder and requires more Adventure Fame to enter.
* Well, Raven, if all of them drop epic, why do I need to clear harder difficulties?
+ Higher difficulties will still have the same drop pool, but the Growth level of those epic will be higher. Therefore, for example, instead of getting level 2 Growth level epic, you get level 25 Growth level, that would save you time and materials to level it up.

* Well, Raven, how do I know which of these 10 dungeon I should farm? I'll get to that.



How 105 Epic are Organized* Even though there are no set piece in 110 cap, all 240+ of them can be organized in 2 major categories: Fixed Option and Custom Option
+ Fixed Option can further be sub-categorized as Normal and Advanced.

* For your convenience, I have prepared this Spreadsheet so you can read about those epic.
* Fixed Option Epics:
+ When looking at the Spreadsheet, you will see that each item will have 4 Options, and those are for the most part unique to that pieces.
+ You can have multiple pieces that can favor a specific build (e.g. Bleeding built, X-string built, etc) to your liking. That's why this 110 cap is so versatile.

* Advanced Fixed Option Epics:
+ These are still for the most part unique in their options but a bit more OP, and they can only drop from from Advance dungeons (Noblesse Code, Destroyed Castle of the Dead, and Meister's Laboratory).
+ They are not necessary 2 or 3 times stronger than normal Fix-Option epics. You need to read their options and see which one worth swapping over.
+ For example: Tactical Drone Controller Armlet , one single option increases Damage Amplification by 356 AND stacks up to 10. Granted it decreases your movement speed by a bunch, so use at your own risk.

Custom Option Epics* These are unique in a way is that their Options are not pre-determined like Fixed Option. Rather when they drop, they get 4 out of a pool of options.
* KDnF has a tier list of those custom option as well, but I'll let you judge for yourself which one you want. For example, "Crit chance +5%" option is pretty trash, duh.
* Another perk is that you get to pick one of the 4 random option and change it. When a gear’s option is replaced this way, the gear can no longer have its options replaced except for the option that was changed.
+ In the left picture below, since this is a clean piece, you can pick any option to change. However, in the right picture, this piece already have option 1 changed, therefore, option 1 is the only one available to change again.

* Replaceable options will be marked with yellow arrows next to them. Left pic is a clean piece, where as right pic has its Option 1 modified.

* Where can you get these custom epic? Only from Normal dungeon at Hero difficulties and Advance dungeons at Expert difficulty or higher. Each slot has 3 possible custom epics and they're dropped in specific dungeons.
* So What is the Point of Custom Option Epic?
+ The main point is to reinforce a certain build (e.g. "If 40% or lower HP, Skill Atk. +8%" option when using Suppressed Mana Bracelet  piece). The possibility is endless. If you don't have a specific build, generic skill attack options are good too (e.g. All lvl x skill atk +20%)

* To learn more about this topic, visit this Custom Epic Made Simple post.

What About Legendary Gear* You read that right, 110 cap also have Legendary Gear. But from what I have read, they're not really used to bridge your way to epic gear.
* They are kinda the other way around. Legendary Gear can only be obtained in Advanced Dungeons Expert difficulty or higher. And they're tradable.
* The main point of them is that their options are better than Normal Fixed Option epic. AND their option can also be transferred to Custom Option Epics.
* So in a way, I guess if you don't have a good option to transfer, you can buy a legendary and transfer an option from there.


How Do I Progress Now

Start From Scratch* This apply for players that have taken a long hiatus. Maybe you left at 86 cap and start to come back. Or maybe you leveling fresh character. This part is for you.
* Start at normal dungeon difficulty Normal or Expert. They don't require a lot of Fame to enter.
* Clearing those dungeons at Normal difficulty will give you entry level materials called  Frost Crystal Fragments and its account bound version.
+ If you don't already have some epic pieces, use these  to start buying unique gears from NPC shop. Moreover, use these entry materials to start buying your basic enchants as well.
+ Also don't forget to buy your Abyss swap set. I made a post about it a while ago, check it out.
* Level 110 Normal dungeons at all difficulty also drop the next tier materials called  Ominous Crystals and its account bound version.
+ Their main purpose is for purchasing Selective Level 105 Fixed Option epic box. Yes, if you don't get the piece you want, you can just trade  for it. Getting epic at this cap is that easy. Each box cost 1,527 .
+ Pro Tip: You can get more of these via daily mission. AND daily mission can be done PER CHARACTER. As you can see, the more alt you clear daily mission, the more  you can funnel to your mains.

  
* Your next goal is to get enough fame to enter Advance dungeon (Noblesse Code and Destroyed Castle of the Dead)
+ Normal dungeon Hero difficulty start at 25,837 fame, where as Noblesse Code normal difficulty start at 16,880 fame.
+ Getting to 16,880 fame shouldn't be hard in this cap. So if you have 4 characters, I highly recommend you start doing Noblesse Code normal mode. Not only do they drop lot of epics, but you can pick and choose which piece to give to which alt. Thus gearing up multiple characters at the same time.
+ These advance dungeons will drop the next tier materials called  Red Dusk Crystals and its account bound version. You can use this  to buy Fixed Option Epic Selection box. This one is different than the one you buy with  in a way that it include epics that drop from Noblesse Code and Destroyed Castle of the Dead (aka Advanced Fix Option Epics)

* Your next goal here is to level up your epics and get to 25,837 fame. Looking at the table below, getting that fame will grant you access to Hero difficulty and Advance dungeon Expert.



| Normal Dungeons | Noblesse Code | Destroyed Castle of the Dead |
| King 21,675 | Normal 16,880 | Normal 17,612 |
| Slayer 23,259 | Expert 23,788 | Expert 24,472 |
| Hero Normal 25,837 | Master 27,483 | Master 30,267 |
| Hero Expert 29,369 |  |  |
| Hero Master 30,946 |  |  |
| Hero King 32,523 |  |  |
| Hero Slayer 33,989 |  |  |

+ This is pretty much your end game farming (for now). These difficulties will start dropping Custom Option Epics to complement with your current set. This part is also pretty much lots of RNG. There is a big pool of custom option, so you don't always get the top tier options.
+ At this high level difficulty is where you start seeing another tier material called  Harmony Crystal. This is used to safely amp your gear where if you fail, the amp level doesn't decrease. You can read more about it here.
+ A side content you should be doing around this progression is Storm's Wrath. This is a weekly dungeon that can drop epic with option level 30~60 and only require 25,407 to enter Expert level. These option level will boost your fame tremendously.

  


Start as 100 Cap Graduate* This part kind of depends on how strong and how many fame you have.
* If you're a whale with 17-18k fame with full Sirocco, Ozma, and BP gear. You can go straight to Destroyed Castle of the Dead Normal mode. Here's an example of 18.5k Male Nen clearing Normal Destroyed Castle of the Dead.

  
.embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }
  
* Along side with Normal mode Advance dungeon, do normal dungeons at the highest difficulty you can to start gathering your 105 epics.
* If you don't have enough fame, myself for example, my main is at 16,101 fame. With the mythic reworks, I probably would have a bit higher fame. Normal Castle needs 17,612 fame, so I would start at normal dungeons Master difficulty (requires 13,195 fame).
* Then try to make your way to 25,837 fame for those higher level dungeons to get Custom Option Epics.
* You can also feed your Ozma fused gear, Sirocco Fused gear, and Max BP gear to 105 epic.



Start at Guide of Wisdom Graduate* This would apply to a lot of my lower tier alts. Those are the character at about 12-13k fame.
* Here you're probably strong enough to solo Oculus party mode or enough to get to Sirocco green party.
* Here I would start with Normal dungeon Master difficulty if you have enough fame. If not, then start at Expert difficulty. Then follow the normal route mentioned above.



Final Milestones* Hitting 33,043 Fame grants you access to the first Legion dungeon, Ispins. This dungeon drop option level 50~70, which can help boost you fame.
+ This is the area where you acquire  Quad-Color Split Energy for your fusion epics for your Accessory slots.
+ Every dragon you kill here will give you 1 Tales of Bravery which can be converted into Conqueror's Token and used to buy various goods from NPC Flo. Some good items includes +30 Elemental damage Magic Stone Bead and Ispins Fixed-option epics.

* Hitting 34,308 Fame grants you access to Machine's Revolution: Total War. This dungeon drop option level 60~65, which can help boost you fame.
+ This is the area where you acquire  Cruel King of Dragons' Seal for your fusion epics for your Armor slots.
+ Here you will get another version Tales of Bravery which can be converted into Conqueror's Token and used to buy various goods from NPC Flo. Some good items includes Warped Dimension Cube and Total War Fixed-option epics.
  
  


Some Final Info* Golden Beryl is another materials used for option growth, transfer and level transfer of epics. They can drop at any normal dungeon difficulty. However, the tradable version  Flawless Golden Beryl only drops in Advance dungeons.
* Level 110 cap comes with a Revamped Encyclopedia. Make sure to use it to look up where to get each epic piece.
+ From a quick glance, Vericollis Temple drops lots of Accessories and Special Equipment. Whereas Nasau Forest drops a lot more armor pieces.

* Advance dungeons require Entry Ticket and FP to enter. These Tickets require Play Points to buy. You get 1 Play Point for every 30 FP spent. So it's in your best interest to burn all FP everyday. If I don't have time to play that day, I would use FP Express to burn them off in normal dungeons. Those ticket don't expire, so stock them up on your busy day then use them on your free day.
+ With the The Meister's Laboratory update, you no longer get Play Point from spending FP . Instead you get 10 Points from completing daily limited mission.

* Keep your 100 cap Mythic. They got revamped and got a huge Fame boost. You can still use them for a while before being replaced with good Custom-Option epics.
Congrats* You have reached the end of this progression guide. Really at the end of the day, it depends on your fame. You now know the general path. Now pick the appropriate dungeon difficult.

Title* These are skill title that are ranging from level 15 to level 35 skills (most likely used for buff swap). Each box will give you 1 of 4 random title. Additional stat as follow:

* Rerollability:

+ Since this is a still title, reroll beads are sold as well for the same price. Each bead will give +1 to +2 of a skill ranging from level 15 to level 70 (Not sure if you can pick the class)

+ It also comes with fail safe system which when you roll enough time, you can pick a +2 level skill of our choice.

* This update adds a new starter area called Elvenmere. It also includes the many convenience improvements, 105 epic and class balances.

Table of Contents

* Elvenmere
+ Dungeon Plays
+ Season rewards
+ Weekly rewards

* Convenience Improvement Update
+ Item Changes
+ System Changes

* 105 Epic Balance
+ Fixed-Option Changes
+ Custom Option Changes
+ Common Options Changes

* Class Balance (Arena)
* References



Elvenmere

* Dev's Note: After the level 110 max expansion, many players made their way back to the game. Therefore we have prepared this content to support the stable growth of new and returning adventurers. It is placed in Elvenguard at the starting area so that new/returning adventurers can access even low level. It's not a long story, but I would appreciate it if you watch it and enjoy it as a small story that is connected to the previously revealed Grim Seeker story.
* New area Elvenmere added where you're heading down to Hendon Myre.

* This is a dungeon that does not consume fatigue, clear cubes, and equipment durability.
* All stages of the dungeon can be cleared once a week, and all accounts share the clear status. For example, you can clear Steps 1~24 as Character A → When connecting as Character B, you can play from Step 25.
+ The appropriate level for Elvenmere to play is level 17 to 110, and you can freely select and enter the 4 allocated areas. (However, you cannot receive rewards for uncleared stages.)

* A certain amount of HP/MP/skill cooldown is restored every time you clear each stage.
* The last stage of each realm will have a boss monster. Defeat it to go to the next realm.
* Hidden monsters appear with a certain probability at each stage and drop the "Leaf Coin" that can be used in the Elvenmere shop.
+ If you move to the next stage without acquiring the dropped item, the item will also be moved.
+ The stage where the hidden monster appears changes every week.



Dungeon Plays* Elvenmere consists of 100 stages
* At each stage, a background and play style suitable for the level appears, and you can enter the next stage by defeating the boss monster.
+ Normal Style: General configuration steps similar to other dungeons. A type of dungeon where a certain amount of normal / named monsters appear and clear the boss.
+ Hack and Slash Style: A stage in which a large number of normal / named monsters appear at regular intervals. More monsters appear than other styles.
+ Great Battle Style: Steps to battle with a small number of monsters. Battle with named and boss monsters.
+ Arcade Scroll Style: Arcade scrolling stages similar to Operation Hope.

* As the level increases, the level and difficulty of the monster increases.
* If you stay within a stage for more than a certain period of time, the illusion becomes stronger, and accordingly, the effect that makes the monster in the stage become stronger and obstacles that interfere with the adventurer appear.



Rewards* Elvenmere rewards are given every time you clear a stage, and consist of seasonal rewards and weekly rewards.
* Season rewards (Accound-bound):
+ Season rewards are given at certain stages, and are provided when you clear the stage for the first time.
+ Season rewards cannot be acquired again until the season reset.
+ The season reset schedule will be notified in advance before the end of the season.

Convenience Improvement Update

Item Changes* You will be able to change the cube contract color even in the dungeon.
+ When changing, a cooldown of 10 seconds and 15 seconds is applied.
+ Live Server: You can only change once per dungeon.
+ Dev's Note: This was done to compensate for the inconvenience of playing if you do not apply the attribute or enter the dungeon in a state different from the main attribute. However, if multi-attribute switching is attempted within the dungeon, unexpected settings may be affected, so a limit on the number of times has been applied.

* Cube's contract is immediately re-applied when resurrected after death in the dungeon
* Level 95 equipment is changed to be able to be engraved directly on level 105 equipment.
+ The cost is the same as engraving from level 95 to level 100 equipment and then to level 105 equipment.
* Effect is added when you acquire the equipment you favorited from the equipment dictionary. Limited to Epic and Mythic equipment.

* When searching for an item, materials and parts other than the item name are also changed to be searchable. Example: When searching for shoulders, items with shoulder in the item name and head/shoulder slot are searched together.

* A function to receive a selection box in bulk is added.
+ You can receive up to 100 batches at once.
+ If the items that can be selected from the box include equipment, avatars, creatures, insignia, talismans, and titles, the function is not applied.

* Changed so that growth capsules/skill level capsules/coins can be used collectively by right-clicking shift.
* When repurchasing an entry ticket item, the player's fame is not checked.
* A warning message is added if there is an enchantment to be deleted on the equipment to be engraved.
* Power Essence will be added to the 'Holy Grail of Faith ' shop next to NPC Magar Rosenbach.



System Changes* A function to check fatigue level in the character selection window has been added. The basic fatigue and the PC room fatigue level are displayed separately, and the remaining fatigue level is displayed.
* Batch sales function will be added to Delilah Shop. The skill registered to the "Shift" key and "A" key will not be used while the Delilla Shop is open.

* Added ability to set saturation in graphic settings

* A dismantling machine repair function has been added to the profession / dismantling menu

* Monster Encyclopedia has been added to the ESC menu

* Changed so that you can check the mission details in the dungeon. Mission rewards can only be received in town.
* An icon is added to the dungeon selection screen for easy identification of daily mission dungeons.

* The remaining skill time of less than 10 seconds, which is the cooldown notification function, is added. Applies when the skill cooldown time display option is checked.

* Town character masking function is added.
+ This function reduces memory usage by limiting the appearance of overlapping characters while in town.
+ In the case of friends, adventure team friends, and guild members, they are displayed regardless of the option.
+ This function was added to alleviate lag when adventurers are crowded at the entrance of the dungeon.

* The material change menu has been added to the Loton NPC menu.
* The ability to add and edit the portal slot on the right side of the Seria room is added.
+ Added slots: "Equipment Upgrade" will move in front of  Kiri NPC. "Profession" will move in front of Abello NPC.
+ Added editing function: You can edit the warp slots using the settings button.

* The ability to view the equipment and fame of other characters in the reward result window that appears after clearing or failing the Noblesse Code has been added.

  


105 Epic Balance* Dev's Note: As mentioned before, we have downgraded the performance of level 105 epic items related to basic options. However, we tried to avoid changing the settings as much as possible due to this adjustment, so the setting was intended to be at a level that could still be considered in options with other settings. And we made adjustments to items that were judged to need additional adjustments.
+ First, we have relaxed the condition of the recovery option due to the combo conditional or multi-hit so that the character centered on single-hit mechanic does not suffer as much.
+ In the process, we have determined that the "Necklace Of Exalted Fury"  and some custom epic options are over-balanced, so we have slightly lowered the figures.
+ If all items are upgraded to match excessive performance, new settings will be created in the process, which can be a burden on adventurers, so we want to keep the changes within a stable range as much as possible.
+ In addition, only items that were judged to require some upgrades were upgraded, and for equipment with excessive conditions and penalties, conditions and penalties were alleviated to enable smoother use.
+ Lastly, due to the nature of the damage increase option, in order to alleviate the negative play feeling of damage increase getting lower as the option level increases, a skill attack increase option that is applied from a certain option level or higher has been added.

* Dev's Note From Live Server: As some custom options change, the options for fixed-option epic gear that use those options are adjusted.
+ Since the 3rd and 4th options of all fixed option epic equipment are designed to use the custom option as it is, adjusting the custom option causes the performance of the fixed option epic equipment to change in the same way.
+ However, it is not intended to change the performance of the fixed option epic equipment, so we have adjusted the option values ​​to have the same effect as the existing specifications as much as possible.
+ This was adjusted for the same purpose for some equipment, such as the 'Knight's Pride' item reflected in the existing first server, and there was a part that caused confusion due to the lack of explanation.

Changelog:* 5/2/2022: The "Every Time The Sum Of The Option Levels Increases By 40 Levels, The Skill Attack Power Increases By An Additional 1%" should be a common option for all equipment slot, not just top, bracelet, ring.
* 4/25/2022: "Class Balance" section doesn't pertain to PvE, but rather PvP (Credit to 彦星 for pointing that out).
https://www.dfoneople.com/news/events/2866/Newbies-Always-Welcome-Season-3?page=1

* It's been over a month since the max level expansion. It was necessary to respond to various issues that occurred after the max level expansion, and to improve convenience that was not taken care of in advance.
* After a meeting with the staff, while chatting, I heard the words, “I am busy working for the max level expansion, so I can’t do it on weekdays, and I don’t have time to do housework on the weekends because I am busy.” I was proud and saddened by the development staff who continued to work hard after the update.
* What is particularly encouraging is that not only those who have played DnF in the past, but also a lot of new/returned adventurers. In addition, existing adventurers are also called Dunlin, and we are very grateful for the help and interest in the settlement of new/returned adventurers.
* We may not have been perfect, but we are really happy with the many people called Dunlin while producing content called Elvenmere that is about to be updated tomorrow, planning an event, organizing a package, preparing a convenience update, etc.
* I think the part that had the biggest impact on adventurers was probably the item reorganization.
* Among the various options for items, if not modified, there were some that would cause serious balance problems in the future, and some items that are expected to be highlighted according to the change of the future meta.
* As I said at the last festival, even if you have a bit of a crazy time in the beginning of the cap, you should fix the items that cause serious balance problems in the future so that it will not negatively affect adventurers with other settings. Because of this, it was inevitable to proceed with revisions several times.
* Even before the revision, there were adventurers who were satisfied with the options and had a lot of fun, so it seems that the unavoidable revision caused inconvenience and anxiety a lot. I apologize once again.
* And after the item reorganization to be carried out tomorrow, we do not intend to proceed with the large-scale item modification similar to the previous one.

Future Direction* Also, there are a few things that are still under development and are under discussing.
* It's about independent objects. From the past to the present, there has been a problem in that characters who mainly use independent objects do not receive the option of triggerable items properly.
+ We don't know all the history of this, but if we simply modify it, the balance can be shifted, and problems such as huge lag can occur, so we are approaching it with caution, but we are currently working hard to improve it.
+ In the near future, we will accelerate the pace of development so that we can introduce it to adventurers through related patch notes.

* We are also carefully reviewing your comments on the difficulty of dungeons.
+ It requires some combination of settings as well as acquiring certain epic equipment to go from expert to master.
+ We plan to lower the Master Difficulty and King Difficulty so that you can move up to the upper level more smoothly. So we're trying to alleviate some of that problem.
+ We plan to maintain the gap between Normal and Heroes to some extent so that Heroes can become more challenging content.
+ Master and King difficulty adjustments will be reflected immediately this week, but setting a new difficulty level will take a little longer.

* In addition, problems such as incomplete settings, which are one of the other factors that increase the entry barrier for new characters or adventurers, will be continuously alleviated by adding helpful content, starting with Elvenmere, which will be updated this time. Please support this as well.
* And, as previously mentioned, the new advanced dungeon, Meister's Lab, will be introduced through the first server in early May.
+ We know that new dungeons, cool patterns, attractive monsters, and rewards or equipment that can be obtained are always a part of high expectations and interest, and we are doing our best to meet those expectations, especially this time at the max level. As adventurers received a lot of favorable reviews about the story through the expansion, we are working hard to create depth of fun in the story aspect as well.

* Lastly, I was thinking about giving something to give as a token of appreciation for the fact that so many adventurers love and enjoy DnF. I've seen a lot of comments about the cute SD mask avatar that I recently gave as an event reward.
+ So, I would like to proceed with the Spring Attendance Check event right away so that you can acquire the item once more. It was a decision I made hastily because I wanted to respond to the voice you give me, even a little, but I hope you like it.

* I think it is really important to give you trust by showing how the parts I talked about in the developer notes, DnF Festival, or DnF ON are implemented step by step.
+ Until now, except for some content that is judged to be better to be provided at a less burdensome time by adjusting the schedule, such as a creature reorganization, everyone is doing their best to keep the roadmap I mentioned earlier.
+ We will do our best to repay you with higher quality by not repeating the disappointing parts in this max level expansion update, and continuing the popular parts.
+ We would like to once again thank all adventurers who are always with us. Please give a lot of love and support to our development team, who are working hard day and night to make the most prosperous year even before the max level expansion.

* This is a small attendance event to celebrate Children's Day in Korea, which takes place on May 5th. Here you log in for 30 mins each day to get rewards. You will get cumulative rewards as well.

Rewards* Daily Special Experiment Box: When opened, you can get 3  mini repair kits (single slot) and one of the following components according to their rate.
+ 50 Ryan Cores,  25 Harmony Crystals, or  10 Golden Beryl

* Children's Day Special Experiment Box: Log in during children's day (May 5th~6th) to get this. It contains the following:
+ Character Shrinker Box: Reduce character size while in town for 30 sec (60 sec cooldown)
+ Blue Rose Weapon Avatar
+ Blue Rose Hat Avatar
+ Random Mythic Pot
+ 2 Mythic Reroll Token

* You will also get cumulative rewards based on how many daily reward you claimed:
+ 3 times:  3 disposable level growth option tickets. You can proceed with equipment option growth without using Golden Beryl, Power Essence, and Gold.
+ 6 times:  Gabriel Contract (7 days), probability of Gabriel's appearance, the type, and number of sales increases so he can scam you some more

* These small improvements are added to Encyclopedia, Inventory Safe, Optional Growth, Ootion Transfer, Level Transfer System, along with revealing success rate for Card Upgrade System.
Encyclopedia* Added a function to display where the equipment is located.
* This function will be displayed only when the "Turn on Show Equipment" option is enabled in the game settings.
* Regardless of the material, if the item is the same, it will be displayed as the equipment you have.
* Depending on the location of the equipment you have, it will be displayed as follows, and if the same item is located in multiple locations, only one icon with higher priority will be displayed.



| Item Location | Icon | Priority |
| Wearing |  | 1st |
| In Inventory |  | 2nd |
| In Safe |  | 3rd |

  
Inventory Safe* Safe  Ⅱ (24 slots) is added. Applies to both existing and new characters. Safe Ⅰ 24 slots, Safe Ⅱ 24 slots, a total of 48 slots are provided as standard.
* The name of the existing "My Safe" will be changed to "Safe Ⅰ ".
* Safe Ⅱ can be expanded when the expansion stage of Safe Ⅰ is greater than Splendid Magtonium Safe (200 slots). Safe Ⅱ can be expanded up to 256 slots.
* The name of the character vault upgrade kit has been changed from "Character Safe Upgrade Kit" to "Safe I Upgrade Kit". Other vault expansion upgrade kits will be renamed as well (e.g. Silver, Gold).

Optional Growth, Ootion Transfer, Level Transfer System* Each system is now color coded. Option growth is Green, Option transfer is Yellow, Level Transfer is Blue.

* Gear with modification (e.g. reinforcement/amplification/refining/enchantment) is improved so that it can be used as material equipment. All enchantments in the material equipment will be destroyed.
* Alert messages for specific situations during option growth, transfer, and level transfer will be strengthened (e.g. when using equipment with enchantments as a material)

Card Upgrade System* Card upgrade success rate is displayed inside the system UI.

ReferencesKDnF Patch Note

* Getting this set is one of the most fundamental step you can take to vastly increase your damage.
* Here I simply explain this process so you can farm a set for yourself.
What's Buff Swap* This function unlocks at level 70. You can click on the "Buff Enhancement" book, then register your swap gear.

* How Does It Work?
+ The swap set basically increases the level and stat of your buff skill (e.g. ).
+ Back in the old days before this UI, you would have to equip the swap set, go into dungeon, cast you buff skill, then swap back into your damage gears. This Swap UI will do all that work for you.

What Goes In the Swap UI?---Equipment---* The first pieces to the swap set that anyone can get are the equipment slots. These items are highlighted below and come from Operation: Hope dungeon.
* This dungeon can be found in Closed Area in Harlem. Each character can enter it 3 times per week.

* While running the dungeon, be sure to follow the path with the quest scroll (circled in red) because it will lead to you the area needed to complete the internal quest. By doing so you can get more Abyss Fragment  at the end.

* can be used to buy swap set from NPC Ceberin. This is where you buy your weapon, armor, accessory, and special equipment pieces.

* Weapon:
+ There are 2 versions: regular and "S" version. The regular can be upgraded to the "S" version, which give more stat. In the example below, the "S" version is about 4% stronger.

+ To upgrade the weapon, you can buy the recipe from Ceberin. This recipe gives you an RNG chance of upgrading to "S". Cost 20  and 100  for each roll. Make sure you buy the correct recipe that matches your weapon type.

+ Each fail attempt will give one  . Basically 10  will give guarantee "S" weapon using Conversion Scroll .

* Armor and Accessory: Generic boxes   for all classes. When you open these boxes, the system will automatically select your class. So you don't have to worry about selecting the right one.
* Special Equipment: This part is a bit more tricky. Here you have 3 options to pick  Encroached set,  Distorted set, and  Warped set. Encroached gives you +3 level but offer minimal stat, whereas Warped gives +1 level but offer maximal stat. And Distorted is kind of in the middle. So you need to pick which one based on your budget.
+ gives the most skill level but doesn't give any skill stat. You save money not to buy other skill level such as platinum emblem, title.
+ gives the least skill level but most skill stat. You will need spend money on buying skill title and platinum emblem.
+ What I recommend for new players is to pick Encroached set. Then as you get more in the end game and start to min-max, you can switch to Warped set.

---Title---* Titles come in many shapes and sizes. Most buff swap titles add levels to your skill through 2 ways. (1) It straight adds level to the skill itself. (2) It adds level from the level range.
* In the example below, this is a swap title for Mistress, whose buff skill is called "Seven Deadly Sins". Because this buff skill is a level 20 skill, when a Mistress uses this title, it will add 3 levels to her buff skill.

* These swap titles usually come from seasonal packages and can cost quite a bit a gold to obtain, especially the price different between +2 and +3 title. Depends on the class, +2 title can cost you about 30 million gold, and +3 title can cost up to 70~80 million.
* One of the beginner package from the webstore comes with a +2 title that may worth your money. If you don't want to spend cash, I would recommend waiting for the price on the auction hall to drop and maybe you get lucky and get something cheap within your budget.

---Avatar---* This is where you can add up to 4 levels to the buff skill. 1 level from Rare Top, Rare Bottom, and Aura, with 1 level from the "Ability" section from Top avatar. Platinum emblems can be found in the Auction Hall and through Lost Treasure as Selective Platinum Emblem Box.
* Top & Bottom Avatars: Rare avatars (clone or non-clone) have slot to add platinum emblem onto them.
* Aura: Only specific auras have plat emblem slot. So watch out for sales and packages from Neople.
* In the example below, each plat emblem add 1 level to Male Ranger buff skill, Death by Revolver. With +1 from the "Ability" option in the Rare Top avatar, this set will give +4 level.

---Creature---* Very similar to title, Pet can add level either straight up or through a skill level range. In the example below, Petite Ms. Black (left) adds level though level 15-35 range, whereas Petite Raven (right) adds level directly to the skill.

* Again just like title, these pets often from from seasonal packages and sales, so watch out for them when they come around.

Example Using My Male Ranger
* NOTE: The MAX level you can add for non-sader classes is +10.
* Equipment:   for armor and accessory,  warped set for special equipment,  "S" revolver.
* Title: +2 from "Awakened Ones All-in-One Package" from the webstore.
* Avatar: Rare top, bottom avatar with aura    and 3 plat emblems .
* Creature:  Petit Raven.
* Total: +10 skill levels

Do I Really Need Swap Set?* YES YES YES. Below is an example of 20-sec sandbag WITH swap set (57 Bil) vs. NO swap set (41 Bil).

Exception to the Guide* Sader classes (Crusader, Seraph, Enchantress) are the exception. They don't use "Operation: Hope" gear and their max level to buff skill is +30 instead.
* Generally speaking
+ Swap gear is the one that give most stat and level to buff skill (e.g.   )
+ Actual gear is the one that give most level to 1st Awakening skill (e.g.   )

+ DFO Content Creator - Season 1
- The qualifications seem a bit too much for those that do this as a hobby or part-time.
- You pretty much will need to dedicate a significant amount of time to be in this program, which not many players can afford.
- Streamer: 20+ concurrent viewers is not easy to do if you just getting started on twitch. It usually takes months to get 20+ viewers, which is not enough time since this application period ends on September 1.
- Video Creator: 10 mins doesn't seem like a lot. But it takes time to edit a 10 mins video if you really dedicated on your content. You can just cut a 10 mins clip from your 3 hours stream and call it a day. That's just lazy content creation. If you have a full time job, it would be hard to dedicate time to make a high quality production. And when you put on a deadline, the quality will definitely plummeted.

- Extremely good price for what you can get

- +2 swap title and petite pet definitely worth the $22.

* In the last analysis, the author compared Ghent Palace vs. Land of Memories / Bottomless Tunnel vs. Black Shrine. Black Shrine there was clearly the winner overall.
* In this analysis, let's see how 400 runs of Black Shrine compare to 400 runs of Stormy Route.

Procedure* The author had ran out of NeoPremium, with 156 fp plus pot, the author ran 20 runs on each character  for easy calculation.
* Repair cost was not included for the sake of consistency.

* Gabriel Shop
+ The author only bought items that are valuable for this analysis such as
+ were not bought due to their minimal affect on this calculation.

* No Purple Card Flip
+ The author started doing no card flip midway through the analysis, so keep it that way for consistency.
+ Realistically would be better if this card flip is included.

Terminology* Total Raw Gold - sum of  from dungeon drops, card flips, selling white/blue/purple drops, and tradeable items such as  , excluding card drops.
* Time's Guide Stone Gold - Theoretical cost of  in term of character progression.
* One Free Hell - One Hell run after about 18 dungeon runs. It's the theoretical cost of 18  in term of character progression.
* Total Progression Gold - The sum of all theoretical and raw golds (i.e. Total Raw Gold + Time's Guide Stone Gold + One Free Hell)
* Jackpot - An occurrence of "Capricious Demon Prion" aka this guy:

  
The Data  
  
  
Discussion* Black Shrine
+ Much easier to clear. 30 billion damage should have no problem clearing comfortably.
+ Has chance of epic drop.
+ Has chance of great card drop such as Ash Rosenberg , Medium Airag , Kazan-possessed Rosenberg .
+ Drop Time Crystal, which is one of the main source of income.

* Stormy Route
+ Much harder to clear comfortably.
+ A lot of the bosses in this place can one shot you easily if don't one shot them first. There are also lots of annoying gimmicks suck as stun, freeze, I-frame. For example:
- Evanescent Ferman : Stun and I-frame
- Hammer King Borodin : Stun and I-frame
- Guardian Rime : Close to 100 % freeze with ice spike
- Hyper Mecha Tau : Stun and I-frame
- Giant Nugol : Bleeding
- Pandemos Floo : I-frame

+ 35-40 billion damage is the cutline to clear.
- 45-50 billion damage is recommended.
- 30 billion damage is really pushing it, brave yourself to burn life tokens with that damage.

* In Term of Raw Gold
+ Stormy Route wins per average run.
+ But you're looking at a 11.6% difference here.
+ But keep in mind this is pre-Sirocco raid. Due to entry ticket costing 30 , the price may increase when the raid comes out.

* In Term of Progression Gold
+ Stormy Route wins with jackpots. Without jackpots, both dungeons are not far apart.
+ You're looking at a higher gap of 36.3% here.

* In Term of Efficiency
+ The main argument here is that Black Shrine has epic drop as an advantage, but at the same time Stormy Route also drop more , which translate to additional Guide of Wisdom runs, which require FP to run.
+ Since level 100 epics are the main point of progression. The author will use epic chance per FP ratio as comparison
+ If the epic drop chance is the same in 2+2, regular Black Shrine runs, and Guide of Wisdom (BIG FAT IF), we all know it's not true, but for the shake of the analysis, the author will designate each epic chance as
+ to FP ratio
- Black Shrine
* Since Black Shrine builds up Guide of Wisdom gauge, 400 runs would give you 420 . Also technically speaking, the first 2 runs give double , one from boss kill, one from card flip. So 400 runs will give 460
* 400 runs yields 481  and 116  ➤ 33
* 22,679,742 raw  ➤ 240  ➤ 13
* Total: 506
* Total FP: 3,200 from 400 runs + 264 from 33  + 104 from 13  = 3550
* Grand Final: 0.14  per FP

- Stormy Route
* 400 runs yields 1070  and zero  ➤ 59
* 19,238,588 raw  ➤ 203  ➤ 11
* Total: 70
* Total FP: 3,200 from 400 runs + 472 from 59  + 88 from 11  = 3,760
* Grand Final: 0.02  per FP

+ Black Shrine wins by the long shot with x7.66  more efficient.

Recommendation* If all you care about is raw gold, farm Stormy. Even though the raw gold is not far apart, with Sirocco raid coming soon, the price of  will likely to increase. Stormy will give you more bang for your buck.
* If all you care about is progression, still farm Stormy. It give you more progression in term of gold. HOWEVER, if you factor in RNG, Black Shrine is way more efficient in term of  to FP ratio.

TL;DR* Black Shrine is easier to clear, yield similar raw gold with great progression efficiency.
* Stormy Route is harder to clear, yield slightly higher raw gold, higher gold progression but with terrible efficiency.

* Ever looked into the 100 epic equipment and got overwhelmed?
* Which one is the best in slot for my character?
* What would be the best bang for your buck in term of damage increase?
* This post provides general guidelines to help you with your gearing and spending decision in the end game.

Equation For Basic Skill Damage* This Reddit page explains clearly how damage is calculated but let's look at it in a simplest way possible.
* This was was last edited 3 years ago, so it may be outdated, but this is the only equation the author can find.

If you get a critical hit, just take this and ✖1.5* Yellow
+ 
+ Depends on if your character is percent damage or fixed damage. You can read more about how to know which one your character is in this post.
+ The higher the Stat, the higher the damage output.
* Blue.
+ 
+ The higher the Elemental Damage, the higher the damage output.

* Green
+ 
+ In the past
- Only Weapon can give Piercing Attack
- Fixed damage classes have no piercing component.

+ For 100 cap, piercing attack is not really a thing anymore. It's all raw physical/magical attack now due to monster defense is practically gone.
- Therefore this green part may not be up-to-date, but the basic components of stat and elemental damage are still there.
- For now, it's the blue line "+11: Physical Atk. + 604" through weapon reinforcement or "+4: Independent Atk. + 119" through weapon refinement (examples below).

          * Other modifiers
+ They usually come as
- "All Atk. +XXX%"
- "All  Classes Level XXX +XXX"
- "Skill Atk. +XXX%"
- "STR/INT +XXX%"
- "Physical/Magical?Independent Atk. +XXX%"
- "Additional Attack Damage +XXX%"
- And more

+ It can get complicated to see which one is the best. TL;DR: the more of these modifier you stack, the more damage you can output.
Best Bang For Your Buck* Looking at the equation, you can clearly tell which component most contribute to damage output and which component doesn't do as much.
* This part is intended for new and returning players.
* Rank 1: Critical Cap
+ A critical hit multiply the damage by 150%, this is best investment.
+ You can read how to hit crit cap in this post.
+ This Spreadsheet will tell you how much critical your class would need in town.

* Rank 2: Swap Set
+ Including title, pet, avatars.
+ Getting a complete swap set is not cheap, but it's still one of the cheapest option and no other content can replace your swap set in a near future.
+ Operation hope was released in June 2019, the last swap set was basically when DFOG came back in 2015.
+ You can read more on Swap Set here.

* Rank 3: Weapon Reinforcement/Refinement
+ On the damage equation, these two do NOT have denominator.
+ I would work on this first before Stat and Elemental Damage.
+ Get your weapon at least +10 Reinforcement or +6 Refinement before moving to rank 4.
+ Weapon reinforce/refine has RNG, but +10 reinforcement typically take about 10-15 million gold (of course depends on your luck)

* Rank 4: Avatar & Emblems
+ Advance clone avatar and rare emblems should be enough.
+ Advance Avatar Box does for about 9 million, rare red/green emblems are about 1 million each
+ Later can transition to rare avatar and unique emblems.

* Rank 5: Enchants
+ This is where you're adding Stat, Physical/Magical/Independent Atk., Elemental Damage to your gears.
+ Use this page for recommended enchant for each slot.
+ Beside the BIS card such as Red Ghost Soryun , Prophet Ezra , etc., 2nd best cards are becoming more affordable.
+ NOTE: Cheap enchant cards such as Officer Mercel , Hound Cyrus , Anje Wane  would probably give you more damage in term of best bang for your buck comparing to Rank 3 and 4.
- It's completely fine to get those first.
- But when it comes to BIS cards such as  and , the author can't recommend spending 20 million gold on a single un-upgraded .
- It's hard to justify spending 20 million gold to get 15 to 26 elemental damage (  → ) when a new player can potentially get a +10 weapon plus an advance avatar box.

* Rank 6: Pet, Title, Aura
+ This rank last because Neople almost always releasing better version in form of avatar packages, sales, lost treasure, etc.
+ Look for additional modifiers such as "All Atk.", "Bonus Damage", Elemental Damage, etc.

The Start of Min-Maxing* There's a great discussion on this topic on this Reddit Post.

* The purpose of this page is to provide everything about the Talisman system.
* General information about Pandemonium War patch can be found in this update page.
* Brave yourself because this is one of the most RNG system in DFO. The worst part is this system is required for endgame contents. Don't expect to get accepted into party if you don't have any talisman.

How Does This System Work?* This system is designed to customize and strengthen your skills.
* You can open this system through the "Talisman" tab in the inventory window.

* Upon opening the "Talisman" tab, you will see Picture 1. The green squares are for Talismans. The blue circles are for Runes. Clicking the Book (circled in red) will open up Picture 2 and 3. Picture 2 is the list of the current 5 talismans. Picture 3 will give all available runes.

* So this system consists of 2 parts: Talismans and Runes.
* Talismans:
+ Currently with the Pandemonium War patch, there are 5 talismans for each class, and you can only equip 2 talismans. Korea added a 3rd slot with the "Black Church" update.
+ Each talisman comes in 2 rarity: "Rare" and "Unique". You can read their descriptions and demonstrations in the section at the bottom.
+ Each talisman also has 3 rune slots, and the colors are randomized between 5 colors. More info in the runes section below.
+ Generally speaking, the best talisman would consist of Red, Blue, and Violet rune slots. This is where the RNG is worst. The talisman itself is RNG to get, and the rune slots are also RNG.

* Runes:
+ Looking at Picture 3, there are multiple skills that has runes.
+ Each skill has 5 possible colors, and each color has 3 rarity (Common, Uncommon, Rare):
- Violet runes increase attack damage
- Green runes reduce attack damage and also reduce cooldown
- Blue runes only reduce cooldown
- Yellow runes only increase range
- Red runes increase attack damage and also increase cooldown

+ Reading through each runes, the 3 most desired colors are  for each talisman.

* Example using male ranger:
+ Two popular talismans for male ranger are Acceleration Revolver and Double Grinder.
+ In Picture 4, you can see that the colors for those 2 talismans are not best-in-slot. The author has Blue Red for top talisman and Violet Red for bottom talisman.
+ Upon equipping the appropriate color runes, the talismans will light up (Picture 5) and activate all their effects.
+ The author picked  runes because it's one of the highest DPS skill. Even then you could see that the author still has works to do because both Red runes and one Green rune are still at Uncommon rarity.

  
How to Acquire Talismans and Runes* Talismans and runes are drops from Pandemonium War dungeon.
* You need to be level 95 to access this content through its specific channel.

  
* There are plenty of guides out there explaining the mechanics. You can learn more through this dungeon guide page.
* Of course this dungeon drops talismans and runes among all kinds. So with the unwanted drops, you can use them for crafting other talismans and runes through "Monica of the Library" NPC.
* The "My Class" option will only use talismans and runes specifically for your class. The author recommend only use this option if you have multiple duplicates or if you know for sure you don't use any of them.

* Other ways to get talismans and runes include buying from mileage shop and explorer shop using Glory Crystals.

  
  
The Terrible RNG System  
* To give you an idea of the RNG with this system, we need to see how big the drop pool is.
* For Talismans:
+ With 61 sub-classes and 5 talismans for each sub-class, there are 305 possible drops.
+ Each talisman has 2 rarities, drop pool increased to 610.
+ So the chance of drop for the desired Unique talisman from clearing Pandemonium War dungeon is 0.16%. AND that doesn't account for the combination of rune colors. 5 colors give 10 possible combination of 3-colors.
+ Therefore, the chance of the desired drop is 0.16%. And when that drops, the chance of the best-in-slot color combination is 10%.

* For Runes:
+ Each class has a set number of skill that have runes. Ranging from 9 skills (Female Nen) to 17 skills (Summoner).
+ Using Female Nen as example: 9 skills, with 5 color runes, with 3 rune rarities give 135 drop pool.
+ Even if we assume all 61 sub-classes have 9 skills, that still give a pool of 8,235 possible drops.
+ Therefore, without compounding, the chance of each desired rune is 0.012%.
+ Although clearing Challenge mode will drop about 25 runes, so that increase your chances a bit.

Descriptions and Demonstrations for Each Talisman* You can access these information along with their popularity ranking through this Talisman Archive page.

* Have you ever looked at the Challenge tab in the explorer club and wonder what does the "Adventure Motion Aura Avatar" look like?

* To be able to get it you will need to get all subclasses of that class to Savior training level.
* This post will give you a rough estimate of how long it would take to get there.

Procedure and Data* With the update of level 100 cap (Season 6 Act 1: Ascension), the character training level cap has been changed.

* We know that each training level requires a set amount of EXP, and they increase exponentially.
* Since there is no one in the DFOG server have reached Savior training, it's impossible to know how much EXP is needed. However, the author does have the EXP needed for lower levels and was able to find out a rough estimate of the EXP scaling.
* Data sample:
+ Challenger level 14 requires 1,731,676 EXP
+ Challenger level 15 requires 1,800,943 EXP
+ Challenger level 16 requires 1,872,981 EXP
+ Challenger level 17 requires 1,947,900 EXP
+ Challenger level 18 requires 2,025,816 EXP
+ Challenger level 19 requires 2,106,849 EXP
Result and Discussion* The author divided the EXP of one level to the previous level, the ratio turned out to be 1.04, which mean with each level, the EXP required will increase by 1.04
* The author took this ratio and scale it up all the way to Savior level and got an estimate of the total EXP needed, however, there were some roadblocks. When comparing theoretical and actual EXP from the author's alts, the difference turned to be off by a few levels. For example:
+ Expert level 33 should require 22,238,447 EXP, but the exact amount is 24,930,662 EXP (a.k.a. theoretical EXP required for level 36)
+ Leader level 40 should require 171,196,329 EXP, but the exact amount is 224,182,043 EXP (a.k.a. theoretical EXP required for level 48)
+ Guru level 16 should require 424,826,869 EXP, but the exact amount is 491,210,463 EXP (a.k.a theoretical EXP required for level 20)

* When scaling up to Savior training and add them all together, the estimated cumulative EXP required turned out to be 2,485,533,761,335 EXP (that's 2.5 TRILLION). And with the roadblocks explained above, we know that we're at least underestimating this number. The author wouldn't be surprise if it turn out to be 3 trillion.

How Long Would it Take?* After running various level 100 cap dungeons, which require only 8 FP each, the author concluded that Ghent Palace Expert full clear yield the highest amount which is about 10.5 million EXP, not including EXP from each monster kill. Disaster Sector 3 also gives good EXP, but the it takes way too many FP to clear.
* Assuming you have 156 FP bar, only 19 Ghent dungeons can be cleared in a day without using FP pot, which translate to roughly 34 years of clearing 19 Ghent Palace EVERYDAY.
* AGAIN, between roadblocks and not including EXP from monster kills, we probably will still underestimate the result. How long does it actually take? looks like we'll never know.

TL;DR* If you want to finish all the challenges from the character tab, you will need to get all 61 subclasses to Savior training, which will require you to clear 19 Ghent Palace Expert full runs on each of the 61 characters EVERYDAY for at least 34 years. If it takes 30 seconds to clear the dungeon, that's about 10 hours of playtime everyday for 34 years.
* GOOD LUCK, HAVE FUN!!!
