General Information* This is a 16-player raid, consists of 4 teams of 4 (Red, Orange, Yellow, Green)
* The raid has 2 phases: "Chase Operation" and "Subjugation Operation" with time limit of 40 minutes each.
* Think of this raid as the movie Inception, but you're moving backward. Instead of going deeper into the subconscious mind, you start from the deepest level and make your way up to "Reality" (aka defeat Sirocco)
* New Special Function: Trajectory of Nothingness (aka Bullet Time)
+ Can only be used by party leaders
+ When activate will slow down all enemies and their attacks.

  


Raid Layout* Phase 1: Sirocco Chase Operation-Lower Sky Castle
+ You chase Sirocco from the bottom of the Sky Castle
+ There are 4 floors:
- Gateway of Laws
- Gateway of Intelligence
- Gateway of Trials I
- Gateway of Trials II

* Phase 2: Sirocco Subjugation Operation-Hall of Immateriality
+ Think of it like reverse Inception
+ There are 3 levels
- Hall of Immateriality - The 3rd Plane
- Hall of Immateriality - The 2nd Plane
- Hall of Immateriality - The 1st Plane



⮜Phase 1⮞

🚪Floor 1/4: Gateway of Laws🚪* 4 Destroyed Gate dungeons will spawn

* The Gatekepper is the boss of the dungeons.
* At each boss room, he will absorb a specific amount of souls, ranging from 1 to 4.
* Your job is to communicate with each other and clear the dungeon in that specific order (1-2-3-4).
* Upon clearing all 4 dungeons, the teams will advance to the next gateway



🚪Floor 2/4: Gateway to Intelligence🚪* 4 dungeons will spawn.
* One party has to be actively fighting the boss in Dawn of Dreams before the other 3 dungeons are unlocked.
* Upon clearing Dawn of Dreams, the teams will advance to the next gateway.
* As for the other three dungeons, clear or not clear each dungeon will inflict different effects.
* Border of Phantasm:
+ If you don't clear:
- It spawns Camouflage in Dawn of Dreams
- It spawns Tornado in Night of Terrors
- It reduces player's defense in Day of Return by 25% (up to 100%)

+ If you clear:
- Player damage in Dawn of Dreams increase by 100%
- All gimmicks from Border of Phantasm will reset

* Night of Terrors:
+ If you don't clear:
- Attack damage of Dawn of Dreams boss (Haniere of Enchantment) increase by 10% (up to 50%).
- Decrease player's hit rate in Border of Phantasm.

+ If you clear:
- All gimmicks caused by this dungeon will reset and re-spawned after 2 minutes.

* Day of Return:
+ If you don't clear periodically:
- Spawn random explosion in Dawn of Dreams
- Spawn Camouflage in Border of Phantasm

+ If you clear:
- All gimmicks caused by this dungeon will reset and re-spawned after 2 minutes

* So think of the three dungeons as Anton's hatcheries, clearing them will stop annoying gimmicks and mob spawns in Black Volcano.
* If you retreat from Dawn of Dreams, all 4 dungeons will re-spawn.



🚪Floor 3/4: Gateway of Trials I🚪* 4 dungeons (2 mirrors) will spawn.
* Fragments of Memories and Memories of Fragments share the same patterns.
* Upon clearing Fragment of Memory and Memory of Fragment, the teams will advance to the next gateway.
* If you fail to clear Mirror of Trials within the time limit, the floor will reset. If clear on time, both dungeons will re-spawn after 90 seconds.



🚪Floor 4/4: Gateway to Suffering II🚪+ 6 dungeons will spawn. 2 gateways, 2 mirrors, 2 castles connected to each gateway.
+ Both light and dark Immaterial Gateways share similar mechanics.
+ Both Castles share similar mechanics.
+ One party has to be actively fighting the boss in Immaterial Gateway before the connected Castle can be unlocked.
+ Upon clearing both Immaterial Gateways, the teams will complete phase 1 and advance to phase 2.
+ Each Castle clear will increase damage in Immaterial Gateways by 40% (up to 200%)
+ Same as floor 3, if you don't clear Mirror of Trials within time limit, the floor will reset.


⮜Phase 2⮞

🧠Hall of Immateriality - The 3rd Plane🧠* 4 Hall of Subconsciousness will spawn. The boss is Sirocco's Nightmare and is the same for all dungeons.
* This level is simple, clearing all 4 will advance the teams to the next stage.
  
🧠

Hall of Immateriality - The 2nd Plane🧠  
* 4 dungeons will spawn: 2 Altered Halls of Subconsciousness (Boss: Old Hag In a Dream) and 2 Halls of Consciousness (Boss: Sirocco's Illusion).
* Upon clearing both Halls of Consciousness, the teams will advance to the next level.
* If Altered Halls of Subconsciousness is cleared, the boss in the connected Halls of Consciousness will enter groggy phase.
  


🧠Hall of Immateriality - The 1st Plane🧠* 6 dungeons will spawn:
+ Inner layer: 3 True Consciousness
+ Outer layer: 3 True Subconscious

* In this phase, you fight Sirocco in 3 different forms through 3 Consciousness, and the damage of three parties are cumulative. Bringing the health to zero will clear the raid.
* As you're fighting the 3 forms, you will see Sirocco's health showing multiple colors. They are indication of damage for each colored party. As an example below, yellow party is the one doing the most damage.

  
The Inner Layer* Three forms of Sirocco: Snake, Queen, and Leste
+ After each groggy phase, the location of each form is randomized between 3 Consciousness.
+ However, the clockwise order of 3 forms is always the same: Snake > Leste > Queen
+ So even though it's randomized, if you know the location of one, you know the location of all three. Even if the Consciousness rotate, the order still remain same. Credit to kdnf forum.


The Outer Layer* The purpose of 3 True Subconscious outer layer dungeons are to set up groggy phase.
* True Subconscious is further spit into three type: Denial, Oppression, and Oblivion.
+ Denial (Boss: Sirocco's Nightmare)
- If not cleared within the time limit, phase 2 will reset back to 3rd layer.
- Once clear, the dungeon will re-spawn after 2 mins 30 secs.

+ Oppression (Boss: Kain Assassin in the Fog)
- If cleared, the three Consciousness will rotate clockwise and is used to set up Resonance.

+ Oblivion (Boss: Roxy)
- If clear at the state of Resonance, it will activate 25-sec groggy phase for Sirocco
- Think of this dungeon as Observatory dungeon in Prey-Isys raid.



How to Activate 25-sec Groggy Phase* This phase can only be activated when the alignment of one Consciousness and Subconscious: Oblivion are at Resonance phase. Once it's in place, clear Subconscious: Oblivion will active groggy.
* There are 2 ways to know the Resonance phase is in place:
+ Pop-up video plays in the corner.

+ The color changes in the map between Consciousness and Subconscious.

* So keep clearing Subconscious: Oppression to rotate Consciousness until the correct one line up. Once activated, all 3 Consciousness merged and groggy phase start.
* In simple terms, keep clearing Kain dungeon until things line up, then send Roxy.
  
What Happen After the Groggy Phase* Very similar to Prey-Isys Raid, after the 25-sec, all parties in TC will be kicked out and have to wait 150 seconds to re-enter.
* Basically you repeat the Resonance process until Sirocco is defeated.



Dungeon MechanicsPhase 1Phase 2  


Raid Cutline & Recommended Gears* Since DFOG doesn't have API website, there's no way anyone can tell how much damage you can do in a 25-sec rotation just by looking at your gear.
* Thus what you wear will determine if you're a strong applicant in the eye of a raid leader.

For DPS classes  
* Weapon
+ Level 100 epic weapon with +12 reinforcement/+8 refinement.
+ Sirocco Primal Dream weapon is fine too, make sure it's +5 modification.

* Gears
+ At least 5/3/3 sets or mixed 3/3/3/2 level 100 epic sets.
+ 3/2/2/2 sets is really pushing it, you will have hard time getting in.
+ Note that this is before any epic reworks so some sets will make you a stronger applicant than others.

* Swap Set
+ Preferably +10 skill, people don't seem to care much if it's Wrapped set or not.
+ +9 skill is pushing the line here.

* Enchants
+ 2nd tier enchants should be plenty.
+ Decent critical chances, 100% is preferred in dungeon but it's really depends on the class as well.
+ Weapon: +12-15 elemental damage.
+ Top/Bottom: Physical/Magic/Independent ATK 45 ~ 50 with or without Strength/Intelligence +20
+ Accessory: +25 ~ 30 elemental damage. Some people pass for +18-23 if you have other part to compensate such as amplification.
+ Magic stone: +18 elemental damage
+ Sub Equipment: +42 PMI
+ Earring: +100 ~ 125 All stat
+ Pet/Title/Aura: At least some sort of modification (e.g. Attack damage, Elemental damage)
+ Talisman: Both unique talisman. No one is gonna check if what you have is BIS for that class. As for runes, doesn't really matter that much.
+ Avatar/Emblem: Rare set with at least rare emblem that add Strength/Intelligence.
+ Insignia: Appropriate one your damage type with rare gems adding at least elemental damage.

For Synergy Classes* For the most part, these classes has a but of lower cutline but very similar to DPS in term of gears and enchants.
* Your weapon doesn't really need to be +12, +11 should be okay.

For Sader/Buffer Classes* Similar to DPS classes, 5/3/3 or 3/2/2/2 set up with appropriate enchants.
* Seraph/Enchantress use Int enchants and Male Crusader uses Vit/Spit enchants.
* Level 100 epic cross.
* Pet/Title: At least 1 of each type that add level to 1A and buff skill.



Raid Strategy* Note:
+ Green and Yellow need to come back and clear mirrors as needed so phase 1 doesn't reset.
+ Green and Yellow continue to clear Castle to give Red and Orange damage buffs.

ReferencesKDNF Test Sever Note  
TLDR from Discord

* There have been rumors of a gold nerf in Stormy Route after the release of Sirocco raid.
* One of the first claim was in this reddit post, October 20, which is right after the release of the raid. However, through the Exstream reddit summary, Neople denied this claim.
* In this post, the author went back to run Stormy Route 401 times (1 extra time by accident) and compare the result to this previous blogpost (collected pre-Sirocco) to see if there are any differences.

Procedure* The author kept the procedure same as the previous post (20 runs on each characters, sells all dropped, no repair cost, etc.).
* On post-Sirocco data, character 18, the author accidentally ran 21 runs instead of 20 runs.
* The  column refers to the amount of golds dropped in dungeon plus gold flips at the end plus selling all drops (e.g. common, uncommon, rare, etc.)

The Data* For this analysis, the author will only show data for    .

  
Result & Discussion* Disclaimer: The author is not a statistician, and the test was performed under the author's best knowledge from an undergraduate stat class. Feel free to suggest a better test.
* From this website that list all the different tests, and since we're testing the difference between the drops from the same dungeon from 2 separate timeframes to test the nerf hypothesis, the author performed Two-Tailed Unequal Variance Independent T-tests.
* You can read about how to replicate this test in Excel here.
* With the P-value of 0.05, the author concludes that there are no differences in  (p>0.05) and  (p>0.05). However, there is a difference in  (p<0.05).
* The amount different in cumulative golds is about 8.6% (~3,900  per run) comparing the two averages.
* Worth noting that the definition of "nerf" differs between players. The original reddit post was referring to the gold flips at the end of dungeon. Some players claimed that the golds dropped from mobs were actually boosted to compensate for the decrease in gold flip. So since this data was collected under the intention of cumulative gold amounts, it may not reflects the "nerf" gold flips nor may it reflects the increase in golds dropped from mobs.
TL;DR* Do I get less golds from farming Stormy Route?
+ Statistically speaking: YES
+ Is it realistically significant? PROBABLY NO

* So as a new, return, or veteran player, which one should you farm?
* Here's the result of 1,000 dungeon runs.

Procedure* The author had ran out of NeoPremium, with 156 fp plus pot, the author ran 20 runs on each character in Ghent and Black Shrine for easy calculation.
* Repair cost was not included for the sake of consistency.

* Gabriel Shop
+ The author only bought items that are valuable for this analysis such as
+ were not bought due to their minimal affect on this calculation.

* No Purple Card Flip
+ The author started doing no card flip midway through the analysis, so keep it that way for consistency.
+ Realistically would be better if this card flip is included.

Terminology* Total Raw Gold - sum of  from dungeon drops, card flips, selling white/blue/purple drops, and tradeable items such as  , excluding card drops.
* Time's Guide Stone Gold - Theoretical cost of  in term of character progression.
* One Free Hell - One Hell run after about 18 dungeon runs. It's the theoretical cost of 18  in term of character progression.
* Total Progression Gold - The sum of all theoretical and raw golds (i.e. Total Raw Gold + Time's Guide Stone Gold + One Free Hell)
The Data  
  
  
  
Discussion* Ghent Palace
+ The  from dungeon and selling drops is okay, but combine with trading  for weapon then resell made up for the total raw gold. Refer to this previous Ghent analysis for more details.
+ Does not drop anything valuable beside chance of epics (i.e. no  )

* Land of Memories/Bottomless Tunnel
+ Worse raw gold out of the three.
+ Can argue that the analysis is only 10 runs vs. 20 runs like the others. But when you theoretically double up the number, it's still the worst.
+ Does not drop anything valuable beside chance of epics and  (i.e. no  ). The  from the data is bought from Gabriel.
+ Only worth running for chance of epics and  for your weekly card box  and gearing up with legendary gear.

* Black Shrine
+ Best raw gold.
+ Can drop epics  and , which are your main source of tradable income.
+ Can also drop great monster cards such as Ash Rosenberg , Medium Airag , Kazan-possessed Rosenberg .
+ Downside is will need at least full legendary set with a mix of some epics to clear comfortably.

* In Term of Raw Gold
+ Black Shrine ➤ Ghent Palace ➤ Land of Memories/Bottomless Tunnel (20 runs).

* In Term of Total Progression
+ Black Shrine ➤ Ghent Palace ﹦Land of Memories/Bottomless Tunnel (20 runs)
- When doubling up the number and include One Free Hell, Ghent Palace and Land of Memories/Bottomless Tunnel are not far apart.

Recommendation* New/returning players with no gears
+ Farm Ghent Palace.
+ Expert mode is still easy to do with Unique Gears.
+ Raw gold is still not worth if this your main farming place.
+ Best to farm other dungeons first (e.g. Anton, 2+2, Dawning Crevice, Assault Mode) then use the rest of FP for Ghent Palace.

* Tayberr Graduate
+ Farm Land of Memories/Bottomless Tunnel 5+5 runs for  to gear yourself up.
+ Do other dailies (e.g. Anton, 2+2, Dawning Crevice, Assault Mode) then then use the rest of FP for Ghent Palace.

* Prey/Fiend War Graduate/Legendary with mix epics
+ Straight farming Black Shrine after doing your 2+2.

Now the Only Place Worth Comparing to is Stormy RouteBut that's a Post for Another Day

* DFO is a game full of daily and weekly homework and not everyone will have the time.
* In this post is the outline of how much gold can you farm casually with just one character everyday, which is relatable for players that don't have much time to just sit and farm all day.
* This post is inspired by this YouTube series episode 15, a series where this Korean player goal is to make a Sirocco Ready character without spending any real money and funnel only with two alts.

Character Set-Up* This data was collected on a weekend, where you get 176 Fatigue Points is stead of 156.
* The character used in this post is Female Nen. The whole process took about 35 mins with this gears. If you have the gear rewards from events, it may take up to an hour of playtime.

Step-By-Step Process

* The 1st Pit, you can clear the whole thing if you want, but at least clear the first few rooms for easy equip drops.
* This doesn't require any Fatigue Points and give some easy gold selling to NPC.
* Selling all gives ~67k.

* Basement of Pain & Black Shrine Expert (2+2), these are must clear dungeons as part of DFO daily homework.
* If lucky, you can some , anyway, selling all drops now bring gold to ~145k.

* Stormy Route, great place for gold farm with extra  on the side.
* Selling all drops EXCEPT for rare items now bring gold to ~870k.
* Note to leave 8 Fatigue Point at the end.
* Disaster Sector, great for farming , only require 8 Fatigue Point to enter.
* One clear of Level 3 Disaster Sector gives 27 .
* Here you're out of Fatigue Points, now buy one Fatigue Potion on the Auction hall to recover 30 Fatigue Points.
* Gold at this point down to ~796k.

* Back to Stormy Route then Disaster Sector, 30 Fatigue Points will gives 2 extra Stormy clears and 1 extra Disaster Sector level 3 clear.
* Total gain of 42  and 54 .
* Sold  on Auction Hall at about 8.3k each and sold  to NPC Pumpkin Ball.
* Gold now up ~1.5 million.

* Extra cash from Rare Items, the author put all rare items collected from Stormy Route on the auction hall, and the next day, 3 out of 5 items were sold, gaining an extra ~119k

  
Result and Discussion* Of course the drop rate of  along with rare items may varies. Also you can't guarantee to sell all these rare items on the Auction Hall. But at the end of one character farming on a weekend, you can expect to get about 1.5 million gold per day.
* On a weekday, however, since you only have 156 Fatigue Points, you're about 2 Stormies short as compared to playing on weekend. You can expect to get about 1.4 million gold depends on how many  drops on these 2 runs.
Recommendation

* The entire process took about 35 mins with this full epic gears. If this is one of your character, this process is great for gold farming for those that wants to get some dailies done and don't really have a lot of time playing. 1.5 million a day is about 10 million per week for just casual 35 mins of playing everyday.
* For those players that don't have this type of gears, Don't Ask. Double It! gives you great gears to start out. You may be able to clear 2+2 expert but to be honest, 2+2 normal probably won't make much of a different in your gold gain. As for Stormy Route, +12 Epic weapon will give you decent clear time, you may struggle here and there, but with patients and determination, you can still follow this process. It may take you about an hour though. If Stormy Route is too much, Ghent Palace is a great alternative.
* For those players that only have legendary and no epic weapon, you can still follow this whole process, but instead of Stormy Route, you can do Ghent Palace. Unfortunately, you would get less gold.

* With the release of this new dungeon, it can be hard to see if you want to spend your time farming it.
* Here I use the epic calculator to compare their sets to see if it would worth your time farming this new equipment.
Purpose of Dark Dimension DungeonsProvide way to upgrade level 100 legendary obtained using  from Land of Memories and Bottomless Tunnel dungeons.  
How to Upgrade Level 100 Legendary* Tier 1
+ Dimension Shock Armlet   to Dimension: Dimension Shock Armlet
+ Need 1,800  to buy
+ can be obtained in Traces of Dark Miscreation dungeon.
+ is the account-bound version of  and can be traded in at 1:1 ratio.

* Tier 2
+ Dimension: Dimension Shock Armlet  to Neo: Dimension Shock Armlet
+ Need recipe  from NPC Santorni for a RNG upgrade  to
+ Need 600  to buy ,  can be traded in using  at 20:1 ratio and dropped from Miscreation's Garden at 3  per floor.
+ can be further modified up to + 5 using NPC Kiri just like other Product of Wisdoms.

  
How Strong is Upgraded Legendary* The calculator used in the analysis here.
* The Final damage % mean "how much stronger you are compared to another of the same class."
* Regular  vs. Dimension  vs. Neo
+ 

* Neo  vs. +5 Neo
+ 
* Current Male Ranger gears (Aug. 6, 2020) vs. Pre-selected Level 100 Epics vs. +5 Neo
+ 
* Mix and Match
+ 

* Result
+ Neo Legendary is strong and pairs with low tier level 100 epic.
+ It's at least stronger than Elementalist's Accessory set.

  
Time Needed to Farm Each Neo Piece* Data from 40 runs of Traces of Dark Miscreation dungeon
+ 

* WARNING: running this dungeon will consume clear cube fragments from ALL 4 characters in the party
* Not include running Dark Miscreation's Garden
+ 156 FP per day will give you 19 runs. Let's round up to 20 runs using pot for easy calculation.
+ Using average 5.8  per run from data above, each day can get 116
+ So each Dimension  will takes 16 days to get.
+ Each Neo  will takes 104 days to get.
+ TOTAL: 104 days (3.5 months) per CHANCE of Neo  piece

* Include running Dark Miscreation's Garden
+ The dungeon only open for 10 minutes every 2 hours on Friday, Saturday, an Sunday.
+ Depend on how strong and how many floor can you clear in a 10 minutes window.
+ My full legendary Savior can clear up to the 5th floor, yielding 15  per dungeon opening.
+ With 156 FP, I can only enter 7 opening per day → 21 opening per week → 315  per week.
+ If I farm Traces of Dark Miscreation dungeon during the other 4 weekdays, that give additional 23  per week .
+ TOTAL: 1.7 week (~ twice per month) per CHANCE of Neo  Piece.

* Worth noting that if the DFOG community put in the effort to clear Miscreation's Garden, we can fill up the "Stop the Dark Miscreation" gauge and can get potential one  per week.

  
Where Does it Fit in the Progression* Tier 1 Dimension  should be able to clear 2+2 easy sub 2 minutes.
* +5 Tier 2 Neo  should be able to clear challenge modes comfortably.

  
Limitation to the Analysis* Low sample size: only include 40 runs, the average  per run may differ with higher sample size.
* Calculator: the author does not completely know what factors are used by the calculator to generate the comparison. The final result may different in sandbag test.

  
Recommendation* For those that want linear progression with no RNG
+ This is a good option to gear up for endgame.
+ However you will need to +5 all three Neo pieces to see a significant increase in damage, and the cost can be very high.
+ Don't expect to get accepted to Sirocco Raid with +0 Neo pieces.
+ Realistically, looking at cost vs. damage increase vs. farming time, the author can't recommend farming 3 neo pieces and +5 them. You're better off farming  from level 95 caps and run Guide of Wisdom.

* For those that like RNG
+ Skip this content and keep running 2+2 and Guide of Wisdom.

* In conclusion
+ Dark Dimension content does not worth the effort
+ If you have trouble clearing 2+2 dungeons in a reasonable time, you could farm the tier 1 dimension  pieces to help you with your RNG journey.

* Spirit Heaven was released on Nov. 19, 2019 along with Pandemonium Meeting update.
* This dungeon is solo only and doesn't consume any Fatigue Point.
* You can get reward once per day, and it resets daily.
* You must be level 95 or above to enter.
* This dungeon is accessible through Valley of the Fallen Souls.

  
Dungeon Layout* This is has a 25 rooms dungeon compacted in 5x5 layout with normal, named, and boss mobs randomized each day.
* Depends on the mob you kill, you will receive "Spirit Purge Points" which fill up the progress bar.
* 2 rooms in the map will be randomly assigned Cooldown buff that would reset your skill in case you needed it. These rooms are useful in Hard mode.

  
* Filling up the progress bar before the 2 minutes time will complete the dungeon.
* If you don't fill it up by the 2 minutes mark, your rewards will based on the rank you filled up to.
* Rank S, A, B, C requires 100, 65, 40, 20 Spirit Purge Points, respectively.

Oversoul Stack* Every time you kill a mob, you absorb its soul and turn into 1 stack.
* Each stack grants you buffs for a set amount of time and you can stack up to 3 oversoul.
* In dungeon, you will see your stacks on the middle left of the screen.

  
Rewards  
* You can search for the looks of these weapon skin under in-game DFOpedia.
* Type in "[Spirit]" under weapon category for results.

  
How to Make Weapon Skin* NPC Blacksmith Linus is the NPC you need to talk to.
* Open the "Weapon Shape Forge" under the "Replication" tab to get started.
* Select your weapon and click "Replicate" and you're done.
* NOTE: These weapons can be gender-locked, so make sure you select the appropriate one.

* IMPORTANT: The weapon used for skin will be destroyed afterward. Don't make a mistake like me and destroy +11 Prey weapon. RIP

Linus's Mold* In order to make the skin, you will need a mold to cast the shape.
* There are 2 types: Regular mold  and Steel Mold . Both are possible drops from Spirit Heaven at low chances.
* is account-bound. The weapon skin made from the mold is untradable and is bound to the character making the skin.
* is tradable. Unlike , the weapon skin made from this mold is tradable.
* Example 1: if you have the weapon on your Ranger, and you want to make that skin for your Monk, you will need to use .
* Example 2: You often see on Echo saying "Sell [XXX] shape, your mold". This means the buyer will provide . You give the seller , they use it to make the weapon skin, and since the skin is tradeable from the steel mold, they trade it back to you.
* Beside Spirit Heaven, you can also buy these molds from Cera shop.
  
How to Apply Weapon Skin* The weapon skin acts as a Consumable, and it will be in your "Use" equipment tab.
* Right-click the skin to consume it, and the skin will be register to your "Skin Storage".
* NOTE: Select the weapon skin this way will override your weapon avatar.

Black Purgatory General Details  


Entry & Rules* Time limit: 25 minutes
* Entry req: 5938 exo, 30 fp
* Can be entered with 4 party members (not less)
* 5 shared coin limit
* 2 rewards/week, 3 entries (1 backup entry)



New Control UI1. Time Limit
* There is a 25 minute time limit.
* Unless you leave the party, you can continue to challenge for a limited time.

- Rewards gauge
- Dungeon Progression
- Retreat to town


Dungeon Route* Similarly to Operation Hope dungeon, Black Purgatory is divided into 4 sections, and in each section, you can pick which route you want to take. Depends on the route you take in each section, you will face different enemies.
* There are two type of Mini-bosses you will face before fighting the final boss: Dark Knight and Follower.
+ Defeat Dark Knights will increase dungeon rewards. The more Dark Knight you defeat (up to 3), the higher the rewards.
+ Defeat Followers will increase party's damage throughout the dungeon.

* So in the beginning of the dungeon, you're given 3 routes:
+ In Dark Knight Encounter Route, you will face 1 Follower and1 Dark Knight.
+ In Follower Encounter Route, you will face 1 Follower, however, there is a chance a Dark Knight will intrude. If the Dark Knight show up, it will have less HP than the one in Dark Knight Route.
+ In APC Rescue Route, you can rescue a random APCs. There are 6 available APCs, each will give you different ability to use.

* Overall, in between 4 sections, the game gives you route options so you can face up to 3 Dark Knights and rescue up to 2 APCs. Therefore depends on your party strength, you can pick and choose how many you want to face as you see fit.
* Through out the dungeon route, War Merchant Posha will be available to you to buy helpful potions along with the ability for party leader to use a one-time everyone skill reset.

  


RewardsFinal boss has chance to drop Random Epic/Mythic/Product of Corruption   
  


Possible Monster Cards

Finally, Director's Note* Mr. Kang is back to announce Director's Note!
* Different from what was announced in the festival, Product of Corruption (PoW versions of existing epics eg. PoW Talisman Selection) will be changed to have the same stats as the normal version, and modifications will give similar gains to amplification. This is to alleviate the stress of never finding the epic pieces you want to reach endgame.
* About the new dungeon reward system:
* We have prepared an item reward that ensures the highest value of the modifier you want, for the option to alleviate RNG.
* We've considered player opinions and have added the option of changing weapon modifiers to increasing awakening skill levels for all classes to possibly use weapons with these stats.
* The aim of the epic/mythic rebalance is to close up the damage gap between sets. We aim to maintain the "theme" of each set.
* In the future when we are developing new gears, we will put this into consideration, to have different "themed" gears that dont have major differences in damage.
* We are working hard to develop the future neo awakenings. In the balance patch starting June, we will, use new skills, changes to skill numbers and changes to how the skills work themselves, to balance and close gaps between the classes.
* Balance patches will be carried out over periods of time to receive reaction as we go.
* As we've said, there will be no new characters or subclasses to be released before all the neo awakenings are released. This is our promise to adventurers. The new female slayer subclass is a promise too, but will come afterwards.
* Ozma will come to KDNF before June 2021.
* There will be new systems implemented so that in the fight with Ozma, it will strengthen the bond with party members and continuously give feedback to each other. In addition to new monster patterns, please look forward to it.

* This rework was released with the new Female Gunner 3A and Black Purgatory dungeon.
* Due to the number of Epic available, pieces that did not receive any changes are not included.
* New <Modification Option> is available for Epic Weapons, Bottom, Ring and Sub-Equipment and can be changed through acquired materials from Black Purgatory dungeons.

Modification Option* Each Level 100 Epic Weapon, Bottom, Ring and Sub-Equipment now have brand new option called <Modification Option>.
* Default <Modification Option> is available at all times, until it was Modified into something else.
+ 165  obtained from Black Purgatory can be used to reroll the <Modification Option> into a new option and a different value.
+ 13  also obtained from Black Purgatory can be used to maximize the value of the current <Modification Option>.
+ After Modifying the <Modification Option> you may choose to keep the current option or swap to the new option.
+ Modified Equipment cannot be transferred.
+ Default option for other pieces is varied depending on the equipment and can be raised between as high as +8% from the default value.

* Available Modification Options:

* Hard Oculus is a new mode added to DFO on June 23, 2020.
* The concept is very similar to regular difficulty with just some boss variation.

Introduction* Entry Rules
+ Must be Level 100 or above.
+ No Daily or Weekly entry limits.
+ You can receive Daily rewards once a day.
+ Your Daily reward count will be reset everyday at 9:00 AM.

* How to Enter
+ Complete the Episode quest "Revenants in the Cycle" to enter. You can access the "Revenants in the Cycle" quest through the Episode quest "Something in the Eyes".
+ Enter through "The Oculus" channel.
+ You can create a party through NPC Oberith Rosenbach in The Oculus channel. After creating a party, you can enter the right-hand side area. You can then start through NPC Teida Beonarr.
+ For parties of 4 or more. Parties of fewer than 4 players cannot enter.
+ At least 5,938 Exorcism is recommended.

* Requirements
+ No entry materials are required.
+ 8 Fatigue is consumed upon entering.

Dungeon Layout* Hard mode only have 3 floors. Unlike normal mode where all the floor bosses and mini-bosses spread out across 3 floors, in hard mode, you start at floor B2 where all the bosses and mini-bosses are on the same floor. Here you go straight to the left, you can go down to B3, where the final boss the prophet Ezra, is located.
* There are 4 bosses on this floor, the 3 original floor bosses (Hellcat Louise, Lone Roseberry, and Red Ghost Soryun). And lastly on the staircase room, you will face Red Ghost Soryun again, but a modified version (berserked version you can call it).
* Note that skill cooldown will NOT reset even if you defeat a named boss. Also, since you CANNOT go back to the previous room, you must decide whether to proceed by picking up buff from killing mini-bosses then face another boss , or ignoring mini-bosses and proceeding straight to the next boss.
* A 15 minute time limit will be activated when you start the content. Your mission fails if you exceed the time limit. Defeating Imposters will add 5 minutes to the time limit.
* Life Tokens are limited to 4 per party. You can increase your max Life Token limit by 2 by defeating the Pandemonium monster Volcano Spider.
* Defeat Tria Celebrum to save the merchant NPC.
* Certain Consumables are restricted from use in this content.
+ Consumable Puppets are restricted from use.
+ Sacred Blessings, Heavenly HP Potions, Heavenly Potions, Divine Revival Formulas, and Immortality Formulas are restricted from use.

Rewards* Clearing Hard Mode will give you new material "Encroached Grim Seeker's Souls" , along with    and new Product of Wisdom recipes .
* Really the only valuable item from Hard Mode is the "Encroached Level 100 Epic Weapon Pot Selection Box"  that costs 2,000 .
+ It can be purchased once per month and is account-bound.
+ It only generate weapon for your class though, not specific sub-class. So technically you can get this box, open on a brand new character, then change the said character's subclasss to whichever weapon type you got.

New Boss Mechanics

* This updates doesn't add any new contents.
* Rather it adds many conveniences and quality of life stuffs.
* Improvements include but not limited to graphic setting, Philasia, party, items, guild, and many more.
Graphic Setting Improvements1. Screen Shake Effect  
* When you check this option in Setting, it will now give you sliding bar to adjust the shake intensity to your liking.
* If you uncheck the box, the bar will be at 0%

2. Total Damage Effect  
* New sliding bar added. It adjusts the opacity of the total damage deal by one attack.
* This feature is similar to Maple Story damage where instead of having multiple damage lines flying all around the screen, now you only see one line of damage.
* The closer to 0%, the more transparent this damage looks.

3. Skill Cover Effect* Before the update, when you have skill opacity at max, the skill often has too much effect that it cover up the location of the target.
* With this new sliding bar, you can now see a dark shadow of the target, making it at least visible while the skill is casting.

  
Philasia Improvements* The safe is moved from all the way from the right to left side right where you teleported

* As for the right side, you can now summon up to 3 NPCs.
* Summonable NPCs: Lady Kiri, Jun the Blacksmith, Knight Robato, Grandis, Karakas, Melvin Richter, Lindsay Rossum.

* Control Panel Improvement
+ Overlapping areas are now integrated. (e.g. Basement of Pain & Black Shrine are at 1 location)
+ New area added: Mountain of Exiles, Night of Revelation, Sirocco Challenge, Black Purgatory.

  
Channel Improvements* The Public and Special channel tabs are now intergraded into one tab.
* Instead of being divided by level, these channels now divided by regions. You can now see them all at a glance.
* The "Tower" special channel is now gone (RIP).
* You can now also auto-change to special channel by walking to the portal

  
Party/Raid Improvements* You can now pick and choose which position you're recruiting.
* It will add the B, D, S letter next to your party, great for letting people know what you're looking for.
  
Item/Equipment Improvements* "Epic Set in Possession" window now shows you duplicated items.
* It shows the location of duplicated items. If you're wearing a duplicate, it will show as a frame.
* When dissembling items, it will now include items on your quick slot bar (it's about damn time).
* Title storage now increases from 3 lines to 9 lines (45 slots).

* In the emblems window, you can still drag them to your avatar.
* Now with improvement, you can right click to register them.

  
Dungeon Improvements* Ghent Palace
+ Dungeon route shortened.
+ Health of Escort Captain Kirsten and Hound Cyrus reduced.
+ Boss Anje Wane: Some i-frames attack removed, and jumping to mech time reduced.
* Bottomless Tunnel:
+ Dungeon route shortened.

+ Kirsch of Deception.

- Some multi-hit gimmicks reduced.

+ Nilvas Gracia.

+ Mandarin boss

Other Improvements* Guild: If guild master is not active for a certain amount of time (30 days), the new "Delegation Option" is added. You will be demoted if this delegation takes place.

* In a nutshell, enchantment is basically adding extra stat to your gears.
* There are 12 equipment slots and countless enchants. This articles outline how to enchants and recommendation on which one to use.

Table of Contents* Basic Concepts
* How to Apply Enchant
* How to Upgrade Cards
* How to Obtain Cards
* Type of Class and Damage
* Which Enchant to Use
* Guides From the Community
* Example



Basic Concepts* Enchants are extra stats for your equipment. You can see them as green lines on the item.

* Enchantment comes in two forms: Monster cards and beads.
* Monster Cards:
+ Monster cards can be looked up through "DFOpedia". In this window, you can sort the cards by slots and type of enchantments.
+ They require enchanter shop to apply the stat, more on that later.
* Beads: on the other hand does not require an enchanter shop to apply.
+ Card can be turned into bead through enchanter profession.
+ They are basically a more expensive version of monster card.
+ For the most part as new player or returning players, most people don't really pay for beads. They are much more expensive and not worth it.
+ It's in your best interest to use cards, with some exceptions of course.



How to Apply Enchant* For cards, you need to find an enchanter shop. They can be found looking like this.
* After opening the shop, select the equip (1) and the card (2).
* Click "Enchant" (3), it will ask for some materials depends on the equipment, then click "Confirm" (4). That's it.

  


How to Upgrade Cards* Upgrading your card will increase its stat and will require other cards with the same rarity as material.
* For example: in order to upgrade a legendary card, you need to use other legendary cards to upgrade it.
* You can check how many time a card can be upgraded by looking at the top right corner.

* You can upgrade your card through NPC Abello.
* Talk to the NPC to open the "Upgrade Card" window.
+ (1) is where you put the card you want to upgrade.
+ (2) (3) (4) are the material cards needed to upgrade your target card. The more cards you put in these slots, the higher chance your upgrade be successful.
+ (5) is the stats your card will gain with every upgrade.
* Yes, upgrade card is also RNG, the more cards you used as material, the higher the chances. As an example below, one card is medium chance (1), two cards is high chance (2), and three cards will guarantee the card upgrade (3).
  


How to Obtain Cards* The majority of the time, you get end game cards through raids or killing the corresponding monster in dungeon. For example, "Awakened Wujo Card" can be dropped by killing "Awakened Wujo" in "Basement of Pain" dungeon.
* Beside that, you can get cards through "Card Binding" and "Card Compounding". Both are very similar. You can check if a card can be obtain through either of these 2 ways by looking at the writing at the bottom.
+ "Card Binding Device" means card binding (duh).
+ "Card Crafting" means card compounding.

Card Binding  
* Binding cards require binding devices. You can get those through "Tower of Dazzlement" dungeon in "Valley of the Fallen Souls" and NPC Simona.
* Then open the device and start throwing your cards in there. The more cards you use, the higher chance you get the next grade card (up to unique grade).

  
Card Compounding* Very similar to using the binding devices, but here you use NPC Abello.
* The more cards you use, the higher chances of getting the next grade card (up to unique grade)
  


Type of Class and Damage* Your class and damage determine which enchants you should get. There are 5 common types:
+ Physical Percent Class
+ Physical Fixed Class
+ Magical Percent Class
+ Magical Fixed Class
+ Buffers/Saders (e.g. Male Crusader, Seraph, Enchantress)

* For non-sader class, you can tell which group you are by looking at your skills. For example:
+ (1) indicates the skill is physical damage
+ (2) indicates the skill is magical damage.
+ (3) You can see the percent sign indicates percent damage.
+ (4) You just see the number, no percent sign, indicates fixed damage.

* For your convenience, click this Class Stats excel sheet to see which one you are.

  


Which Enchant to Use* For non-buffers:
+ Priority 1: All benefit from critical chances. Priority these enchants before everything else.
+ Priority 2: All benefit from elemental damages. They trump Physical/Magical/Independent Attack.
+ Lastly, for Percent classes, you get most benefit from "Physical/Magic Attack" and "Strength/Intelligent" enchants, with attack as priority. For Fixed classes, you get most benefit from "Independent Attack" and "Strength/Intelligent" enchants, with attack as priority.

* For buffers:
+ Seraph/Enchantress: Benefits from Intelligent enchants. Get as much as you can.
+ Male Crusader: Benefit from Vitality/Spirit. Either one is fine, he has passive that equalize both stats.

* For your convenience, click each gear slot below to be directed to the list of respected recommended cards/beads (Non-sader only). For sader classes, go here.

Guides From the Community* Detailed list of cards can be found in DFOWiki
* Poised (updated May 2020) provides an extremely detailed excel sheet on which card to get for each equipment slot.
* ChewyTheGoon (posted May 2020) provides a detailed video about this subject.

* Black Purgatory was released in Korea on Jan 6, 2021 as first part of Winter Festival.
* This dungeon is known in the community as Oculus 2.0
* You can get reward once per day, twice per week per character.

Table of Contents* Dungeon Set-up & Layout
+ APC Rescue
+ Dark Knight
+ Corrupted Village

* Possible Routes
* Boss Mechanics
* Tips and Tricks
* Rewards
* New Monster Cards
* References


Dungeon Set-up & Layout* This dungeon has very similar concept as Operation Hope.
* Here it is divided into 3 Crossroads, and each one is guarded with a mini-boss.
* Once the mini-boss is defeated, you will be presented with different route options to take to the next Crossroad. The 3 possible options are: Dark Knight, Corrupted Village, and APC Rescue

  
* The illustration below will give you an idea of how the dungeon progress. The route you take will determine the bosses you face and the reward you get at the end.
* Here's how the dungeon progresses.
+ You face Jade (1), then pick your route to the next Crossroad (2).
+ After fighting the bosses in that route, you face Venta (3), then you pick your route to the next Crossroad (4).
+ Again after fighting there, you fight Onyx (5). But before her, you get to rescue an APC that give you a random buff and you also get to meet merchant Posha, where you can reset your skill and buy various useful pots.
+ You then choose your next route (6), fight all the bosses there then meet your final opponent Astaros (7).
* So regardless of which route you take, you get to fight at least 3 mini-bosses (one guarding each Crossroad) and you get to rescue at least 1 APC for a random buff.
* NOTE: You can retreat without losing dungeon progress. From my understanding, after treating, you start back where you last kill a mini-boss. Keep in mind the more you retreat, the longer you need to wait to go back in. You can use this to your advantages such as resetting skill cooldown before a particular hard boss.



* Once the APC is rescued, you can use the buff by using the "Special Dungeon Key" (defaulted as "Tab"). Name of APCs and their buffs below.

* While you're in this route, there's a chance a Dark Knight OR a Follower can intrude. Defeat Dark Knight will increase final reward. Defeat Follower will give permanent damage buff. More details below.
* Now let's see what you will face if you pick Dark Knight and Corrupted Village routes.



* In the image below, each Dark Night (D, Right) is accompanied by a Follower (F, Left), and the pairs are always the same (3 total pairs). You will always fight Follower first, and each successful Dark Knight defeat will grand you more reward at the end.  The pairs are:
+ Drooping Darkness Jet and Timor the Pure Blood.
+ Despero the Pure Blood and Tiamat of Despair.
+ Blood Drinking Banya and Verias the Doom.

* Note: The location of each pair is randomized.



  
* If you pick this route, you will only fight Follower.
* However, there's a chance his Dark Knight can intrude. If this happen, the Dark Knight will have less HP, and defeating this Dark Knight will grant you more rewards as if you were taking the Dark Knight route (yay).
* The good thing is each Follow defeat will give you damage boost, 3%, 8%, and 25%, respectively.



Possible Routes* There are endless routes you can take to the final boss depends on your party composition and gears, and you need to weight your risk vs. benefit as well to see how many Dark Knight you want to face.
* If you look at the rewards, it's divided into stages. So I will go over the route needed to achieve each stage.
Stage 1* Here you don't take any Dark Knight route at all. So your rewards will be minimal. Take this route if your party is extremely barebone.
* In this route you only face 2 Followers and get to rescue 2 APCs.
* If your party still really need the damage, you can also pick Corrupted Village route in the beginning (2) to get the 25% boost.
  
Stage 2* Here you take down 1 Dark Knight.
* I know the location of Dark Knight pairs are randomized but I'm not sure they would stay the same if you retreat and take another route.
* So even if they are randomized but stay the same once you know which one they are, potentially you choose which one to take out (4 or 6). For example. if you get into (4) and that boss is too hard, you can take Village at (4) and do Knight at (6) instead, and vice versa.
* I don't recommend taking Knight at (2) though because you may need that extra APC buff, and since you're only doing 1 Knight, might as well do either (4) or (6).
  
Stage 3* Here you take down 2 Dark Knight.
* There's not really any other way. You can try to take Village at (2) if your party need that extra damage buff.
  
Stage 4* Here you take down 3 Dark Knight and all 3 followers.
* This is definitely the hardest route where you face ALL the bosses and mini-bosses this dungeon has to offer. So proceed with caution.

  


Boss Mechanics  


Tips and Tricks* Rescue APC Paladin Jenna when you can.
+ After defeating Jade, you will have 3 options to pick which route to go next. Paladin Jenna will always spawn in the APC Rescue route.
+ You can use her 15-sec groggy ability up to 2 times with 60-sec cooldown in between. So unless you're doing the stage 4, always rescue this APC.
* Retreat to town with caution.
+ If you're out of coin, you can always retreat to town and retry. Retreat will reset all your skills so you can use this as your advantage. However, retreat doesn't reset your 5 coin limit.
+ However, be careful, the more you reset, the longer you have to wait to go back in (5 seconds, 80 seconds, 100 seconds, 130 seconds, 180 seconds, and so on). So I don't really recommend you retreat more than 2 times.

* Know when to dump all your skills.
+ First, the merchant Posha can reset all your skills for just 1 time (left circle). So you can dump all your skill on the boss before him.
+ Second, this go in hand with retreating, dump all your skill before the final boss (right circle). After that, you can retreat to reset skills then go back to fight the final boss. Since the first retreat only have 5-sec downtime, most parties use this strategy.
* Know when to Sader 1A/3A.
+ NOTE: This content is focused on sustain damage, so sader should bind 1A to 3A. There you can cast 1A while 3A is on cooldown, and vice versa.
+ For Stage 1-3, the recommend spots are below. Really self explanatory, here you combine both merchant Posha and town retreat to reset your 1A/3A.

+ For Stage 4, since this is the hardest difficulty, you may have to retreat twice (once after 1st dark knight, then once right before final boss).
  
  


RewardsFinal boss has chance to drop Random Epic/Mythic/Product of Corruption

* DFO is a great multiplayer beat 'em up action role-playing game. This game definitely reminds you of the 90s fighting game.
* You're in luck because this game does have internal support for controllers. Unfortunately this internal program is not that great. You can move around, but you can't map the skills.
* This article outlines step-by-step process of using an external program called Xpadder so you can play with any controller (XBox One as example).
* Disclaimer: I know plenty of players in DFOG server that use external program to map out controller that have been playing for years and don't get banned. However, there are some people also claimed they get banned for it. Do your own research and use this guide at your own risk.

Table of Contents* Purchase Xpadder
* Before Getting Started
* How to Set-up
* Assign Your Keys
* Tips & Tricks
* Example



Purchase Xpadder* You can download through this link xpadder.com. The link looks sketchy but this is where I got it from. It costs $9.99 as one time payment.
* Once entered in you will get email of how to buy with PayPal, then you get access to many other info such as forum, controller images, preset profile, etc.
  


Before Getting Started* Make sure you connect your controller AFTER logging into DFO. The reason for this is that you don't want DFO client to recognize the controller and using its internal integration. We're trying to use a 3rd party program here.
* Also make sure you run the program "As Administrator", and set up "Compatibility Mode" using instruction below.

  
  


How to Set-up* Once installed, open the program a make a new profile.
* Then use the following steps to register the controller's keys.
* A disadvantage of Xpadder is that it doesn't register special key such as "Home" key with Xbox One.
* Once added your controller image (Xbox One as example) and register your keys, move them around to match your image.

  


Assign Your Keys* To assign a key, click on the key you want (1), then select what you want that key to do (2)
* That's pretty much. Map all your keys and have fun playing DFO.


Tips & Tricks* Your default left and right thumbsticks only register 4 keys each, but you can change it so that it can do 8 keys each.
* Note that you can adjust the sensitivity of the thumbsticks so it can give you less room of error and not accidentally casting the wrong skill.

* We also know that DFO has lot of keys so it can be hard to register everything on one profile.
* Luckily, Xpadder gives you option to switch between profiles so you can assign a set of keys on one profile and another set of keys on another profile.
* Example swapping profile 7 and 8
+ Click on a key (1), then "Advanced" (2)
+ Pick "Set Selector" (3), then "Set 8 Two-way" (4) (two-way means each key stroke will send you between profiles)

  


Example* On the daily basis, I play DFO with 2 profiles. You can see some gameplay examples from my YouTube channel.
* Profile 1 is where I register all basic keys such as movement arrows, skill quick slots "QWERTV" and "ASDFGH".
* I also have quick slots "123" as potions and "9" as "//setitem" for quick dungeon drops pick up.

* Profile 2 is any other special keys that doesn't fit in profile 1.
* Here I have "F10, F11, F12" for quick "Dungeon Restart, Select Other Dungeon, Back to Town" options, along with quick slot "456" as things like "Faithful Owl" and "Ria's Communicator".
* I also have the "right thumbstrick" as mouse control and "left/right trigger" as left/right mouse click so I can sit on the couch and not have to reach for the mouse for some simple mouse clicking and changing characters.

* Coefficient tablets are charts made by KDnF community.
* In a nutshell, it gives every class the same gears, then rank the damage of every skill and talisman corresponding to each class. Therefore this is a useful tool to help you decide which skill to pick and which talisman to prioritize.
* Please note that these tables change based on class balances and as more 3A are released. Be sure to check on the original source in the reference at the bottom for the most up-to-date info.
* You can also quickly look up these tables in this Coefficient Archive page.
* This article will attempt to show you how to read these tables.

How to Read* (01) Original name of skills
* (02) Level of each skill
* (03) Raw damage of each skill
* (04) Raw damage with TP points
* (05) Damage with self buff
+ This number determines raking of each skill

* (06) Percentage of damage and cooldown
* (7,8) Passive skills name and their percent damage increase (?)
* (09) Talisman skill
* (10) Full damage of talisman
* (11) Percentage of Talisman damage and cooldown
  
How to Use  
* Keep in mind that I'm not a min-maxing player, therefore these tables definitely have more usage than I can understand.
* For skill build, I would pay close attention to column (4)(5)(6).
+ (4) This is your TP damage, it's a good indicator of which skill you should invest TP on.
+ (5)(6) are your damage with buff along with its damage/cooldown ratio. Of course basic math here, bigger ratio means higher numerator (aka damage) and lower denominator (cooldown).
+ As you can see, when deciding skills, you really need to combine all 3 columns AND your knowledge of how each skill works.

* Example of how I would use this table:
+ May rank very high on the chart. However, the damage/cooldown ratio is relatively low, plus the skill has long animation. Thus not many players, including myself, max this skill.
+ May rank very low on the chart. However, the damage/cooldown ratio is relatively higher than other skills. Thus many players max these as sustain damage skills.
+ Itself already a decent damage skill with great damage/cooldown ratio. With its talisman, even though the damage ranking is not the highest, its damage/cooldown ratio is very high. Therefore with both combination, this skill and talisman combination is a must.
How It's Calculated* To be honest, I'm not really sure how they come up with these number.
* From the reference below, I know that these are the gear used, and they tested in Training Room using Meteor as the 25-second target. But beside that, I couldn't find any information about equation, target setting, etc.
* It's a bit frustrated because I know lots of people use these tables, but I just can't figure out how they come up with these number.
+ Weapon: +5 Modification Primal Dream
+ Armor: +10 Amplification Mother Nature's Breath Set
+ Accessories: +10 Amplification Elementalist's Accessory Set  (However, the cooldown reduction effect is not applied.)
+ Special Equipment: +10 Amplification Normalizing Synchro Set
+ Title: Advent of the Sado (+6 Elemental damage)
+ Avatar: Rare Avatar
+ Emblem: Unique Emblems
+ Platinum Emblem: Emblem optimized for each class
+ Creature: Book of Awakening SD Creature (2 cards +1 additional reflection)
+ Insignia: +7 reinforced legendary insignia for each class & + 7 speed gem

ReferencesGamechosun.co.kr

* Ever wonder why everyone tells you to do your daily 2+2 dungeons?
* Are you curious how much progression you can make with your characters?
* How about drop rate and how many epics can you expect to drop from these dungeon?
* This article will show you the result of 250 daily 2+2 runs.

Procedure & Data* In case you didn't know, 2+2 means 2 Black Shrine and 2 Basement of Pain dungeon runs. Both have special rewards through card flip at at the end for the first 2 runs. So 250 total 2+2 runs is 1,000 dungeon clears.
* The procedure was very simple, I ran 2+2 on multiple alts and record their     drops. I didn't record any gold drops or gold from selling equipment. I also bought all from Gabriel and didn't pick any purple special reward cards.
* In the data below, for the sake of data presentation, each group is a combined result of 25 data points, and each data point is the result of 2 Black Shrine and 2 Basement of Pain runs. For complete information of all data points, you can visit this PDF file.
* The "Total Raw Gold" is the price of all tradable stuffs (e.g. ). Prices used: 48,500  and 7,397 .

  
Discussion* How much progression can you get from doing 2+2?
+ With level 100 cap, progression is quite simple actually. Since you can upgrade level 95 Fiend War and Prey slots in to level 100 epics, you really only need 4 good epic pieces to drop, 5 if you include weapon.
+ Take my Female Spitfire for example, with her 4 drops, I can continue farming 2+2 for , then upgrade 3 pieces Mother Nature, 3 pieces Normal Syncho, and then ditto the last piece through Oculus dungeon. As for weapon, you can do pit 456 for RNG weapon pot, or if you really desperate, transfer the weapon if it drop from other alts.
+ Neople has been giving out  and discount recipes through events, with just a couple months of farming, you can upgrade your equipment easily.
+ Now can this strategy get you into Sirocco Red party? NO. But with optimization, you definitely have a chance for Green party.

* What's the expected drop rate?
+ As you can see from the data, after 1,000 runs, I got 89 drops. So it's about 9% drop rate.
+ Note that this is a combination of both gold flip and drop from killing the boss though. I can tell you that the drop from killing boss is even lower, I didn't keep track, but I can definitely count it on two hands. So the drop rate probably around 8.5-9%.
+ So if you're lucky, maybe you can get that good 4 pieces and 1 usable weapon. Most of my weapon drops from Top 12 Progression page is from these 2 dungeons.

* Should you continue to farm 2+2 with characters that already 12/12?
+ Yes, definitely yes,  can be converted into  if you need to transfer that last epic piece.
+ Each epic transfer requires 125 , which is 12,500  (aka 12,500 ). If you're new here,  is not your bottleneck. Farming 126  for a weapon or 168  for a equipment is not that hard. It's getting 125  is the hard part.
+ Therefore, keep farming these  so you can eventually funnel to gear up other characters. As a bonus, you get about 2 million gold for every 25 daily 2+2 runs, and that is not including the white drops you can sell to NPC. Gearing up alts, and cash on the side, 2 birds with 1 stone.

Cursed Ruby Expansion* Added 10 extra floors. You can now get chest on 55th and 60th floors.
* Cursed Ruby title changed so that it can be obtained from the 46th floor to the 55th floor.
* When defeating monsters on the 56th floor or higher, there is a probability that a newly added high-ranking honor reward box.
* HP of all monsters appearing in Curse of Ruby is rebalanced.
+ HP of normal monsters has been lowered.
+ HP of named and boss monsters has been increased.

* As the curse of ruby ​​is expanded to the 60th floor, the hit rate reduction penalty is rebalanced.
+ Floors 51 ~ 60 are subject to the same hit rate penalty as on floors 46 ~ 50.
+ The hit rate penalty for floors 21 ~ 50 has been lowered.

* New explorer club achievement also added to this new expansion.


Cursed Ruby Hidden Dungeon* When clearing the dungeon on the 6th floor or higher, this area can be found at random.
+ The higher the number of floors you are playing, the higher your chances of appearing.
+ When clearing the dungeon, the more times it is not found, the higher the probability of appearing in the next dungeon,
+ The odds are shared within the account.
+ It does not appear in the final dungeon on the 60th floor.

* When clearing the false haven, you will get the following rewards:
+ 1~2 Ruby Curse Reward Box.
+ The higher the number of floors to find a false haven, the higher the rank of the chest to be obtained.
+ Provides one chance to synthesize the curse reward box of ruby

  


New Cursed Ruby Chest* Called "Shiny Ancient God's Box" that acquired on the 55th and 60th floors.
* Beside the usual , you can now get legendary cards/beads.
* New accessory cards/beads include:
+ Fire & Light elemental damage +30
+ Water & Shadow elemental damage +30
+ All elemental damage +28
  


Arad Adventure Subjugation* New area "Mountain of Exiles" added with total 7 dungeons. Its BGM here.
* The number of times you can participate in this Subjugation Battle and obtain rewards is applied on a per dungeon/weekly basis.
+ If you successfully clear the dungeon and get a reward, the "number of rewards available" will be deducted.
+ If you fail to clear and do not get the reward, the "number of rewards available" will not be deducted.
+ As long as the number of times remains, you can re-enter the dungeon that has already been cleared to obtain rewards.

* For the first 6 dungeons you can run 2 dungeons at once with 2 teams of 4.
* At the final dungeon, you needs to enter as 1 party of 8.
* NOTE: The first 6 dungeons will have the usual 3 attributes, whereas the final dungeon will have 5 attributes.

* In subjugation, the battle continues even if the you get disconnected.
* The duration of the subjugation battle is calculated for each dungeon, and the battle is in progress for a specified time, but if the client is connected, the battle proceeds at twice the speed of the specified time.
* Various objects that respond to clicks are hidden in the dungeon.



New Subjugation Reward* Basic rewards, these are account bound and reset monthly. All 4 types once open you can get  . However  will weight more toward talisman box.
+ Reward for clearing the 1st area (top row).
+ Reward for clearing the 2nd area (next row).
+ Reward for clearing Citadel & Outcasted Mountain.
+ Reward for clearing final boss.

* Random rewards, the rewards increase as you get closer to the final dungeon. The higher the clear rank, the more rewards you can get. These are also account bound and reset monthly.
+ Mysterious Material Pouch: Contains    .
+ Adventure Ruby: Used to recruit adventure mercenaries.
+ Same type of boxes you get from Adventure Gabriel shop.
+ Random Talisman and Rune boxes.
+ Mountain of Exiles cards. Their stats can be found in this Mountain of Exile guide.

* This is an adaptation to the KDnF Battle Pass.
* The period for Season 1 is Jan 27, 2021 to Apr 4, 2021.
* In a nutshell, you complete daily, weekly, and season missions to collect your rewards.
* There are 2 major type of Passes you can get: Plus Pass & Royal Pass. There's also free version available.

Basic Arad Pass UI* You will see 3 main tabs on the top.
* (1) is your timeline, it basically shows what rewards you can get based on your Pass level.
* (2) is your task summary, here can see your daily weekly seasonly missions.
* (3) is your privilege summary, it shows you detail of perks based on your Pass.
* (4) is basically your mission counts for you keeping track of.
  


Timeline Tab* Each time you clear daily weekly seasonly mission, you get EXP that would level up your Pass level.
* And based on that level, you get certain rewards. Note that all Passes will have a free version reward (top row) and pass version (bottom row). If you purchase a pass, you get both top and bottom row.
* If you're free-to-play, you can still get benefit from this system, just not as many rewards.
  


Task Summary Tab* You can find all your task here: (1) Daily, (2) Weekly, (3) Seasonly, (4) Mileage.
* You can also see how many time the task can be completed and the amount of EXP it gives.
  


Privilege Summary Tab* Lots of benefits here including title pet equipment boxes, raid discounts, exp bonuses, etc.
* You can also specify your "Royal Pass Character" in this screen. You basically telling the system which character to give the boxes to.
* Some basic bonuses include free raid entry passes, more raid reward materials, Guide of Wisdom discounts.
* "Royal Pass Character" boxes:
+ Royal Pass Equipment Box: This gives you a weapon box and a title box
- Royal Pass +10 Reinforcement/+3 Refining Epic Weapon Box. This is a SELECTIVE level 100 epic weapon box.
- Selective title box. It gives 10% town movement speed AND +3 level to your BUFF skill

+ Royal Pass Title Box. This is your damage title.
- All stat +110
- All elemental damage +12
- Physical / Magic Critical + 10%
- Attack / Cast / Movement Speed ​​+ 5%
- Hit Rate, Evasion Rate + 2%
- HP / MP Max +300
- HP / MP 24 recovery per minute
- Attack damage +15%
- Additional damage +12%

+ Royal Pass Avatar Box. These are Admiral avatar box.
- All stat +93
- HP, MP Max 150
- HP, MP recovery 12
- Attack speed / movement speed +6.4%, cast speed +8.4%
- Inventory weapon 6kg
- Physical critical / magic critical +8.8%

+ Royal Pass Creature Box. This is a SD type creature
- All stat +50
- Physical / Magic / Independent Attack +50
- Physical / Magic Critical + 10%
- All elemental damage +15
- Town Movement Speed ​​+ 10%
- Attack Speed, Cast Speed, Movement Speed ​​+ 4%
- MP Max +15%
- Attack damage +15%
- Additional damage +10%



Mileage Tab* This is there so that if you can't clear a particular mission, you can clear it using Mileage Point.
* Up to 2,400 EXP can be purchased with 25 Mileage per 100 EXP.



Pass Level* Basically all the odd levels are for free-to-play people.
* Even levels are for people who purchase Plus or Royal passes.
* AND every 8th level, you get an additional reward box for Royal pass.

Available Daily Weekly Seasonly Missions

Daily Missions
  
* You get 3 missions per day (randomly generated from a set of mission).
* Each mission gives 100 EXP (300 EXP total daily, 600 EXP total daily if you have paid passes)
* Chest Town Dungeon Clear, Wisdom Guidance Dungeon Clear Mission will be replaced with Alternative Missions 1 and 2 if there are no 100Lv characters in your account.
* Possible daily missions:
+ Use 10 skills (not sure what type)
+ Clear 2 optimal dungeons
+ Clear 2 optimal dungeons without using life token
+ Clear 2 optimal dungeons with S tier or higher
+ Kill 30 monsters in optimal dungeons
+ Kill 2 Bosses in optimal dungeons
+ Kill 10 Bosses in optimal dungeons
+ Dissemble equipment 3 times
+ Visit the point shop 1 time (not sure what this shop is)
+ Complete 1 quest / dungeon missions
+ Burn all Fatigue points 10 times (aka 10 characters)
+ Equipment repair or all repair 1 time
+ Earn 100 Adventure Tokens 1 time
+ Clear 1 Chest Town Dungeon  Basement of Pain / Black Shrine / Land of Memory / Bottomless Tunnel (Change to Alternate Mission if there are no 100 level characters)
+ Clear Guide of wisdom 2 times (Change to Alternate Mission if there are no 100 level characters)
+ [Alternative Mission 1] Use the Portal to the right of Seria's room 1 time
+ [Alternative Mission 2] Visit the training room


Weekly Missions* From the weekly mission list, you get 1 fixed mission and 4 random missions.
* Random missions will be selected randomly from 12 missions.
* The total weekly experience for weekly missions is 4,800
* Fixed Mission:
+ Basic Free Pass / Plus Pass players will have fixed mission of 6 daily log-in (display on top).
+ Royal Pass fixed mission will only require 3 daily log-in instead.

* Random Missions:
+ Dissembling Equipment 9 times
+ Clear optimal dungeon 10 times
+ Kill monsters in optimal dungeon 150 times
+ Kill boss in optimal dungeon 10 times
+ Flip Gold / Premium Cards in reward screen 3 times
+ Complete quests / dungeon missions 3 times
+ Joan Ferrero's Voyage Dungeon Clear 3 times
+ Get 300 Adventure Tokens 1 time
+ Clear Guide of Wisdom 10 times (Change to Alternate Mission if there are no 100 level characters)
+ Earn 200 Undaunted Determination 1 time (Change to Alternate Mission if there are no 100 level characters)
+ Clear any raid 1 time (Change to Alternate Mission if there are no 100 level characters)
+ [Alternative 1] Use the Portal to the right of Seria's room (only once a day) 3 times
+ [Alternative 2] Visit to the training room (only once a day) 3 times
+ [Alternative 3] Use colorless cube fragment skill) 20 times
+ [Alternative 4] Visit point shop (only once a day)



Seasonly Missions* 10 types of missions will be set for the character specified as the Royal Pass character.
* Each season mission can be completed only once during the period.
* Here're the missions:
+ Clear optimal dungeon 50 times
+ Clear Guide of Wisdom100 times
+ Dissembling Equipment 50 times (Item type does not matter)
+ Clear Basement of Pain 20 times (Any difficulty)
+ Clear Black Shrine 20 times (Any difficulty)
+ Clear normal Oculus 3 times
+ Clear Pandemonium War 3 times (Challenge / Hard / Normal / Guide)
+ Clear Fiend War Raid 3 times (Normal / Guide)
+ Clear Prey Raid 3 times (Hard / Normal / Guide)
- Note that DFOG doesn't have Prey Hard mode

* In early July 2020, I started recording my epic drops. After 7 months of data, I finally hit my 1,000th ebin.
* Are you wondering what they're consist of? This post will show you.
* All raw data is located in this PDF file.

Top Duplicates* Of course my #1 drop is a weapon, and one of them is an Agent's weapon.
* Top duplicate are:

  
Top Locations* To be honest, I didn't really do Guide of Wisdom that much. Rarely did I remember doing full 156fp bar.
* As you can see, Basement of Pain and Black Shrine counts are very similar (33.8% vs. 32.6%).
* A very small portion drop is from Land of Memories and Bottomless Tunnel. I did get quite a bit of drops from the event dungeon though.
* As for Oculus, I only do on the character that I need. When I got the Ditto, I was slacking on doing the dungeon on the weekly basis.

  
Top Character Drops* It's ironic that my main Male Ranger is actually not the top character getting the drops.
* Apparently Male Spitfire leads the chart with 114 drops, followed by Female Nen with 113 drops.
* Most of these drops are from doing daily 2+2, you can follow their gearing path in details through this Top 12 Progression page.
  
Top Slots* No shocker here, Weapon is the #1 with 364 drops, and yes, Agent weapon  is one of the top drops.
* If you think about the distribution of level 100 epic, this chart reflects it pretty closely.
* There are 19 tops, bottoms and shoes; 15 belts and shoulders; 8 bracelets, necklaces, rings, sub, stone and earrings. lastly there are 74 weapons.
* However you can't find ele, syncro or mother so we takes those out and that leaves us with 18 tops, bottoms, and shoes, 14 belts and shoulders, 7 bracelets, necklaces, rings, sub, stone and earrings. for a total of 198 epics.
* This would put tops, bottoms and shoes at 9% drop rate; belts and shoulders at 7% drop rate; the entire right side at 3.53% drop rate; lastly weapons would be 37.37%
* Looking at pie chart, it's VERY close, well within error.

  
Mythic Drops* Lastly, How many Mythic?
* You can't see it on the chart due to small numbers. I got 20 Product of Wisdoms and 3 Mythics. I only got 2% PoW, but it makes sense because I didn't really do Guide of Wisdom that much. Since PoW doesn't drop in 2+2. This number would definitely higher the more you run Guide of Wisdom.
* Only 3 Mythic out of 1,000 drops. Looks like my RNG is not that good.

* With Exile Mountains update, expansion to the talisman system is added, and I'm sure lot of players will be asking which one they should use.
* Wondering which talisman is better? This article outlines my recommendation that you should consider when picking your next talisman.
Which Talisman Should I Use?* Back when we only have 5 talismans, we have a KDnF popularity list to guide us on which talisman should you use.
* Now with this expansion, we don't have any guideline from Korea on which we should use. So here is my advice and recommendation you should consider when picking your next talisman.
* In a nutshell, Talisman system intention is to provide players variety of ways to customize their skills. At the bottom line, look at it in 2 angles, damage advantage and structure advantage. Damage and cooldown usually go hand-in-hand, so really 3 things.
* And of course, considering these things will require you to READ and use your brain, I know it's hard, DFOG players can't read \*insert meme here\*

Damage Advantage* What you need is to learn how to read damage chart. It basically takes all talisman's damage and their cooldown and rank them. Here're Coefficient Archive (aka damage charts) and Simple Guide to Damage Coefficient Table (aka how to read these tables).
* Note that just because a talisman is top damage, doesn't mean you should pick it. You need to take cooldown into consideration. "Damage/cooldown ratio" is where I would pay close attention to, especially newer contents tend to head toward sustain damage (e.g. Exiles and Black Purgatory).

Structure Advantage  
* Ask yourself, does this talisman make sense to use? does its skill augmentation worth it?
* Personally, what I looks for is if a talisman allows me to cast the skill easier and if I can cancel it out to another skill. Those quality-of-life rank higher for me.

Example* Male ranger is my main, so I'll show you my thought process of choosing this 3rd talisman slot.
* Below is the damage table for his talisman, we have skill name (1st column), its damage (2nd column), and damage/cooldown ratio (3rd column).
* The 2 new talisman are Fast Draw  and Wipe Out , now think about your "Damage Advantage", we clearly see the winner (Fast Draw) due to higher overall damage. Not only that, the damage/cooldown ratio is better as well.
* How about "Structure Advantage"? Below is what the skills look like. Fast Draw  allows you shoot faster (aka reduce cast time), which can be a huge advantage since you can fit more skills in between Death Hawk .

* For Wipe Out , instead of casting the skill at a distance, you now cast it right where you are.
* For me, it's not really an advantage because male ranger doesn't really cast that many skills while he's right on the target except for Wild Shot  and Deadly Approach  really. Beside that, Male ranger usually do damage standing in front of the target, not right on it. So for me, it doesn't really make sense to use Wipe Out talisman.

* In conclusion, looking at damage/cooldown ratios and structural advantages of both talismans, I'll be using Fast Draw .

ReferencesExcel - KDnF 75/80 Talismans
