* Undaunted Determination is a great way to funnel your characters.
* Ever wonder why many veterans cap them weekly? This article outlines this process in details along with my example.

Table of Contents* What is Undaunted Determination?
* What is it Used For?
* How to Cap Weekly Limit
+ Top Tier: Many Sirocco Ready
+ Mid Tier: Prey Over-Geared But Not Enough For Sirocco
+ Low Tier: Only Legendary Gears

* How I Do It



What is Undaunted Determination?

* It is a universal reward for clearing raids (e.g. Fiend War, Prey, Sirocco). You can get up 4,000  per week.
* You will get different amount of  based on the type of mode you do.

  


What is it Used For?* is primarily used to buy epic soul boxes from the raid shop and RNG reward from "Raid Special List".
* You can access the raid shop though the main DFO menu.
  
* Through NPC Magar, you then can trade each  for 20 , which you can use to run Guide of Wisdom to roll your RNG for level 100 epics.
* As you can see, this is a great way to funnel your resources into a character you want to gear up.

  


How to Cap Weekly Limit* Unfortunately, each character can only get 650 , so you will need at least 7 characters to cap this weekly limit.
* Another thing, due to weekly raid entry limit (2 per raid per character), you will need to do more than 1 type of raid. For example, doing only Sirocco on 7 characters will only give you 2,800  so that's not enough.
* So how much raid do you need to do? I'll break it down based on the type of player using the least amount of effort.



Top Tier: Many Sirocco Ready* If you can do Sirocco, you can do Prey raid.
* Using 7 characters, you only need to 14 Preys and 6 Siroccos.
* With 7 Sirocco ready characters, you can enter easy 4-man Prey party, if you can find a group to people to do your Prey train, you can knock it out easily and quickly.



Mid Tier: Prey Over-Geared But Not Enough For Sirocco  
* These are the type of characters that are strong enough to enter 8-man prey party. Usually a mix of level 100 legendary and epic sets.
* Of course, if you can do Prey, you can do Fiend War, using 7 characters, you need 14 Preys and 10 Fiend Wars. Technically 8 Fiend Wars are enough to cap, but since you cap at 650  per character, you will need the 2 extra Fiend Wars.
* Since Fiend War is a lot easier, you could potentially do 14 Fiend Wars and 11 Preys instead. Again due to cap 650 per character, you will need that extra Prey.



Low Tier: Only Legendary Gears  
  
* Technically speaking, having full level 100 legendary gear should be enough to do Prey raid. However, with pub raid nowadays, you will have hard time getting into 8-man party, let alone 4-man party, and 12-man party is very rare.
* So potentially, unless you want to wait a long time for a 12-man prey party, you can only do Fiend War here. And you will need more than 7 characters, 14 to be exact (aka 27 Fiend Wars).
* In the other hand, asking a new player to make and play 14 characters is extremely UNREALISTIC. So my advice is if this is you, don't worry about this process yet.



How I Do It* You can look at my Top 12 Progression and judge for yourself.
* For me, Sirocco pub raids take way too long to fill up. So I only do it on 1 character. Therefore most of my raiding to cap this is from Preys and Fiend Wars.
* On the weeks that I'm busy on the weekend, I do about 13-14 Fiend Wars on Wednesday, about 8-9 Preys on Thursday, 1 Sirocco each on Friday and Saturday.
* On the weeks that I'm free on the weekend, I do about 10-11 Preys on Thursday, 1 Sirocco each on Friday and Saturday, then 7-8 Preys on Saturday.

* The release of level 100 cap comes with a convenience way to transition your gears from level 95 cap. Your Fiend War and Prey gears can now be upgraded to level 100.
* This article outlines in detail this upgrading process and is meant for new or returning players.

Table of Contents* Required Materials
* What Gears Can Be Upgraded?
+ Left Side (Fiend War raid)
+ Right Side (Prey raid)


Required Materials for Upgrading* In the nutshell, NPC Dorothy is the one doing the upgrade for you. She can be found in Chest Town in Dark Side region (image below)

* In the example below, all you need to do is drag the item into the window. Each upgrade requires 1,850 Black Crystals  and 50 Aiolites . You get to keep your enchantment / reinforcement / amplification this way.
* Depends on the reinforcement and amplification of the original piece, you may need to provide some Engraving Stones

* Black Crystals are reward materials from Black Shrine and Basement of Pain dungeon, located in Roschest. You can get the rewards twice per dungeon per character per day.
* Aiolites can drops from these 2 dungeons and all other level 100 dungeons.

* Engraving Stone can be trade in through NPC like Loton.
* can be traded for by 1 Wisdom Crystal , which can be traded for by 100 Wisdom Crystal Fragment .
* are drops from Guide of Wisdom dungeon and can be also be traded from .

  


What Gears Can Be Upgraded?* The only gears allowed to upgrade through this path are Super Tayberr armors (Left Side) and Prey Accessory/Special Equip pieces (Right Side).
* Unfortunately, you can't upgrade your level 95 weapon.
  


Left Side* Regardless of the Super Tayberr type, they will all be upgraded to "Mother Nature's Breath Set"
* This set is not top tier but it's pretty good for a straight forward upgrade.
* Super Tayberr can be upgraded from Regular Tayberr set, which can be bought through NPC Joshua in Pandemonium Junction using Sky Fragment . You can get  from Tayberr dungeon, Pandemonium Meeting, 1st Pit & 2nd Pit.
* In order to upgrade your Tayberr armor, talk to NPC Masked Knight in Elvenguard.
* Upgrading each piece will require 75  and some other materials. On average, you can expect to upgrade each piece every about 2 weeks worth of raids.

* That's a lot of walking, so there's a way you can skip all of that and just buy the recipe from the Raid shop.
* Using this you get to skip the buying Regular Tayberr part, the downside is it requires 96  instead of 75, you still need 20  though. So it's up to you which way you want to get there.

* If you want to skip that 20  too, you can use the "Antimatter Dynamo Box" from the Mileage shop.

  


Right Side* Regardless of which set you pick, they will all upgrade to the same level 100 sets.
* Accessory will upgrade to "Elementalist's Accessory Set". This set is not as great for DPS/syn classes, however with the epic rework, it got a small boost.
* Special Equipment will upgrade to "Normalizing Synchro Set". Similar to left side, this set is great for a straight forward upgrade.
* Very similar to upgrading Left Side, you get Prey Equipment from upgrading Regular Tayberr pieces (bought from the same NPC Joshua).
* You can upgrade by using "Chest of Power" in "Ashen Grave". It will require 140  and similar materials. Unlike Fiend War, each piece will take about 1 month worth of Prey raids.

* Again, same as upgrading Left Side, you can buy the recipe from raid shop or mileage shop to reduce material costs. You gonna need 190  instead of 140 though.

* Ever wonder how much effort is needed to make that weekly transfer? Wouldn't it be nice to be 12/12 in 3 months?
* Assuming you only have 156fp per alt, this article will show you how many characters you need to play.
* Too much reading? 👉 TL;DR 👈

Required Materials* The mats for weapon is a bit cheaper, but here I'll do the math for other slots.
* In a nutshell, 2 notable materials are 168 Epic Souls  and 125 Wisdom Crystal .

Epic Souls* How in the world can you get 168  in a week?
* Your 1st main source is from raid, capping weekly Undaunted Determination  will get you 40 . You can read more about it in this How to Cap Weekly Undaunted Determination post.
* 2nd main source is Dawning Crevice (DC), I only started collecting data for only 200 runs, so far, you can expect to get at least 8  per 50 dungeon clears (aka 25 characters), assuming you have the worst luck and not having any epic drops. I have details how to convert these materials into epic souls in my Gold Farming guide. Think of it this way, for every character you do DC on, that's enough mats for about 0.32 .

* So to get the remaining 128  in 7 days, you will need to do daily DC on at least 57 alts to get enough mats.
* The 3rd way for this to farm gold and buy Product of Wisdoms (PoW) then dissemble them. If farming DC on 57 alts is not enough work for you, the more stormy you farm, the more PoW you can buy and grind for more souls.
+ 156fp will only get you 19 stormy runs, and let's say you do your daily 2+2 and 2 DC runs, that'll leave you with 13 stormy runs per character.
+ Looking at my Stormy Route: Sirocco "Nerf" Debunked data, 13 runs will get you roughly 775k. With PoW price about 1 million gold each, you can expect to get about 3/4  per character.
+ If you add the average soul gain from DC to this method (0.32+ 0.75), you can expect to get about 1  per character (aka, do 2+2, then 2 DCs, then spent rest of fp on stormy, then sell all drop and ).
+ So if you're following this path instead, you can get 128  by doing about 18.3 alts per day. (Pick your poison, 18 alts on 2+2 DC stormy daily or 57 alts on just DC daily).

Wisdom Crystal* 125 Wisdom Crystal  is 12,500 Wisdom Crystal Fragment , which is about 1,785 needed per day.
* There're 4 main dungeon sources of : Guide of Wisdom, Basement of Pain, Black Shrine, and Oculus. Beside Guide of Wisdom, the other 3 dungeons give , which can be converted into  at 1:1 ratio from NPC Loton.
* Looking at my Black Shrine and Basement of Pain: Result of 1,000 Dungeon Runs data, you get about 61  per day, doing that 7 days a week and add reward from your 2 weekly Oculus runs (46  each run), you get about 518  per week per character.
* So 125  will require you to do daily 2+2 and weekly Oculus on about 24 characters. Assuming you don't do any Guide of Wisdom at all. That calculation doesn't include the 60fp needed for weekly Oculus runs per character, so you're looking at even more stormy farming.


TL;DR* To transfer 1 non-weapon level 100 epic per week, you will roughly need:
+ For : Cap 4,000  through raids. Then full 156fp burn on 18 alts daily or DC on 57 alts daily.
+ For : Do daily 2+2 and weekly Oculus on 24 alts.

* As you can see, the  is really the bottleneck in this process. Not many people do Oculus on 24 alts, let along waiting on pub parties to fill up.

* This article outlines some tips so you can get to the highest wave possible.

How Does This Dungeon Work?* Full detail about this event can be found in this Decisions unto Destiny event page.
* I will just briefly tell you know this work. When you enter the dungeon, you're basically fighting waves of enemies. The more waves you can survive, the more reward coins you get at the end. You will fight a boss every 10th wave.
* In the top right corner, you will see a count down, you don't have to kill everything on the map before the clock hit zero. However, if it hits zero, the next wave will come.

* After you finish the "Remaining Kills" (For example, 12 kills from the flag above), the game will give you 5 ability options to choose from. Again and again, you get to choose an ability after each wave.

* From the event page, there are 3 type of ability options to choose from:
+ Type 1: These increase your character stat (e.g. All attack, crit chance, attack speed, etc.)
+ Type 2: These increase your character skills (e.g. increase attack, range, decrease cooldown of a particular skill)
+ Type 3: These are random epic piece (e.g Natural Guardian, Centurion Hero, etc)

* As you can see, there're some RNG involved in this event, sometime you get good options to pick from and sometime you get jack nothing. But regardless, I will give you some recommendation on which one should you pick to help you get as close as wave 50 as possible.

General Strategy* What options should you pick LAST?
+ Critical Chance: When I first started doing this dungeon, I thought to myself, "Well, gear doesn't affect my stat, but if I can get my crit rate up, I can kill things faster". But I was wrong, although crit rate is important, it still doesn't give you the best benefit.
+ HP/MP regeneration: This usually only a problem during your first 10-20 waves, I found myself run low at 30-40% MP. From my runs, if you have to, 1 HP/MP regen should be enough to last the whole dungeon.
+ Movement/Casting/Attack Speed: This option is not bad, however, if you get "Full Plate Armor" piece as an option, pick that instead and it should provide you with plenty of speed.
+ Physical/Magical Defense: Personally, I don't recommend you pick this one. Higher wave mob (30+ wave) are really strong, most of them 1 shot you anyway. There're just way better options to pick.

* Which options should you pick FIRST and FOCUS on?
+ After looking though various Youtube videos, the main strategy is to pick and stack one skill as much as you can. So whenever you can, try to pick That Skill first.
+ Secondly, Epic pieces will give you huge boost. Many of them give you Skill Level (Centurion Hero ), Decrease Skill Cooldown (Eternally Flowing Path ), Super Armor & Speed (Full Plate Armor ), Skill Attack (Elemental Dropper ), many many more.
+ With mobs from wave 30+ getting more and more annoying, many of them stun and one-shot you. There are many instances where 20 of them stun me over and over, I was pretty much killed and couldn't do anything. As you can see, if you can get an epic that give you Super Armor, Speed or Invulnerability, try to grab those.
+ Lastly, All Attack +10% option is great to get too.

Example using Female Sader* Below are the options I picked during a run. I was able to get to wave 42 before getting one-shotted. Hopefully with enough practice and good RNG, I can get to wave 50.
* As you can see, I stacked Uriel's Ward  as much as I can. The range of this is skill is huge, it also provide I-frame for you. The more you stack this skill, you can just spam it.
* I also got plenty of epic pieces and Attack damage. I got some Physical/Magical Defense, Critical Chances as well because those are the only decent option during those waves.

TL; DR (Summary)* Sirocco Farming Improvements (April 1, 2021 update on KDnf)
+ 220 Petals to buy Sirocco Weapon Material (Residue).
+ 55 Petals to buy “Ark of Circulation”: combiner that fuses 3 Sirocco Epics (of any piece) to produce a random piece from the selected set (May produce the piece used to combine.)
- In other words, you have ⅓ chance to snipe a piece you want.

+ Defusing Sirocco Epic will be free
+ Cost of Sirocco Ditto will drop to 220 petals (from 437) and material needed to change ditto will drop to 55 petals (from 110)

* New Mechanics in Ozma Raid (Planned within First half of 2021)
+ “Sanity Level”: Every player will have a “Sanity Level” that Ozma will drain. Certain debuff “that will force players to completely change the game style” will be casted if the level drops to a certain level.
+ Interactive Difficulty selection: Raid members will be able to change the difficulty of raid interactively during the raid (Instead of choosing “Hard Ozma raid” at the start, the difficulty and the reward would fluctuate depending on path players take during the raid. I.E. skipping x maps will increase the raid difficulty to high, but doing y maps will decrease it back to normal, or even to an easy-mode raid.)
+ Reward Auction: Raids cleared with Hard difficulty will have a chance to encounter “Jackpot Reward” (on top of normal rewards that every member receives) that will be put up on auction within the raid. Players will bid gold to win the prize, and gold from the winning bid will be distributed among the raid.

* Xlation Note: From the language he uses, it seems like this “Mega Flip” will happen on top of normal gold cards.
+ My attempt as an analogy to Sirocco raid (100% MY GUESS):
+ Extra Account bound mats, Sirocco Epics, Monster Cards, Weapon Residue would be Normal Gold flip (players win individually)
+ Mythic and Primal Dream Weapons (PoW) would be put up on Auction.

Full Note* Greetings, This is Jeong Ho Kang, Lead Director of DnF
* First, we thank every adventurer playing and observing Dungeon and Fighter as it progresses.
* This Director’s Note will focus on improvements on Sirocco Farming and new mechanics currently under development for the upcoming (within first half of this year) Ozma raid .

Sirocco Farming Improvements* Considerable amount of time has passed since Sirocco Raid has been released, and many adventurers made significant progress in farming their gears.
* However, we acknowledge that many are struggling to graduate due to the RNG nature of the raid, as well as many newcomers who started farming later than others.

* With anticipation of the upcoming Ozma raid, we wanted many more people to attend the new raid with satisfactory gears. Thus, we allowed the players to buy Residue with a set amount of Petals, as well as introduce a method to fuse “deadweight pieces” into a random piece from the selected set.

* We also decreased the cost of Sirocco Ditto, materials needed to convert the ditto, and removed the petal cost to defuse Sirocco Epic, as an attempt to decrease the overall cost of changing Sirocco gears to the desired set.
* Above improvements will be implemented in Live server on April 1st, and we anticipate this to benefit not only those struggling, but also allow graduated characters to grow even stronger (optimize with stronger set).
* With more people trying their best to prepare their characters for the Ozma raid, we (neople) will also try our best to develop a high quality raid.

New Raid: Ozma Raid* We are developing multiple new mechanics in an attempt to appeal “Ozma” to as many adventurers as possible, from those who remember him in Otherverse dungeons to new adventurers who have never heard of an Apostle named Ozma.
* Today, I am introducing a few of the many systems we are currently developing.
* First, “Sanity Level” mechanic.
+ Adventurers fighting Ozma in “Dark Side” will be under the influence of Ozma. Each player will have its own “Sanity Level” gauge that will fluctuate depending on the battles fought against the mobs.
+ Players who lost sanity (gauge hits 0) will receive significant debuff that will put them in disadvantageous position, thus we expect the players to pay close attention to their gauge.
+ Additionally, we will implant various gimmicks to utilize the Sanity Level, one of which the raid (as a whole) can upgrade to soothe the subjugation process.
+ We are avoiding this system from becoming dull by only encouraging players to maintain high sanity. For example, certain stats (damages) would be amplified at low sanity (as a reward for taking high risk). We are striving this new mechanic to be as dynamic as possible.

* Next is the interactive difficulty selection, first introduced in “Dark Purgatory” dungeon.
+ Xlation note: Dark Purgatory has a mechanism where players choose the difficulty (up to 4 levels) depending on what path the party takes. Instead of choosing “Hard mode” at the start like P. War, every party starts at level 1, and will be given the option of increasing the difficulty to receive better rewards. Oculus has a similar mechanism where players can choose to skip Luiese or Roseberry to change the difficulty of Shoyun but it doesnt change the rewards. In Black Purgatory, and the Ozma raid, the party will receive additional rewards for taking the harder route.
+ We added an interactive method of difficulty to give players freedom to make decisions based on the current situation (being able to decide AFTER observing the power level and pattern proficiency of the party).
+ However, we noticed that the current system implanted in Black Purgatory provides an insufficient amount of freedom to make optimal decisions. In Ozma raid, we will allow players to not only increase the difficulty of the raid, but also an option to revert the choice to provide even more degree of freedom.
+ We are hoping players to take a shot at challenge mode without burden of risk.

* Finally, We are planning to introduce first ever (in DnF history) system: Raid Auction System.
+ Xlation note: This system has been in WoW for eons, but the raid leader was able to lead the auction (for whom to attend, and how the item and gold to be distributed, etc). I was told other kMMOs such as Lost Ark and Blade&Soul have similar systems… but there has always been some degree of controversy in each of the games. I am both excited and worried about this system, especially knowing how prevalent “sells” are in the endgame contents of DNF.
+ Will customers be able to attend the auction? Will they receive the cut of the winning bid? Would it be fair? Will “friendship” between static raid members be at risk? Who knows. We don’t even know if this system will be 100% automatic by the game, or raid leaders (or players) would have influence in the process.

* Throughout many raids, we found the need of raid scale “feedback\*” on top of the individual feedback that previous raids provided..
+ Xlation note: \*Kang uses word “feedback” to mean “rush of Adrenaline” or “sense of winning”

* Thus we are preparing to implant a Raid Auction system to Ozma raid.
* Normal Rewards will be provided to every participant similar to Sirocco raid, while the raid cleared in certain difficulty will drop a shared loot that can be auctioned among the raid participants. Player with the highest bid will win the item.
* Additionally, we are designing a system where the gold from the winning bid can be distributed among the raid members to allow other players to enjoy the sense of victory.
* On top of systems introduced in this note, we will try our best to make Dungeon and Fighter as enjoyable as possible to our adventurers.
* Thank you.

* Othello is old board game invented back in 1971, which is a version of the original Reversi game of the late 1800s. You can learn more about it in this wikipedia page.
* In a nutshell, when you place a piece down, any pieces of your opponent that are located in between your pieces will turn into yours. Using example below, when Red place a piece on C5, the blue pieces on D5 and E5 turns into red because they are "surrounded" by red on the ends (C5 and F6).

* So you keep playing until there are no more spaces to play. Then at the end, whoever has more pieces will win.
* This is a game strategy, and here I will show you some tips to help you win.

Tip #1: Prioritize the space you want to put your piece on* Generally, the edges of the board are your top priority, especially the corners.
* If you can, these corners should be your #1 pick, the reason is that there is no way you can lose that piece.
* Here's an example, I got my piece on the corner of A8, and it gave give me an advantage across the board, vertically horizontally and diagonally. So I put my piece on F3, and turn the entire row.

* Below is another example of Red player utilizing the edge pieces to overtake the whole row.

  
Tip #2: Avoid the RED Zones* Below are the red zones, where you should try your best to avoid playing your pieces on. The reason is that if you place your piece on these slots, you give your opponent the opportunity to take over the edges (remember tip #1?)
* HOLD ON, 8 of those slots are also the edges, which you told me to take priority on. Why you're telling me now that they are red zones?

  
* The reason is that if you put your piece there, now you opponent can have the chance to take the corner piece, which is the last thing you want. I'll give you an example.
* Starting from the left picture, the Red player thought that he could be smart and place the piece on H2, thus taking out 3 of my pieces (middle picture). However, by doing so, he gave me the opportunity to place my Blue piece on the corner of H1.

  
* So in the end, think of these 8 slots as more of Yellow zone instead of Red. They are good to take advantage of, but at the same time, proceed with caution.

Hero's Warfront* This is a 6-week event dungeon that's a PVP type, consists of 2 teams of up to 5 members each.
* Existing equipment, avatars, and talismans do not apply.
* This of this like your typical DOTA or League of Legend type of game, where your objective is to destroy the other team's main tower. The map will look like this

* Map Keys:
+ (1) is your main tower, destroying this will win the game. This is also where you will spawn if you die during battle.
+ (2) is your sub tower. You must destroy at least the top or bottom sub tower before you can damage the main tower. This sub tower will also be the place that spawn mob to fight along with you. Killing these mob will give you gold to buy equip to get stronger. Ya know, exactly DOTA style.
+ (3) is the location where the mob from both sides fight
+ (4) is your free champion, like the jungle mobs from LoL
+ (5) and (6) are like your damage and defense boost.

* Again, killing mobs and champions will give you gold so you can buy equipment. These increase stat like Attack Damage, Crit Chance, Attack Speed, Movement Speed, Physical/Magical Defense, Max HP/MP, etc.

How This Dungeon Work?* "Crypts of Fallen Souls" is a new dungeon added to "Valley of Fallen Souls" area.
* Up to 6 characters can register to enter the dungeon per week, and it looks like the rewards are account bound but not shared between characters.

  
* This dungeon has 100 floors. Once you entered, your basic objective is to clear each floor and get as high as you can. Unfortunately, you only given 1 min to clear each floor, so looks like this content won't be easy at all.

  
* The reward concept is similar to "Spirit Heaven", the system will give you a rank and the corresponded amount of "Ancient Gold Coin" depends on how high you got.
* You can retreat at any time, but you will have to restart at floor 1, and the floor you have cleared won't give you any coin. Same for if you fail, you will restart at floor 1.
* So in a nutshell, you can use 6 characters per week to gather up to the max of 1,500 Ancient Gold Coin.

Ancient Gold Coin Shop* Random level 100 epic weapon, cost 2,250 coins. Note that they have each box for each weapon type too.
* Random level 100 epic/mythic Armor/Accessory/Special Equipment, cost 2,250 coins. YES, you can get mythic from this.
* +23 Elemental Damage for Accessory, each color corresponds to an element type (Fire/Water/Light/Shadow), cost 900 coins.
* All Elemental Damage +12 for Weapon, cost 900 coins.
* All Elemental Damage +21 for Accessory, cost 900 coins.
* Str/Int/Vit/Spi Stat for Accessory, cost 900 coins.

Lastly* The coin itself has a description that it can be used to buy  Ore of Despair,  Pupil of Fear and  Petal Quartz. So who knows if this will ever get to other game version.

  
EDIT 4/20/2021* New items had been added to the shop. You can now buy   .
+ 1,200  for 250 Ore of Despair (limit 16 purchases per character).
+ 2,400  for 1 Pupil of Fear (limit 4 purchases per character).
+ 2.400  for 22 Petal Quartz (unlimited purchase).
* I also changed the name for this dungeon to Crypts of Fallen Souls, I think this it fits better.

+ 8,400 , which is enough for 14 Ghent pieces. Not really worth it since you can farm all 12 pieces in like 2 days, so there's no reason to wait 28 days for this.
+ 2,800 , which is enough for about 5 non-weapon swap pieces. This is probably your second best option if one of your alt still need buff swap pieces.

* With rewards from 30 mins, you can get:
+ 2,800 , which is plenty to upgrade one 95 epic to 100 epic. This is your best option, looking at my 1,000 Black Shrine & Basement of Pain runs, this many mats is equivalent to about 46 days worth of doing 2+2 on one character. So if you're new and only have 1 character, this is 46 days of progress in 28 days.
+ 1,400 , which is not even enough to buy 1 Dark Dimension Piece. Looking at my Dark Dimension small data, this is only 12 days worth of progress. So this option is not recommended.
+ 2,240 , which is only enough to buy 1 legendary piece. Looking at my Land of Memory and Bottomless Tunnel data, this is about 3.7 days worth of progress. So, yeah, terrible option to pick.

* With  rewards from 60 mins, you can get: 83 days worth of Contract, 280 , or 84 . Really up to you. Contract is probably the best option, creature food and potions are cheap to get from package's bonuses.
* With rewards from 120 mins, you can get 560 , 84 , or 28 . I think the Stone is probably your best option. If you were gonna buy the  from the action hall and convert to 560 , that's about 26 million gold worth.

* As a Beat-'em-up MMORPG game, DFO has a function that allowing you to manually assign commands to all your skills.
* Here I'll go over some simple tips & tricks so you can get the most benefit out of this system.

Why Would You Use This?* You only have 12 quick slots. Well, every class in the game has at least 1 buff skills, among many many other skills. So you will not always have enough space to put them.
* Take Female Nen for example, she has at least 3 buffs that I cast at the beginning of every dungeon . If I put those 3 on the hot bar, where would I put the other skills.
* How about Female Spitfire, I need to cast 3 buffs , so there's no way I would have enough space for other skills if I put them on the hot bar. If you play sader classes, you will even need more manual skills.

How to Assign Manual?* First, click on a skill, then click "Change".
* A window will open where you can put in whatever manual you in it.

General Principles* A manual input usually contain a set of arrow key and one letter.
* So which letter can you use? There're only 4 letters you can use. They're letter used for "Skill", "Skill2", "Normal Attack", and "Jump" skills. You can see which those letters are under "Settings" then "Hotkey Settings".

* As you can see, my "Skill", "Skill2", "Normal Attack", and "Jump" skills are Z, Space, X, and C. So I can only use those for manual input.
* What do input usually consist of? In a nutshell, at least 1 arrow key & 1 letter. For example, most of my character's buff skills are "↑+Space"
+ You can register up to to 4 arrow keys, so go ham and be creative. You can use whatever input as long as you follow those simple principles. For example, "←↓→→ +C", "←↓→+Z, "↓↓↑↑+Space", etc.

* Can you just put a letter? Yes, a manual input can just be a letter (for example, Z or Space). HOWEVER, you CANNOT use Normal Attack key and Jump key by themselves.

What Key To Avoid* I would say don't use the "Jump" key as an input because it can get confusing because sometime in dungeon, you want to jump to avoid certain gimmicks.
* I would avoid using "→→ + Normal Attack" as a manual, especially if you're a gunner. Because that's the combination for doing run and dash move.
  
Which Skill?* Which skill should you use manual inputs? Generally speaking, buff skills are the ones you don't really want to put on hot bar. I put all my buff skill on all my character as "↑+Space".
* High cooldown skills are good options, such a 1st 2nd or 3rd Awakening skills. I have the majority of my Awakening skills as "↑↑+C" and "↓↓+C".
* For example: My female sader, I used "↓↓+C" for 3A, then when that's going, I used "↑↑+C" for 1A.
ProTip* Not many people know this, but this system can register an arrow as HOLD. On the command, you will see it register as "↑&" (right pic) instead of "↑+" (left pic).
* To register this, simple press the arrow key, hold it for a few seconds, then register you letter key. Note that if you use this hold function, you can only use ONE arrow key.

* Why does this hold function matter? Well, you can use this as a "combo" manual. In stead of using 2 different manuals for 2 skills, you can now just use 1 similar input.
* For example: For my Female Nen, I used "↑+Space" for , then "↑&Space" for .
+ Remember the Hold function? After casting , because I already have my finger on the ↑ arrow (it will register it as a hold), now all I need is to press "Space" again for .
+ So instead of using like "↑+Space" and "↑↑+Space" for 2 skills, I pressed "↑+Space+Space" and casted 2 skills spontaneously.
* Here's another example using THREE skills:
+ I used "↑+Space" for , "↓+Space" for , then "↓&Space" for .
+ Why the Down arrow? because after casting , the Down function is "Neutral Bullet" which increases Skill attack.

+ So "↑+Space" to cast , then since my finger already on ↓ arrow after picking the element, I pressed Space to cast , THEN since my finger already HOLD ↓ arrow, I pressed Space again to cast .
+ There you go, I pressed "↑+Space+↓+Space+Space" to cast 3 skills spontaneously like a pro.

Meister's Laboratory* Dev's Note: The new advanced dungeon, Meister's Lab, has been updated.
+ The secret project, code-named Gáe Bulga, carried out by 7 Meisters to defeat Bakal, eventually started to move in the wrong direction due to Gizel's intervention. Adventurers must defeat Gizel's powerful weapons, including Gáe Bulga, with the help of the 7 Meisters.
+ Starting with this Meister's Laboratory, I would like to tell you about the changes in the difficulty direction of advanced dungeons in the future.
+ Existing advanced dungeons are designed to be able to proceed without unreasonable difficulty in clearing them once the entry is possible. The reason was to minimize the hurdles for entering and clearing content in the early stages of growth and farming.
+ However, the advanced dungeons that will be updated from Meister's Lab in the future aim to become content that you want to challenge and clear. For this reason, advanced dungeons are expected to be applied as a "minimum admission standard" rather than a "appropriate playable standard" as a challenging content.
* Story: A laboratory where 7 Meister finally conducted the secret project "Code Name Gáe Bulga" to defeat Bakal.
+ While developing Gáe Bulga, numerous security systems and weapons were deployed to fend off possible intruders, and it consists of a maze-like complex passageway.
+ Except for Eternal Flame, who guards the laboratory with the 7 Meister , no one will be able to pass through this territory safely.​

* Arts & Illustrations:
+ Main Art: 1024 ✕ 768 | 1280 ✕ 1024 | 1680 ✕ 1050 | 1920 ✕ 1080 | 3200 ✕ 1800
+ Monster: GB-1 Haps | GB-2 Identate | GB-3 Energi | GB-4 Diregent | GB-5 Feluhan Stark
+ Area: Gáe Bulga Field | Meister's Lab | Weapons Depot | Power Charging Room | Energy Production Room | Automatic Response Room | Gáe Bulga Boarding Point
+ NPC: Meister Jenne | Meister Eldirh | Meister Rati | Meister Teneb | Meister Volgan | Meister Curio | Meister Odruz

* Fame Requirement: 26,933 (Normal) 31,795 (Expert) 34,198 (Master)
* Entry Material:  Meister's Laboratory Admission Ticket + 30 FP
+ Each difficulty will have their own ticket. If you buy the Expert ticket, you can also enter normal mode. If you buy Master ticket, you can also enter expert and normal mode.

* Dungeon Information:
+ Time Limit: A 30-minute time limit applies at the start of the content. As long as you do not leave the party, you can continue to challenge for a limited time.
+ Dungeon Abandon: The party leader can retreat from the dungeon using the retreat button on the status board. When retreating, re-entry to the dungeon is not possible for a certain period of time. When retreating, the skill cooldown is maintained. After retreating, you can select 'Abandon mission' through NPC 'Meister Curio'. All dungeon progress will reset and entry materials will not be returned.
+ Combat Restrictions: When using coins in the dungeon, the skill cooldown is maintained



Dungeon Progression* Operation Deterrence:
+ Players can use the EF-MK1 vehicle to block the movement of Gáe Bulga.
+ One EF-MK1​ vehicle can be boarded by one driver/one anti-aircraft gunner by entering the 'Z' key, respectively.
- Up to 2 vehicles will be prepared.
- If only the driver is in the EF-MK1​ vehicle, the AI ​​will fire instead.
- The vehicle's defense changes according to the driver's reputation.
- The vehicle's attack power is changed according to the anti-aircraft gunner's reputation.

+ You can block the movement of the Gáe Bulga by reducing the HP of one of the parts to 0.
+ You can identify your vehicle with the icon ().
+ When the vehicle's health is exhausted, all players in the vehicle will die. Players can be revived using coins (player in driver's seat will get priority).

+ When the security system is successfully hacked, some bosses will have a functional error effect.
+ For functional errors, attack power increase and defense decrease are applied at each stage.
+ If the security system hack fails, nothing happens.

Level 110 Normal Dungeon Farming Improvements(Added with Live Server)* Dev's Note: We have confirmed that those who develop characters with an adventurer fame of less than 24,000 as their mains are having difficulties in the process of growing the option level for 105 Epic.
+ In particular, we identified the most problematic part was that it was difficult to figure out how to efficiently grow with several equipment already acquired.
+ Accordingly, it has been decided to add one new Level 105 Epic equipment for each part (excluding weapons). These equipment are "only for optional growth materials", and drop more in general dungeons with slayer difficulty or lower.

* 11 new level 105 epic equipment are added for the purpose of "only for optional growth materials". The equipment has the following features:
+ There is 1 type each in 11 slots other than weapons.
+ There are no other options other than the damage increase option.
+ When used as a material in the option growth system, the option level and experience are added to this equipment as it is, regardless of the equipment's options.
+ It can be obtained from the following dungeons and does not affect the drop rate of existing epic equipment.

Item Recommendation Board* Dev's Note: ​After reaching level 110, the item recommendation board allows you to check recommended items based on class, and was added in anticipation that it will be helpful for farming. We are planning to provide various conveniences in the future.
* The item recommendation bulletin board is divided into an item tab and a combination search tab, and items are recommended in different ways. This board will be available in various endgame dungeon areas.
* Item tab:
+ The Item tab shows recommended items for each part based on the class, and you can also check the recommended items of other characters by changing the class.

* Item selection:
+ You can select an item by clicking the left mouse button, and you can check the acquisition information of the selected item.
+ Also, a menu for "Combination Search" is activated when right-clicking the mouse.
+ If you select 'Combination Search', you can check various combinations based on the selected item.

* Combination search:
+ Combination search allows you to check various combinations based on the selected item.

* Check the combination:
+ Based on the selected item, the item is recommended after searching for an item with the same remaining parts.
+ Recommended item efficiency is not an indicator of the best efficiency, so only use it for reference purposes.

* Hashtags:
+ You can check the characteristics of the combined item with a hashtag that is duplicated in the combined searched item.
+ Non-duplicate hashtags are not displayed.

+ Dev's Note: To solve such a problem, it has been improved so that the option is activated even when attacking independent object. However, in the case of the "option to reduce the enemy's remaining HP" in the process of improvement, it can inflict strong damage to the enemy even when the character is unable to fight. General Information* Raid: Ozma of Chaos has been added.
* Just like other raid, you can enter once per day, up to twice per week.
* This is a two phase 12-man raid, and you have 50 mins limit to clear. 30 mins for phase 1. 20 mins for phase 2. 5 mins limit as break in between phases.
* Since adventure reputation system replaced Exorcism system, you will need 10,349 reputation or higher to enter.
* There's a 4-coin limit per dungeon, and skill cooldown will not reset when using coin (Exception: )
* There are 5 limited consumables you can purchase through NPC to be used in raid:
+ Recovery Potion: Restored 30% HP/MP. Cures all harmful effects.
+ Strength Potion: Damage +30% for 30 seconds.
+ Blessing Potion: If die within 20 mins of use, you will resurrect with 1/3 of max HP.
+ Invisible Potion: For 3 seconds if used.
+ Purification Potion: Restores 10 rationale points.

* LIVE Server: Lupsong buff added (STR/INT only)



Phase 1 Operation Black Earth: Decent of Annihilation* Phase 1 consists of 3 crossroads: Destruction, Despair, and Terror. It also has 1 special dungeon Tower of Revelation, and 1 camp.
+ The goal is to clear the main dungeon, Holy Land of Fear, in Crossroad of Terror. In order to enter Crossroad of Terror, you needs to clear the other 2 Crossroads first.
+ Camp is where your character stay when not entering dungeons. Think of it like a waiting area
+ Tower of Revelation is a special dungeon that spawns negative effects periodically every time it comes up. If the revelation occurs 3 times, the raid will reset.

* Each Crossroad also has 4 sub-dungeons: Main, Liberation, Chaos, and Secondary.
+ - Main dungeons: These will clear the crossroad
+ - Liberation dungeons: You must clear this to enter the main dungeon
+ - Chaos dungeons: This raises the chaos level of the raid (aka difficulty)
+ - Secondary Dungeons: This provide buff effects for the raid when cleared.



Phase 2 Operation Ellerinon: Second Coming of Chaos* Throne of Chaos, the goal is to clear this dungeon to complete the raid. It consists of 3 dungeons. The bosses in there share the same HP value, and the damage inflicted is shared. (just like Sirocco raid where you fight 3 forms)
* Special Dungeon: City of Tragedy. Once cleared, you can force Ozma to enter a special state (Groggy???). You can only enter this dungeon once you have completed certain conditions.
* Secondary Dungeon: Garden of Mirrors. Once cleared, it will increase recovery speeds for the people at camp, and also gives damage buffs for everyone. Someone must be fighting Ozma in Throne of Chaos for other party to enter this dungeon.  
  



Rationale System

* Think of this as your sanity level. Everyone will have their own gauge. This gauge reduces when hit with boss attacks. When it hits zero, you will lose your mind and start to threaten the other members. You can see everyone's gauges by the orange/purple indicator underneath their party name.

  
* When your gauge hits zero, you will be teleported to a limbo place where you have to counter attack Ozma's illusion 3 times in order to regain your conscious mind and come back to reality.
* If you fail to counter attack within the time limit in limbo, you die. If you success, you come back with your gauge turned purple and at 50%. If your purple gauge hit zero again, you die.
* If everyone gauge in the party hit zero and they're in limbo at the same time, you lose the boss fight immediately.
* This gauge can be further upgraded/modified with sigil reward from Ozma raid through Black Earth Engraving System.



Black Earth Engraving System* The sigil you get from Ozma will look like the marks below.

* They can be used to upgrade and activate Ozma raid's exclusive stat. Think of it as a way to improve your own Sanity Gauge and to "gear" yourself up for harder Ozma difficulty.

* There are 3 type of sigils:
+ Destruction Sigil: Increase Max Sanity Gauge
+ Horror Sigil: Increase Max HP
+ Despair Sigil Increase Damage when Sanity is below certain amount

* Starting Price of 1mil or 3mil depending on the item. 15 seconds to make a bid and timer resets after every bid.  Each bid must be at least 5% higher than the current highest bid.

The Holy Grail of Faith(aka Ozma Epic Reroll)* You can combine 2 Ozma Epic for a new random Ozma Epic. However you can exclude 6 Ozma Epic from the result pool.
* If the new Ozma Epic is not the piece you wanted, you may add another Ozma Epic to combine with your new Ozma Epic while excluding another 6 Ozma Epic from the result pool.
* This can be done until 24 Ozma Epic is removed from the result pool for the piece you want (This would mean 5 Ozma Epics are needed for 1 guaranteed piece you want)
* Once you decide to receive the Epic you rerolled, the exclusion count will reset back to 0

Possession Gold Expansion  
* If the personal inventory is expanded, the maximum amount of gold that character can hold is expanded. 600 million golds at slot 90, 800 million golds at slot 100.
* If the account vault is expanded, the amount of gold that can be stored is expanded. 400 / 500 / 600 / 700 / 800 mil at slot 56 / 64 / 72 / 80 / 84, respectively.



Adventurer Reputation* The Current Existing 'Exorcism' stat will be replaced by 'Explorer Reputation'
+ Dungeons will not penalize players for not having the recommended amount of Explorer Reputation unlike Exorcism
+ But certain dungeons will require at least a specified amount of Explorer Reputation to enter (see Restriction below)

* This is a special event livestream on KDnF Twitch channel with their head director Yoon. You can watch the interview in this Youtube video.
* This interview was about 3 hours long, and the author would like to express special thanks to u/halfmango08 for the amazing translation.

First Half-Year Feedback* Growth System:
+ The equipment level growth and transfer system itself was the first system introduced in Dungeon & Fighter, so we approached it too carefully. After much thought, the number of growth has increased more than tenfold since the update of the equipment growth system. He expressed his honest opinion, saying what would have happened if these changes had been corrected two to four weeks earlier.
+ In addition, as an apology for having to rely on 'transfer growth' for equipment option levels at the beginning of the season, we are preparing a plan to calculate the golden beryl used for the 110 level transfer and refund 50% of the amount. It is at the stage of considering the payment method of beryl and promised to refund on July 17th.

* Transfer/Growth UI:
+ Because the UI of the growth and transfer system was not intuitive, there were too many cases where precious enchantments such as reinforcement, amplification, and enchantment disappeared in one day by placing the material equipment and the equipment to be received in reverse.
+ He had a policy of recovering as much as possible from such cases, but there were so many cases that the workload was overloaded. Accordingly, along with a major UI reorganization, the system will be improved so that equipment inheritance can be carried out at once.
* Neutralization System:
+ We plan to reorganize the "neutralization system" that harms the foundation between characters. He frankly stated that the system that reflects his greed was correct. He said that he wanted to revive the system that was alienated from the boss monster, which was armed with various defense conditions such as immunity to status abnormalities, impossible to hold, and invincibility in order to avoid situations where monsters were unilaterally hit.
+ However, it is also true that the meta has changed rapidly after the maximum level expansion, and the actual dealing gap between characters who are well-adapted and those who are not is too large. It is difficult to directly adjust the character's balancing for each dungeon or item change, and it is difficult to directly modify the character's unique characteristics because it has to be respected.
+ Therefore, the neutralization system itself is completely modified. It is reorganized so that the neutralization gauge can be cut even with a normal attack, and in the case of neutralization-type abnormalities, the gauge can be attacked regardless of weakness. In addition, he explained that he thinks that the neutralization state can play a similar role to the groggy time in the future, such as a significant decrease in the neutralization gauge when the monster's pattern is broken.

* Character Balancing:
+ Skill customizing gear such as talisman and decisive weapons have the merit of being creative and fun, but they also have the problem of characters being skewed when those gears disappear. As weapons would only last a season, they wanted to try something more bold and if necessary move some of its options to the characters via balancing. We realize this hasn’t worked out, and we're sorry.
+ In addition, they plan to raise the weapon options for classes with an excessively low use rate for Decisive Weapon, and downgrade the weapon options for some classes with too high use rates. The content will be updated as soon as July 7th.

+ The character values ​​themselves are also partially adjusted. Asura, whose own performance is strong, will be slightly downgraded, and character balancing will be carried out for about 7 classes , including Troubleshooter, Male Ranger, and Dark Knight.
+ Lower difficulties don’t have enough buffers, higher difficulties don’t have enough DPS. Dungeons cannot be balanced without buffers in account as they give so much dmg (almost 10 times with base buff, 20 times with 1a).
+ This will be drastically reorganized so that you can feel the play experience equivalent to that of a dealer when playing solo. It is scheduled to be renewed in September, and until then, a cool-time reduction buff will be provided to the buffer group to supplement their solo play ability.

* Gear Theme:
+ It was also mentioned that only certain item combinations are being used. Reorganized to reduce the firepower gap between items. Representatively, the  Golem's Keystone Ring is a powerful piece of equipment that can be mixed with the Akan theme, and the  Unknown Golden Stone is reorganized as a cornerstone of the advanced level enhancement theme.
+ Some setups (like sleep and petrification) have been designed with future contents such as Ispins and Bakal raid in mind, but obviously they haven’t been able to serve the current meta and have been neglected.
+ More gear balance incoming to completely revamp unused gears. Internal testing shows that many weaker setups will be vastly improved to be not far behind MP consume + ailment setup (current meta setup).

* Level 110 Dungeons:
+ Nassau forest is run vastly more than any other dungeon as its mobs have less HP than those of the other dungeons. Furthermore, the belt and shoes of the MP consume pieces also drop in Nassau. Dungeons will be nerfed/rebalanced to reduce players’ fatigue and alleviate this problem.
+ Advanced dungeons improvement: golden beryls will be usable to buy the tickets to reduce reliance on burning through fp in normal dungeons to get play points. Tradable golden beryls will also drop guaranteed to stabilize the economy.
+ Advanced dungeon expansion: Master difficulty will be updated in the future to improve its playability at the point where it starts lagging behind the legion dungeons. Tickets will have effects imbued that may improve rewards, buff players and enemies. Won’t be a ‘new’ content that must be played.
+ Meister's Lab: Was harder than it should’ve been as they changed its design from a weekly dungeon to an advanced dungeon during development. Will be massively nerfed to better fit the position & let the players have their revenge.


Second Half-Year Roadmap

June 30th(Multi-thread client improvement ).embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }


July 7th(Ispins, Stormwrath, Dungeon & Life, Advanced Dungeons Improvement, Training Room Renewal)* Legion Dungeon: Stolen Land, Ispins:
.embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }+ An adventurer who pursued Sirocco's thoughts meets the cruelest era in the history of the heavens. As the first Legion dungeon, it is a new advanced dungeon classification with strong named and 1:1 battles as the main, and potions and coin restrictions like raids.
+ You can select a mission before starting a battle, and depending on this, you can get an advantage for monsters or for allies. You can also select the difficulty level in advance to increase the amount of rewards.

+ The core rewards of Ispins Dungeon is the 'fusion system'. We focused on making the character stronger without compromising the existing equipment settings. In addition, in the dungeon reward, fusion equipment does not appear at all, and the "Complete Price System" is introduced, which can only be purchased by collecting materials.

 + A new fixed option Epic is also added. A powerful item that supports the previously neglected equipment theme is expected to appear. On the other hand, custom epics are not newly added, but instead, existing custom epic equipment appears with a higher probability.

+ The entry system uses a system similar to the existing advanced dungeon, which allows you to enter a certain number of times per week rather than an admission ticket. Can enter as party. Solo mode available. Once a week per character.
+ The difficulty level (requires 33,043 fames) is not much higher than that of the existing dungeons, but will consist around Meister's Laboratory expert and master level.

* Stormwrath:
+ Instead of a fixed number of entries per week, this dungeon consumes no play points, has good fatigue efficiency, and has a higher level of equipment options than other dungeons in the same class. The existing dungeon resources will be recycled as an 'intermediate dungeon', which means between a normal dungeon and an advanced dungeon.
+ It consists of two difficulty levels of 12,000 and 25,000 fames, so it is a great help in advancing to advanced dungeons.

* Dungeon & Life:
.embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }+ It is a place where you can take a breather from DFO, the traditional battlefield that grows villages by acquiring materials and building buildings through activities such as gathering, fishing, farming, and harvesting through Dungeon & Life. It will be updated on July 7th.
+ Among them, you can also create consumables that help in battle. You can also play new content along with new consumables such as potions that restore allies or potions that cause status ailments.

* Advance Dungeon Improvements:
+ Advanced dungeon admission tickets are reorganized so that they can be purchased with Golden Beryl. Also, if you clear the advanced dungeon, there is a 100% chance to get a certain amount of Flawless Golden Beryl. An advanced dungeon card book will also be added so that you can continue to obtain financial benefits when playing advanced dungeons.

* Improvement of Training Room:
+ Completely revamp the training room, which is one way to measure damage. The type of monster and the battle situation can be created as an actual level 110 dungeon environment.
+ The ability to retain the original enchantment, material, and equipment option level even if the equipment is replaced in the training room allows you to experience firsthand how powerful it will be in practice when new equipment is acquired

* Neutralization System renewal, Golden Beryl sale Decisive/Source Weapon adjustment also carried out in this date.
* More improvement carried out on July 21th



August/September* Character Renewal & Balancing on August 4th. Bakal Raid Part 1 (weekly dungeon) on August 25th. Bakal Raid Part 2 (actual raid) on September 22nd
* Bakal Raid, scheduled to be updated in August, will be added in two installments.
+ Normal difficulty, 'Mechanical Revolution: Open War', can be challenged by 1 to 4 players, and is designed to be cleared more easily by adventurers who are difficult to challenge advanced difficulty or have difficulty in raid structure.
+ The advanced difficulty, 'Mechanical Revolution: Bakal Raid' is a raid that deals with Bakal in earnest, and 12 people will challenge it together.

.embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }* Main reward: 4 new weapons, 5 types of fusion armor, and 11 types of fixed optional epic equipment (one for each part) will be introduced. Convergence equipment can be acquired regardless of difficulty, so it will faithfully serve as a cornerstone for challenging advanced levels of difficulty.


October(Advanced Dungeon Expansion, 16:9 widescreen, PVP season 8)* Advanced Dungeon Expansion:
+ It is scheduled to be updated around October, and at that point, the equipment level is already high and the reason to return is lost. If you use an additional Lion Core to the existing Master Difficulty Ticket, it will be changed to an admission ticket with 4 enhancement options.
+ Two reward enhancement effects, one character enhancement effect, and one monster enhancement effect are added, and of course, among the reward enhancement effects, there is a function that allows the equipment option level to appear at a higher level.

* 16:9 Widescreen:
+ Wide mode is officially supported, providing a wider screen that can be enjoyed in a PC environment. You can see a more detailed and majestic village, and even in the dungeon, colorful patterns and various elements of monsters that were not previously hidden or invisible appear, allowing you to experience a more lively dungeon.

.embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }* PVP Season 8:
+ Introduces a system that can reverse the battle pattern by applying a powerful buff to the character when it enters below a certain HP. In addition, most of the skills that were not available for existing characters are unlocked, and blades and assaults are added as new characters.


NovemberCharacter Renewal / Balance,  Archmage's Dimensional Corridor* Archmage's Dimensional Corridor:
+ It is a content in which a group of adventurers who were traveling through the dimension after the battle with Bakal arrive at a place called the "Library of Memory", peering into their memories and passing through trials.
+ Like Ispins, this is the second Legion dungeon with weekly entry counts. It appears on a lower difficulty level than the raid, and for users who have not yet entered the raid, it is possible to raise the equipment level, and for users who have already entered, it is being conceived as content that will help supply and demand goods.



December(Level 1~100 Scenarios Renewal)* Whenever the maximum level is expanded, the story of Dungeon & Fighter is rearranged in such a way that it is added to the existing story. Even after reaching the highest level, the equipment and materials used are reorganized so that they can be obtained from level 1 instead of level 100, and the overall story breathing is also uniformly rearranged.


Other Changes* Missions and Play Points:
+ To reduce fatigue in general dungeons, the efficiency of limited missions will be greatly increased to reduce fatigue. Play points are also earned through missions rather than by consuming fatigue in regular dungeons. It allows you to acquire play points that were previously earned when you exhausted your fatigue in a day just by performing a mission.
+ It solves the phenomenon that only specific dungeons run by allowing unique Epics obtained from general dungeons to be randomly dropped in advanced dungeons as well as from specific named/bosses. In the case of Heroes Mode, we plan to reduce the HP increase for each difficulty level so that you can experience the feeling of becoming stronger.
* Meister's Lab:
+ Change the position to a dungeon that can be cleared more easily and has a good reward. Overall, the HP was lowered by 10% and the 12 o'clock room where I felt all kinds of negative experiences called 'Pork Cutlet Hammer', 'Identitate' dramatically reduces HP by about 80% so that I can pass easily.

* Character Retouching:
+ Seem like they're bringing the Dnf Mobile version to PC?

* Custom Legendaries Improvement:
+ Custom Legendaries will get an option reroll system, options can be rerolled a limited number of times. Reroll count will reset upon being resealed



Q&A * Should buffers farm multiple sets for buffing & damage after the revamp?
+ No, they’ll make sure the class & gears balancing will prevent this.

* Will dungeon & life consumables be tradable?
+ Yes they will be tradable.

* +14 reinforce & +12 amp for clears kek.
+ No, Bakal raid will never be balanced around amps

* Farming custom epics is too hard.
+ I agree, we’ll eventually add more sources to farm it. If necessary we’ll also consider and add new systems for it. Also they have no plans of adding new custom epics.

* PVP arena too small.
+ With 16:9 widescreen update they’ll improve PVP visuals as well.

* Male Slayer / Female Fighter new sprites when (DFO mobile sprites)
+ They’re working on it. There are a crapton of sprites so it’s taking some effort, but they are working hard. Very hard. Probably next year. In case anyone asks: no it won’t be some paid thing, it’ll be an actual, free update.

* In order to keep this article short and sweet, I will assume you already know what Arad Pass works and what the general rewards are.

Free players will get rewards on the Left Column, Plus players get rewards all from free players plus the Middle Column, and Royal players get rewards from all 3 column.
* This season is similar to season 8 is that it only have 50 levels instead of 80.

  
What's New?* Comparing to season 8, nothing really new. Since this is released with the Stolen Land Ispins update, they added Scattered Energy to the list of bonus reward when clearing dungeon. Beside that, you get a bunch of  Golden Beryls,  Ryan Cores, and  Harmony Crystals.
* At level 10, Plus players get  100% +10 Equipment Enhancement Ticket. Royal players also get  Petit Shark Creature Box. No stat with +315 fame.

  
* At level 20, Royal players will get  100 Golden Beryl. Royal players also get   Master Kaleido box.

* At level 30, Royal players will get   Master Kaleido box. Royal players also get  Gorgeous Emblem boxes (probably equivalent to Emblem+ in DFOG)
* At level 40, Royal Pass get  RANDOM Avatar Full Set Box, which is similar to season 6

+ + 20 All attribute
+ +35 Physical / Magic / Independent Attack
+ +80 STR/INT
+ +60 VIT/SPI
+ +5% Physical/Magical Critical Chance
+ +10% Town Movement Speed
+ +325 Fame

* The following are confirmed to be released on the next weekly maintenance (July 12th).

Content* LEVEL 110 CAP is here. All information can be found in this Level 110 Expansion category.

Events* KDnF version of 110 cap events

+ Reward include +12 Reinforce Ticket

Sales* Hyperdimension Arad Package (KDnF version here) along with Hyperdimension Pass

* Danji Pot system with new animation (Introduced by YJ, DFO Sale Designer)
+ This is the system that will be replacing Lost Treasure. It is here to make it more friendly to luckly and unlucky players, and the main goal is to make sure there's a minimum return safeguard.
+ Skeleton key will no longer available to purchase. Your existing keys will NOT expire, and you can convert them to Danji pot in Seria's room at conversion rate of 3 key to 1 pot. The reason being it takes 3 key to open 1 LT, where you only need 1 pot to open each pot. These Danji pot can be dropped in dungeon just like Skeleton Key.
+ Originally with LR, you can only open 1 at the time. Here you can pick to open 1 time or 10 times.
+ You can also select the Danji level, which relate the chance of the key items. Higher level will require more Danji pots to open (e.g. level 2 need 2 pots, level 3 needs 3 pots)
+ New Danji Stack system also added. Each open will gain stack, and you get reward depends on your milestone. These stack rewards are NOT just one time. When you max the gauge, it resets and you can get rewards all over again. These stack rewards are TRADABLE. These stack rewards are seasonal and will be changed after a certain period (Some simple math here, 942 stacks will need 74,418 Cera, which is about $745 USD).

Epic Road* Straight off the bat they give you 500 Time's Guide Stone. You can use them to run 2 event dungeon: Dimension and Corridor

+ This dungeon has increased chance of epic and mythic items.

+ The dungeon also drop Growth Fragment  which basically used to level up your alt. The amount of EXP  it gives depends on the level range.

* Corridor Dungeon:
+ This dungeon is similar to Dimension dungeon. It still drop   and has higher chance of dropping epic mythic than regular Guide of Wisdom.

Voyager Treasure Chest* This is a sale package. Think of this like the Lost Treasure 2.0 and you have the option of buying 1 box, 10 boxes, or 30 boxes pack.

When the gauge hit 100%, they give you the  on your next box. This box has +10 ~ +12 Amp Tickets at various percent success rate (from 10% to 90%).

* The original idea of DFOArchive is a place where you can find guides and learn about the game. So in the beginning, New Player! Start Here page was created as an index page to quickly guide players through the game.
* Looking back, although this page is useful, I thought it's a bit barebone. So I want to expand it to the next level through the inspiration of choco's blog.
* When you look this blog page, it includes the most basic information about DFO for new players. Things like how to navigate UI, what are cubes, how to use auction hall, how to trade with other players, etc. So I want to make a page just like it and this page would eventually be where new players can go to to learn about the game.
* This project will be called "DFOlmanac" which is a combination of DFO and Almanac (I thought it's a clever name).
* What the heck is an Almanac? it's basically a guide for farmer that has lots of information to help them decide what and when to plant for the year. It has information like weather, moon phase, etc. So basically DFOlmanac will be a place that contain DFO most basic information to help you progress through the game. You get the idea.
* The plan: When I have free time, I'll write simple and basic posts about the game. These posts will have [DFOlmanac] in the title and the "Newbie Friendly" tag. They will then be organized and indexed so new players can find everything on one page. In order to reduce cluster, these posts won't show up on "Latest Articles".

* This is where you send and receive mails from other players. The 2 most used function for the mailbox are Received and Send Mail. You will get mail notification when someone send you anything.

* You don't have to be in Seria's Room to receive mail, you can just click the envelope icon on the bottom left for quick access. However, if you want to send mail, you will have to be in Seria's Room.
* Receiving Mail:
+ All mail will stay in your mailbox for 180 days before it get deleted. If someone attached a message into the mail, you can click on the item to see what they say.
+ If you receive multiple mail items, the "select all" is on by default and you can just click Receive at the bottom to get all of it.

+ If you receive any mail from Neople like winning an event item, or any compensation through a bug in the game, these will go through this system.
+ The system will also notify you if the mail is suspicious (like from a new and unknown account), so watch out for those.

* Sending Mail:
+ It's very simple. You can use this function to send mail to other characters in your accounts. They also include quick function like Guild members, Friend list, Recent lists, etc.

+ Simply type in the IGN and select the server of the player, then click the check mark to make sure the IGN is valid. Then you can type whatever message you want, then attach the item, then send. You can send gold if you want to.

* Fatigue point (FP) is a basic function in DFO, and here I'll explain what it is, what's it for, and how to get more of it.

Basic Concepts* You can find your FP bar on the bottom right of the screen. Hovering the mouse over it will tell you how many point you have left.

* Fatigue points determine how much you can play that particular character. Generally speaking each dungeon room will cost 1 FP. For example, if a dungeon has 4 rooms, it will cost you 4 FP to clear. When you're out of FP, you can no longer enter dungeon for that day. FP will reset each day.
* Some exceptions:
+ With level 100 cap, some dungeons will cost a fix amount of FP regardless of how many room you clear. E.g. Ghent Palace, Basement of Pain, Black Shrine, etc.
+ Raid dungeons will not cost any FP. E.g. Fiend War, Prey, Sirocco Raids.
+ Some dungeons don't require any FP at all to enter. E.g. Valley of Fallen Souls area.

Get More FP* The biggest way to increase FP per character is to purchase Neo Premium Contract. It's located under "Premiums" tab. This contact will increase your default 156 FP to 272 FP, which is a huge boost. The best part is that this increase is for every character in the account.
* For a 30 days contract, it will cost you about $10.
* NOTE: If you get the contract, you will have an option to turn on "FP Express", which burn FP twice as fast but give you twice as much EXP. Do NOT turn this on. The majority of your EXP for leveling is from completing quests, which this function does not increase. So the more FP you have, the more quests you can complete, the faster you can level up.

* Beside contract, another way to increase FP is through FP pot. This generic point can be crafted through Alchemy profession. Most people buy them from Auction Hall.
* You can only use 1 pot per character per day. Each pot will recover 30 FP.

* Sometimes Neople releases packages what have FP pot as bonus as well. So watch out for those.

  
The Problem With FP* The biggest problem is that Fatigue Point hinder new players from playing more on their first day. DFO only allows you to create 2 characters per day. For a 156 FP bar, it will take about 1 hour or so to burn through.
* So without any FP pot, on the 1st day, new players probably can only play about 2-3 hours.
* If you're a new player reading this post. Please don't let this kill your game experience. I can assure you that when you get to max level and closer to end game, FP won't be a problem at all. This game highly encourage you to play multiple characters. The more characters you have, the better funneling you can do.
* Just look at the first page of my character screen, I barely have time in the day to play all of them.
https://www.dfoneople.com/pg/qlipha2021?page=1

* Amor retexture is an easy way to boost your damage that everyone should know about. Here I will explain how it works in simple terms.

Why Retexture?* There are 5 armor types in this game: Cloth, Leather, Light, Heavy, and Plate. Why can't we just use whatever drop? It's because classes have their own Armor mastery, which gives extra stats when you wear appropriate type.
* Armor Master is a passive skill that learned when you start to change to your subclass. In the example below, when Male Gunner become Male Ranger, he gets Leather Armor Mastery.
* So when a Male Ranger equip a leather armor, he gets extra stats. Below is the description of the passive. In total, by wearing all 5 leather armors, you can get up to 316 Strength and 15% Critical Chance. Simple damage gains for not a lot of work.

How to Retexture?* First, walk to NPC Roger Levin in West Coast, talk to him and select "Retexture". NPC Strawberry Nose Della in Black Market can also retexture as well.

* After that, simply put in the armor piece you want to retexture, select the type of armor you want to convert into (it will ask you for some materials), then click "Retexture". That's it, super easy.

* Each retexture, depending on the armor type, will ask for 500,000 gold, 1 legendary soul, and 80 Superior material (leather, cloth, bone, stone, or iron). These leather, cloth, bone, stone, or iron materials can be easily found through dungeon runs. Pretty much all mobs can drop these.
