* Ozma raid is here, and it comes with 5 extra set to fuse with your current epics. Here I will simplify the effect of each set along with their pros and cons to help you pick which set is best for you.
* I don't play Sader and Aeterna much, so this post will mostly cater to DPS and Synergies. But for your reference, I'll put the stat summary and comments for Sader and Aeterna at the end.

Table of Contents* Why Read This?
* For DPS / Syn
+ Tiamat Set Summary
+ Astaros Set Summary
+ Rosenbach Set Summary
+ Berias Set Summary
+ Redmayne Set Summary
+ Combination Example
+ Summary

* For Saders
* For Aeterna
* References



Why Read This?* Well, with Ozma raid, you get 5 sets, each contain 5 pieces, to fuse with your Shoulder, Shoe, Belt, Necklace, and Magic Stone.
* On top of that, each Ozma set has set option of 2-set, 3-set, or 5-set. So as you can see, just like level 100 epics, you can mix match multiple Ozma set to your liking.
* AND on top of that, Ozma has reroll option where you can add unwanted pieces and filter out what you want. So eventually, with enough effort, you can get any Ozma pieces you want.
* NOTE: Your Ozma reroll will reset if you collect the item. So you’ll have to do it all in one go to get the exact piece you want.

* NOTE: There are some RNG involved with Ozma Epic. Each Ozma piece will have a grade (Blue, Purple, Yellow). Each grade will provide different "Special Option" stat and there's no way to reset them (you will have to hope for another dup with higher stat).
+ For example, Tiamat Shoulder that provide "Level 45 skill consume (9 / 7 / 5%) HP". That means if you get a blue version, the skill will consume 5%, purple version consumes 7%, and so on.


For DPS / Syn

Tiamat Set Summary* Pros: This set has 1% higher modifier from the "Simple Option" than other set. Especially with the Shoes piece, it has 2% higher total modifier (1% higher Additional Attack and 1% higher Bonus Damage).
* Cons: Every time you cast a certain skill, you lose 5-9% HP. The cooldown is 10% but this can be a problem especially during longer fight or when you have lots of CDR gears.
* Good News: At 3-set option, the HP reduced is cut down by 5%. So now instead of losing 9/7/5%, you will lose 4/2/0% instead, which is great.
* Overall:
+ If you want to get this set, the Shoes is a must.
+ Try to get 3-set option to get the reduced penalty.
+ Mix with other set that have utility.


Astaros Set Summary* Pros: Huge skill level increases the more pieces you wear.
+ With the 2-set option, you can type "Past" to activate that dimension. Think about if you get 2-piece of yellow version, you can activate +2 levels to skill 70, 75, and 80. Which is a huge damage increase.

* Cons: Highly RNG and you don't always get the version of the skill range you want.
* Overall: This set is very good if you know what skill range you want to activate.
+ It's also hard to make a recommendation because every class has different skills, but generally higher level skill like 70 75 and 80 do a lot more damage.
+ If you want to use this, I would get at either 2-set or 3-set option (maybe 3 Tiamat piece and 2 Astaros piece)



Rosenbach Set Summary* Pros: Great utility set that give you a shield (20% of Max HP) and give you various buff if you get hit with the active shield. The 2-set option is great, increasing 1% HP/MP every 1 second.
* Cons: Nothing really.
* Overall: Best with 2-set utility option. Highly recommend the belt for movement speed.


Berias Set Summary* The pieces give you a soul (Max Stacks: 1, Soul perish after 5 hits, Hit Cooldown: 2 seconds, Soul Respawn Cooltime: 20 seconds) on top of your character that give you buff.
* Pros: Great utility set like Rosenbach. The buff effects are great.
+ With 2-set option, you can increase hit limit to 6 and reduced Soul Respawn cooltime to 15 second.
+ Unlike Rosenback set where you have to get it to get buff, this set gives you buff right at the start.

* Cons: The set options fall short after 2-set.
* Overall: Good utility options. The Necklace is the only Ozma piece that give both Attack and Casting Speed.



Redmayne Set Summary* Pros: Decrease skill cooldown by 10%, which can go great with other CDR strategy like Mind Stim Potion and Sirocco's Assassin Set.
* Cons: Decrease your max HP/MP by a huge amount.
* Overall: Great set. I would check how much CDR you have and weight your risk/benefit from there.



Combination Example* 3 Tiamat (higher modifier) + 2 Redmayne (more CDR):
+ Remember to get Tiamat Shoe for the 2% higher modifier.
+ This combination is good if you already have epic set that already give utility (e.g. Crossroad set)

* 3 Tiamat (higher modifier) + 2 Rosenbach or 2 Berias:
+ If you don't have a lot of utility, this is a good combination.
+ If you don't care about the 3-set Tiamat that reduces the HP penalty, you can replace it with Berias belt to make up for those HP lost.


Summary for DPS/Syn* Tiamat Set - Higher overall modifier, but comes with HP penalty.
* Astaros Set - Increase skill level at a rotation, comes with no penalty.
* Rosenbach Set - Create HP shield, gives buffs when you got hit.
* Berias Set - Give buffs right off the bat, and wears off after certain number of hit.
* Redmayne Set - Reduce skill cooldown, but comes with reduce max HP/MP penalty.



For SadersTiamat Set Summary* Definitely has the strongest buff power, but doesn't provide any additional benefit through healing, resurrections, etc. (perhaps you can use this a swap set)
* If you're playing Enchantress, note that wearing all 5-piece will reduce Black Forest Barrier from 5 sec to 3 sec.
Astaros Set Summary* Buff power is quite low compared to other. It offers no special benefit or penalty.
Rosenbach Set Summary* Overall great balanced set. Buff power is not the highest, but provides huge additional benefits through special option. I fell like most sader would go with this set.
* Note that the barrier her is 5% of Max HP as compared to 20% for DPS/Syn.
Berias Set Summary* This set only increase stat through passive skills, and doesn't add any buff power to level 30 and 50 skills.
Redmayne Set Summary* Overall about the same power as Astaros set, although comes will penalty in healing skills.


For AeternaTiamat Set Summary* For simple option, you get total of 1,550 stat increase right of the bat.
* In addition to special option (assuming you cast all the required skills to proc the effect), you get another 1,250 stat, for a total whopping 2,800 stat. This set by far will provide the most stat.

Astaros Set Summary* For simple option (just like Tiamat), you get total of 1,550 stat increase.
* The special option is RNG though, you get additional 375, 625, or 875 stat for a total of 1,925 or 2,175 or 2,425 stat.
* As you can see, the total buff is not as strong as Tiamat and has RNG involved.

Rosenbach Set Summary* For simple option (just like Tiamat), you get total of 1,550 stat increase.
* For special option, it's pretty bad. Here you only get additional 100 stat. So I don't recommend using this set at all.

Berias Set Summary* For simple option (just like Tiamat), you get total of 1,550 stat increase.
* This set definitely gives you huge attack movement casting speed. But again, it only provide additional 100 stat through special option.
Redmayne Set Summary* Unlike other sets, this one gives you 1,675 stat through simple option.
* It gives you the highest simple option stat, but fails to provide any additional stat through special option.

Summary for Aeterna* Tiamat Set - Higher overall party effects, but comes with HP penalty.
* Astaros Set - 2nd highest party effects, but comes with RNG.
* Rosenbach Set - Bad party effect, but high survival with the shield.
* Berias Set - Bad party effect, but gives huge attack movement casting speed.
* Redmayne Set - 3rd highest party effects, gives total 900 px party effect, but comes with HP/MP penalty.

* DFO sure is a game that promotes playing multiple characters. And with the Farming QoL Improvement coming up on the horizon, there're now even more ways to funnel your resources.
* Do you want to learn how to funnel? In this article, I will show you the many ways to can gear up your alt from Zero to Hero.

General Information* Before we start, this Equipment Farming Improvements will be your main farming method. Basically all the character bound materials in level 100 cap will now have their account-bound version. As you can see, the more alts you have, the faster you can gear up another character..

Weapon* Grave Tower is an option if you have highly geared characters. You can register up to 6 characters per week to gather Old Golden Coins, then use them to buy the weapon type of your choice. Since there are 2 level 100 weapon for each type, here you have 50% chance of getting the weapon you want.
* Hard Oculus is another option. You can get this Random Weapon box once per month per character, and it's account-bound. The sad thing is that pot is randomized based on the base class (slayer, gunner, mage, etc.)

* Pit of Incarceration 3,4,5 also give mat to buy weapon pot. Unfortunately, the pool for this pot is very big. For example, if you're female fighter, it will give you a random weapon among all the fighter weapon type.

* If you need to refine the weapon, Powerful Energy Improvements added account-bound version to fit your needs.
+ Clearing Roschest legendary dungeon will give you account-bound Refined Powerful Energy .
+ You can also buy  through NPC Jun using  and buy from Raid shop using .

Equipment* With the improvement patch, you can now upgrade level 100 legendary to pre-selected level 100 epic sets (Mother Nature, Elementalist, Synchro sets). Legendary to Epic needs 2,000  and 100 .
+ For 3+3 dungeon,  reward multiplied by 1.5 times. 50% of  will be given out as . The cost of legendary equipment is reduced to 600  each. Looking at the data from my 3+3 runs, each character can get you 60 . So doing 3+3 total 10 times will give you enough account-bound mat to buy 1 legendary slot.
+ For 2+2 dungeon,  reward multiplied by 2 times. 50% of  will be given out as . Looking at the data from by 2+2 run, each character can get you about 61 . So doing 2+2 total 361 times will get you enough account-bound mat to upgrade all 11 slots. Also remember that Oculus also give . I have 25 characters that can do 2+2, so it will take me like 2 weeks to get this done.

* Random Epic Pots are your friends. They're available from NPC Dorothy and NPC Robato. They are character bound, but the materials needed to buy them comes in account-bound version ( and ). So the more 2+2 and Oculus you do, the more you can buy these pots.
+ From the Sirocco Challenge shop, you can get another random pot per week.
+ Also, DON'T forget your Oculus Ditto and your random epic pot from Night of Revelation too.

* Recycle unwanted epics from all your random pots. The "Chest of Immateriality" from Sirocco Challenge shop is a good option. In addition, with KDnF's Sirocco Hard mode, you can buy 2 Chests per character per week with .

* Last option for your desperate needs. If there's an epic piece you really need to complete the set-up, beside transferring the piece from another character, you can buy the epic fragments from Sirocco and Ozma raid shop. Each of these boxes will give you 50 fragments.

  
Mythic* Really the only way you can funnel this is through transferring from another character. Mythic  can be dissembled and will give 1 Light of Wisdom
* Transferring Mythic will need the following materials. You will need 630 Elemental Crystal for earring slot instead of 420.
  
* Want to reroll specific Mythic line? Sirocco Hard mode got chu. You can buy up to 2 mythic kaleido boxes per character per week.

Black Purgatory Mods* Reward Improvements were added so you can buy Ore of Despair Box  from auction hall if needed. They also added Fearsome Eye box  that let you get 2 eyes per week guaranteed.
* Mods Improvements were added so you can inherit the mod to another piece of the same slot and change the type of mods too. As you can see, the more BP daily / weekly you do, the more Ore you can funnel.
  
Sirocco Pieces* The Sirocco weapon is easy, you can just funnel 220 petals for that.
* The "Liberated Subconscious Pot" is your friend. The more Sirocco you do, the more Account-bound  you can funnel.
* The "Chest of Circulation" will allow you to recycle unwanted Sirocco pieces.
* If you still can't get the piece you want, Ozma raid has Selective Sirocco box you can buy for the cost of 30 Saturated Grudge Crystal. Beside doing Ozma raid, you can get this crystal through Sirocco Hard Mode (up to 2 crystals per week per character). Really between this box and Sirocco Ditto, you will grad in no time.

  
Ozma Pieces* This part is very straight forward, the only way you can get the pieces you want is to open the "Sleeping Terror Pot", then use the "Holy Grail of Faith" system to filter out the pieces.
  
Talismans and Runes* Forget about the RNG with this system. The Runes / Talisman Improvements made it so that you can purchase unlimited "Capella Talisman Selective Box"
* As you can see, doing enough Exile Mountain will get you enough account-bound  to get any talismans and runes you want.
  
Swap Set* Operation Hope changes make it super easy.  will be given out as , so farm this as much as your heart desires.
* S Recipe will have 100% success rate, and Abyss Fragment's purchase limit removed.

WooHoo* There you have it. That's pretty much all the different ways I can think of to help you funnel and gear up your alts. As always, if I'm missing any other ways, let me know!

General Information* This sequel uses the same concept as the original. In this edition, instead of raising multiple characters and have no control over where they go, you now control the character.
* In a nutshell, you collect materials, craft stuff, then clear higher level dungeon. Ya know, basically like every MMORPG out there.

* (1) This is your character info bar. It include info like gold, HP, potion, and Fatigue points.
* (2) Alert center. It basically notify you when something new is available
* (3) Mini-map
* (4) Your character. You can use the arrow keys to walk around.
* (5) Tool bar, include things like character info, inventory, achievement, etc.

* This part is very self explanatory. This is basically your character info, where you can see level, equipment, stat, etc.
* That's basically it, you kill stuff, gather stuff, kill daily boss, unlock more regions. One thing to note is that in this version, you don't really build anything. All the building already placed on your town, so you will need to upgrade them to be able to buy stronger equip.



Reward Shop* The currency is called Bit Fragment, and you can get them through completing daily and achievement within the mini-game.
* The shop is not bad, some of the notable ones are:
+ Sirocco Set Box: you select a set and it spits out a random piece of that set.
+ Selective Level 100 epic equipment box.
+ Selective Level 100 epic weapon box.
+ Time's Guide Stone box (100 count): You can buy 2 boxes per week and it's a 6-week event, so basically free 1,200 TSG.
+ Cosmetic like Face and Weapon avatar

* In the Japanese version of the event, they also give you cosmetic bubble head, pets and emotes as well.

  
  
  
  


Tips and Tricks* The goblin attack speed is quite slow, so you can actually use the hit-n-run strategy. From the look of it, doing it horizontally seems to work better.
* Each region boss appear once per day.
* The Wooden Club from Souvenir Shop is a good starter weapon. It has 100 attack, which is stronger that the default weapon they give you. It has level 1 requirement so you can just equip right the way.

* Right at the beginning, talk to Seria to complete a series of question. When done she will give you a Cosmic Soul, which you can use to upgrade the Souvenir Shop to level 2. Then you can buy "Faded Emerald Ring" which adds 435 HP and 15 movement speed (very helpful in early game).

* When you're out of HP, drink from the village pond to recover.

* If you don't want to manually hunt, you can put your character in auto-drive. It will take about 20 minutes to burn through 156 FP bar. If you were doing it manually, each mob kill will cost 3 FP.

* The level 1 Chestplate is another good early game purchase from the Armor Shop. It cost 1,800 gold and has 48 defense.

* Treasure chests are your friend. Each one is 500 gold and the estimated location are as below. The chests (red circles) will reset daily. The Blue Circles and Gray Squares are locations for quests which I'll cover later on.

Quest/Ending Guide* Quest 1: Beginning Arcade Fighter Online - [Talk to Arcade Seria and listen to her explanation]
+ At the beginning of Beat and Legend, there is Seria in front of the fountain in town. Talk to Seria, listen to all 1234 options, and choose the last option to finish.
+ For reference, in this ending, Seria's location moves to the east of the village,

* Quest 2: Don't Strain Yourself - [What happens if you try to go outside the village while injured?]
+ Leave the village while you are recovering from an injury to get the ending

* Quest 3: Too Bored to Stand Still - [Is it okay to leave the event on for 5 hours?]
+ AFK for 5 hours to get the ending

* Quest 4: Sharan Shop's Secret - [Craft a Secret Medication at Sharan's Armor Combination Shop and talk to the Female Mage]
+ If you upgrade Sharan's Armor Combination Shop to Level 2, you can craft Secret Medicine 1 , which require the following materials:
- 1 Talisman  (Pandemonium - Late Area)
- 10 Low Grade Elemental Crystals

+ Low Grade Elemental Crystal  comes from Level 1 Canna's Crafting Shop. Each Crystal requires 1 Raw Cloth  and 1 Raw Paving Stone
+ Raw Cloth and Raw Paving Stone are 125 bit gold each at the Loton's Material Shop, so this Secret Medicine will cost 2,500 gold.
+ You will need 100  to complete this quest (aka 250,000 gold)
+ Reward: 1  Grand Flores Gem I The reward is a Jewel of the Demon Realm I.

* Quest 5: Toby's Helper - [Accepts all requests from Beat Toby.]
+ All you have to do is do Toby's request at the western edge of town by gathering materials for him
- 10 Goblin Leather  (Grand Flores - Early Zone)
- 10 Kinoll's Lightning Crystals  (Grand Flores  - Mid Area)
- 10 Tau Essence  (Grand Flores - Late Zone)

+ Reward: 1 Grand Flores Gem I

* Quest 6: Please Find My Dogs! - [Talking to Isabella, craft Training Sticks  at Canna's material Combination Shop, and defeat the Ownerless Beasts.] (Isabella Location: Entrance to Zelva)
+ The training stick  is unlocked at Canna's material Combination Shop level 3 and requires 5 Bird Feathers  + 2 Ordinary Paving Stone  + 1 Ordinary Iron Crystal
+ Ordinary Iron Crystals  can also be synthesized in the Canna Shop and require 1 Intermediate Hardener + 1 Intermediate Iron Shard.
+ Requires a total of 1,000 gold.
+ Combine and go to the Roschest Mid Area with the stick. If you catch a beast that has lost its owner there, you have successfully trained it! A message appears. After that, talk to Isabella again for the ending.

* Quest 7: There's a Liar in Front of You- [Open all 8 red treasure chests in the late Guide of Wisdom Are]
+ When you enter the latter part of the Guide of Wisdom, red treasure chests will stand out. Open 8 chests to complete the quest and get the ending
+ Reward: 1 Guide of Wisdom Gem I

* Quest 8: Hills' Competitor- [What if you combine 100 Needle and Yarn Sets  at Sharan's Armor Combination Shop?]
+ This Set is unlocked at Sharan's Armor Combination Shop level 4.
+ Each set requires: 1 Raw Cloth  + 1 Raw Iron Piece  + 5 Goblin Leathers  + 5 Bird Feathers
+ Total gold needed: (125⨉100 ) + (125⨉100) = 25,000 gold
+ Total materials needed: 500  and 500
+ Reward: Legendary Gem I

* Quest 9: An Adventurer and A Secret Passageway - [Talk to the fountain in the center of the village 5 times to put something in motion]
+ Talk to the Fountain in the village 5 times to open The Magic Circle located in the northeast corner of the second half of the Pandemonium region.

+ Once in there, kill Arcade Sarpozas and collect 100 Sarpoza Cloaks . It doesn't seem to drop until you get this quest, so make sure you receive this quest first.
+ Collect 100 Sarpoza Cloaks and talk to The Magic Circle again to get an Invisibility Cloak . Then talk to the Fountain again to get the ending.

* Quest 10: Thank You, Postman - [Bring the Mail to the mailbox in a region other than the village]
+ The Mail can be crafted at Secretive Tree Level 4. These Mails also requires higher quality materials, which come from Level 3 Loton's Material Shop. Craft the needed mail and deliver them to 4 locations below.
+ Reward: Guide of Wisdom Gem Ⅱ

* Quest 11: The Secret of the Goblin Statue - [Insert Goblin Dolls to the Goblin Statues in 4 different areas.]
+ The Goblin Doll can be crafted from Level 5 Sharan's Armor & Accessory Combination Shop which requires 3 Intermediate Cloth Pieces + 3 Goblin Leather
+ Bring the Dolls to the follow 4 locations to complete the quest (some statues requires different amount of dolls). After this quest, you can use these locations fast travel teleportation.

* Quest 12: Bit Alchemist - [If you buy a strange bottle in Loton's Material Shop, red lines appear in 4 areas.]
+ A strange bottle that can be bought in the Level 2 Loton's Material Shop. 1000 bits gold.
+ After purchasing them, talk to the red wire at the location below to complete the quest.

* Quest 13: Explosives Are Dangerous! - [Continues renovating Strange Cogwheel in Farris' Special Equipment]
+ Complete this quest by crafting the Strange Cogwheel (Legendary)  item in Level 3 Farris' Special Equipment
+ Please use the material tables above to see what needed to upgrade the building and craft the item.
+ Reward: Legendary Gem II

* Quest 14: Will You Marry Me? - [Collect a Written Request  from the Secretive Tree and bring it to the Arcade Rich Man]
+ Upgrade Secretive Tree to level 2 to get "Written Request", which requires 5 Superior Cloths  and 2 Kinoll's Lightning Crystals .
+ Superior Cloths  cost 500 gold each at Loton's Material Shop level 3, and Kinoll's Lightning Crystal  come from Grand Flores Mid Regions
+ Arcade Rich Man will also ask for 10 Ordinary Cloth , Ordinary Hardener , and Ordinary Iron Piece . They can be bought for 250 gold in the Loton's Material Shop level 2 (7,500 gold cost).

* Quest 15: Who Moved My Apples? - [Combine Apple Tree Fertilizer  at Canna's Material Combination Shop and grow village's apple tree for 7 days.]
+ 1 Apple Tree Fertilizer  = 2 Tau Essences  (Grand Flores Late Regions) + 1 Bird Feather  (Zelva Early Regions)
+ 7 Apple Tree Fertilizer , so a total of 14 Tau Essences  and 7 Bird Feathers .
+ Note: You can only fertilize once a day. Then after this quest, for once per day, the apple tree restore all stamina.

* Quest 16: A Hidden Passageway? - [Look for Red Rocks in Grand Flores, Zelva, and Pandemonium Regions]
+ Just find the red rocks on each map and interact with them. Destroying all the red rocks will open a passage to the west of the village with an ending. This allows you to quickly move to each passage (useful when going to catch a boss
+ Reward: 1 Pandemonium Gem III

* Quest 17: Romeo and Juliet - [Talk to the village peach tree 5 times or more to start something]
+ Talk to the Peach Tree in the village 5 times or more, and you will suddenly discover a hidden note.
+ After this time, there will be a character appear near the bottom of the second half of Grand Flores. Talk to this character.

+ Take this letter and go to the mid-range of Grand Flores to complete the quest

+ Reward: 1 Grand Flores Gem Ⅲ
* Quest 18: Hint Collector - [Collect all the hints]
+ Refer to the locations below.

* Quest 19: Chest Collector - [Open 200 treasure chests]
+ Refer to the locations below.

* Quest 20: Rock Collector - [Collect all breakable rocks.]
+ If there is a rock in the dungeon, get close and break it. Refer to the locations below.

* Quest 21: Town Travel Sickness - [Move fields 100 times.]
+ I guess this is done automatically when you play the game

* Quest 22: Take Care of Your Game! - [Watch the game intro 10 times]
+ Since the Game intro is only visible when you open an event after the first log in. You can basically kill client and restart the process to get this quest done.

* Quest 23: I'm Rich Now! - [Collect 50,000 Arcade Gold and talk to the Secret Moonlight Tavern]
+ Pretty easy, just get 50k and complete the quest.

* Quest 24: More Secret Medication...? [Clear the Sharon Shop's Secret ending, and then talk to the Arcade Male Mage to put something in motion]
+ After completing Quest 4: Secrets of Sharan's Shop, talk to the Male Wizard guy to start.
+ He will ask for 100 Sharon Shop's Secret Medication 2 , which can be unlocked from upgrading Sharan's Armor & Accessory Combination Shop to level 3.
+ Each Secret Medicine II requires 5 Low Grade Elemental Crystals , 5 Medium Grade Elemental Crystals , and 5 Lowest Grade Elemental Crystal . These Elemental Crystals can be crafted from Canna's Crafting Shop (These Cloth and Paving Stone can be bought from Loton's Material Shop)
- 1 Low Grade Elemental Crystal  = 1 Raw Cloth  + 1 Raw Paving Stone
- 1 Medium Grade Elemental Crystal = 1 Ordinary Cloth  + 1 Ordinary Paving Stone
- 1 Lowest Grade Elemental Crystal  = 1 Superior Cloth  + 1 Superior Paving Stone

+ Each Secret Medicine II will cost you:
- 5 Low Grade Elemental Crystals  = 1,250 gold
- 5 Medium Grade Elemental Crystals  = 2,500 gold
- 5 Lowest Grade Elemental Crystals  = 5,000 gold
- So total = 8,750 gold

+ So to complete this quest, you will need about 875,000 gold
+ Reward: Exiled Mountains Gem I

* Quest 25: A Arcade Singing Group [Talk to the Arcade Knight to put something in motion]
+ Talk to Knight, she says she need her band members to start. Then talk to the following NPC then go back to Knight to complete the quest.
- Female Slayer - southeast of town (near the entrance to Zelva)
- Female Gunner - Southwest of town (near the entrance to Grand Flores)
- Thief - Northwest of town (near Canna's Crafting Shop)

* Quest 26: Poor Construction Exposed - [Destroy the strange rock in the corner halfway through Grand Flores]
+ Just find this rock and break it to get the ending

* Quest 27: A Arcade Singing Group 2 [Clear the Arcade Singing Group ending, and then talk to the Arcade Knight to put something in motion]
+ After completing Quest 25, talk to Knight again to start. Then craft the Power Supply  from Canna's Crafting Shop level 2
+ 1 Power Supply  = 5 Precision Data Chips  + 1 Luke's Research Material
+ 1 Precision Data Chips  = 3 Data Chips  (From Canna's Crafting Shop)
+ Data Chip  can be obtained from Zelva late regions and boss area
+ After crafting this device, speaking to the microphone right in front of the entrance to the Guide of Wisdom, select #1 to complete the quest

* Quest 28: Arcade Master's Ordeal - [Open all the fields, and then talk to the Arcade Master to put something in motion]
+ You must open up all the maps to complete this quest
+ Talk to Beat Master in the Exile Mountain Area. His quest is to defeat all the boss each area.

* Quest 29:  Beat Girl and Seven Goblins - [Speaking to Beat Girl to start something.]
+ Talk to the Girl in the south of town. Her quest is to find 7 Goblins. They are scattered throughout 7 maps disguised as a green rock.
+ Talk to the rock to make it transform into goblin, then talk to goblin to get your token.
+ Collect all tokens and return to the girl

* Quest 30: To the Arcade Depths - [Clear the Starting Arcade Legend Online Ending, collect 10 endings at Level 95, and then talk to Arcade Seria]
+ After completing Quest 1, then complete 10 more quest at level 95 or higher, then talk to Seria.
+ Then you will be given the souls of the 5 bosses you have defeated so far, and with them you can talk to the sign in the corner of the village to create a path to the bottom of the beat.

* Quest 31: Path to Roschest - [Reach Guild Management Office Level 3, and the Character level 95, Talk to Fighter in Roschest to put something in]
+ Once you hit level 95 and got your Guild Management Office to level 3, Talk to the  Fighter in Roschest to start.

+ Craft the 5 Energies from Secret Moonlight Tavern level 2
+ Reward: Exiled Mountains Gem Ⅱ , and Roschest region is also unlocked
* Quest 32: Toby's Homeland - [After the Toby's Helper ending, look for suspicious things about Toby]
+ After completing "Quest 5: Toby's Helper", talk to the real Toby near the south of Grand Flores early area. After that, go back to the village and talk to the fake Toby to get the ending.
+ Reward: Grand Flores Gem IV

* Quest 33: The Art of Explosions- [Defeat Hyper Mecha Tau and check the pentacle in the corner of the Boss Monster area]
+ In Grand Flores region, defeat Hyper Mecha Tau in the boss area.
+ A magic circle will pear near the south side of the region, talk to it to complete.

* Quest 34: Blue Feathers
+ There is an interactive feather in the middle of the Pandemonium Regions. Talk to it to complete.
+ Reward: Pandemonium Gem Ⅳ

* Quest 35: A Sad Story About the Stone in the Corner - [Spend 1 minute in the corner of Zelva Boss Monster area.]
+ Go to this area and stay about a block from the rock for 1 min to get the ending.
+ Reward: Zelva Gem Ⅱ

* The original mini-dungeon was first released in DFOG, and the second installment was first released in CDnF. Now that it has arrived in KDnF, I'll summarize what it is and what are the differences.

What's New* The character UI has been expanded. On the left, you now have more option to adjust character stats. On the right side, you can pick your difficulty to fit your needs. Higher difficulty is needed for certain achivements.
* Just like the first addition, you pick your flag, then after each wave, you can pick and chose the ability for your build.

* A new material Seed of Chaos is added. You get this when killing mobs in the map.
* During the run, you can meet merchant NPC where use can use these seeds to buy more stuff from her shop. The biggest one is Talisman. You can also reroll the shop once for 100 seeds. With talisman and cooldown build, you can do crazy stuff like this male mech.

* New map has been implemented. Here you have more options and routes you can take.
+ Boss: This is the main boss of each phase.
+ Named Monsters / Normal Mob: When killed you can select more ability. You can get Seed of Chaos from these.
+ Special Shop: This is where you can use Seed of Chaos to buy more ability (including Talisman).
+ Recovery: Restore 50% HP / MP
+ Golden Goblin: Drop Seed of Chaos and other useful things
+ Random: Any room (except for boss) can spawn here.

  
Rewards* This mini-dungeon has 5 phases, and depends on how far you get, you will receive the following rewards (You can only get these 5 stage rewards once per day).
+ Seals of Chaos for completing the first 3 phases. 20 Seals for each phase.
+ Essence of Chaos for completing the remaining 2 phases. 2 Essences for each phase.
* Below is the event shop, it's pretty good:
+ Level 100 Random Mythic Pot. Limit 1 purchase. Cost 800
+ The Legacy of Remidia Chrysos. Adjusts the current Black Purgatory option to the maximum value. Limit 1 purchase. Cost 150
+ Mythic Transformation Token. Limit 1 purchase per week (4 week event). Cost 80
+ 50 Petal Quartz. Limit 1 purchase per week (4 week event). Cost 30
+ 25 Chaotic Grudge. Limit 1 purchase per week (4 week event). Cost 30
+ 300 Black Crystal. Limit 2 purchase per week (4 week event). Cost 10
+ Chaos Gate Special Wallpaper. Limit 1 purchase. Cost 35  (pic below)
+ Rare Avatar Option Change. Limit 1 purchase. Cost 15
+ Avatar Option Change. Limit 1 purchase. Cost 5
+ Ozma Entry Ticket. Limit 2 purchase per week. Cost 2
+ Sirocco Entry Ticket. Limit 2 purchase per week. Cost 2
+ Prey Entry Ticket. Limit 2 purchase per week. Cost 2
+ Fiend War Entry Ticket. Limit 2 purchase per week. Cost 2
+ 3 Mind Stimulant Potion. No purchase limit. Cost 2
+ 3 Warlord's Cry Potion. No purchase limit. Cost 2
+ 30% HP/MP Potion. No purchase limit. Cost 1

  
* Finally, the 7 Deadly Sins Achievement Reward. In order to get this, you must clear the dungeon with all the penalty and difficulty added to the total of 60,000 points or more. Complete this will give you a nice juicy aura.

* DFO ExStream is a traditional live stream from the DFOG developer team where they showcase what contents, event, and sale are coming on the following week.
* The following are confirmed to be released on the next weekly maintenance (Nov. 23rd).
* IMPORTANT: MILEAGE RESET with the next weekly maintenance.

Contents* SPECTREEEE is here!!!!!!!
+ This is the new 5th female slayer class (called Blade in KDnF)
+ Here's the class cinematic and class intro cinematic.
+ Here's the class song and the instrumental version
+ Here's the skill information and the damage chart.

* Solo mode for end game dungeons. No farming QoL yet.

Events* Song of the Spectre
+ Clear Spectre exclusive dungeon to level up your training level. Rewards includes:
- Level 100 Untradebble Mythic Box at training level 7
- Mythic Conversion Stone at training level 8, 9, 10. This stone works like Ozma system where you can filter out the the mythic you don't want. What you filtered out will be saved when you use multiple stones.
- Also Selective level 100 epic box (aka free ditto) at training level 10.

+ Here's the event shop. You can buy 1 additional Conversion Stone per week (this is a 8-week event). So total 11 Conversion Stones.

* Path of the Spectre
+ Extension of Spectre Song event where you get more rewards once hit level 100 and clear end game dungeons and raids.

* Himan Stella's Stage Prep!
+ Clear dungeon to get Silver and Gold Music Notes to buy stuff from event shop EZPZ. You can also click on NPC for Cheering Buff (Once per character per day, buff is character bound)
+ Silver Note Shop. Including Random Mythic Box, 500 TSG, Temporary +12/+8 legendary weapon box, Stella Creature and weapon box (Here's other character),
+ Gold Note Shop. Including Ticket to change the temp +12/+8 to permanent version and Mythic Conversion TOKEN (aka RNG reroll). Here's an example.

* Newbies Always Welcome Season 2
+ Same concept as season 1, link players, clear contents, get rewards.
+ Here's the Warm Greeting Shop and Budding Sprout Shop.
+ Spectre event character can also get newbie materials

* Honey Time
+ 120 mins - Random Exile talisman box
+ 10 hours - 5 Kaleido
+ 20 hours - 156 fp pot
+ 30 hours - 200 TSG box
+ 50 hours - 100 Dark night's Remains box

* DFO Twitch Drops Event
+ Look here for guide and FAQ on how to participate. Here's the schedule.
+ You basically watch stream to get rewards based on the number of hours.
+ Reward include Olympus avatar (Female Priest Included) and New Background (Permanant)

* 7th DFO Fanart Contest. Must be Spectre related. Can't be commission, no plagiarism, etc.

Sales* Spectre Pass, similar to KDnF version
+ Exclusive Avatar and Pet
+ OP DPS pet +18% Crit Damage

* Monster Cosplay Package. Color variation here and here
* Black Friday Part 2
Others* Kill Till I Get My Mythic (Spectre promote video), featuring Dunni, Tigger, and DJ
* New item of the month
* Again, MILEAGE RESET
Q&A* +25 All Elemental Bead release?
+ Plan to release as sale.

* Will we get Rare avatar set from Korea (Generation 6 7 8 9)?
+ We're checking which set DFOG has and doesn't have compared to KDnF and make plan later.

* More battle pass? KDnF is season 5 already.
+ Yes, season 2 soon, can't tell which patch but within this year.

* We want to know the QoL and balance patch release schedule.
+ These will be released as massive patch soon within this year and event dedicated to it.

* The Spectre events come with Mythic converters that basically let you filter out what you want. Here I'll summarize what is needed so you can get the Mythic of your choice.

How Many Stones* From the Event page, each stone will let you filter out 1 mythic that you don't want. The best part is your selection will be saved when you use the next stone. There 35 Mythic in the game, so in theory you will need 34 stones to get the Mythic of your choice.
* Is it really possible to get 34 stones? I'm not sure. But from this video, he used 34 stones to get the Annunciation Mythic from KDnF Blade events.

How to Get 34 Stones

* Let's do some math to see if it's possible. Right off the bat, by hitting training level 10, you get 6 stones. So make sure you farm those event dungeons to level up.

* Next is from leveling to 100. You will get 3 stones (1 from level 95 and 2 from level 100). Now you have 9 stones.

* Next is from Posia's shop, you can get 1 stone every week for 8 weeks. Now you have 17 stones. You will need to get 2,000 Stectre Tokens for those 8 stones. I found that a good way to get those is to dissemble those "S" equipment dropped from the event dungeons.

* To get the remaining stones, they have to come from "Path of the Spectre" event. From looking at all the path, you can get another 5 stones. Now you have 22.

* To get the remaining 12 stones, you can get them from buying the repeatable box at the end of the path.

* In order to buy everything from this path without getting the last box, you will need 21,600 RP. Since each repeatable last box cost 2,000 RP, in order to get 12 stones and clear out the whole path, you will need total of 45,600 RP.
How to Get RP Points* Once you hit level 100 on Spectre, you can gain RP points from clearing end-game dungeons. Your first source is "Hall of Experience" and they can only done once. You can earn total 4,150 RP here.

* The next source is "Hall of Exploration" and they can be done respectively. If my math is correct, you can get up to 4,750 RP per week  assuming:
+ You clear all your daily dungeon everyday.
+ You clear Oculus, Exile, and Black Purgatory 3 times per week.
+ You clear Prey, Sirocco, and Ozma 2 times per week.

* Since this is an 8-week events, you can get up to 38,000 RP totally.
* So if you complete both hall, you can only get 42,150 RP, which is nowhere close to 45,600 RP to clear out the path and buy all the repeatable stones.
* To make up for the 3,450 RP short, you can clear daily dungeon repetitively through the "Hall of Exploration". I would recommend farming the "Spectre Event Dungeon" because they drop epics, talisman, BP mat, etc. Each run gives you 15 RP, so you just need to do 230 runs over the course of 8 weeks to get all the benefit from this event (which is about 5 runs per day everyday).

Which Mythic Should I Get* One of DFOG Content Creator has done a video about this topic, you can watch it here. You can also use this https://apps.dfcat.net/regiondungeon/ to specifically farm for the epic piece you want.

* As stated in the Exstream confirmation, DFOG will get full Farming Improvement Update. With this patch, Ghent will yield more Token and the cost for Unique gears will be reduced. Here I'll do some quick math to see how much gold you can earn from here.

What QoL* Each run will now yield x1.5 times more Token, AND Ghent unique gears (including weapon) will have the cost reduction from 600 to 400 Tokens. Basically you can buy more Weapon to resell. These heavy bulk weapon (e.g. Zan, Cannon) can be sold for almost 30k gold each.
* If you didn't know, KDnF daily reward count is 6 per day, and DFOG is 20 per day.

  
Quick Math* Belows are some of the data I have gathered for my previous comparison, using Aiolite price of 4,183 gold. Each of the data row is 20 runs.
  
* If Ghent get the QoL Patch:
+ For 20 runs, your average Token earning will goes from 5,589 → 8,383.5
+ Which mean you can buy 20.9 weapons to resell, which give you about 625,997 gold.
+ Add that to your average raw gold earning 609,727 will give 1,235,723

* Compare that to Stormy Route average 20 runs:
+ 1,235,723 (Ghent) vs. 983,771 (Stormy), that's about 25.6% better and Ghent really require no gear to clear

What about Roschest* Well, from my data, Roschest gives 1,260,294 gold per 20 runs. Using 16,600 as Time Crystal price.
* If we get Ghent QoL, 20 runs can give 1,235,723 gold, that's a 1.98% different. Literally Ghent will become the BEST GOLD FARMING spot.
* This would have huge impact on the game's economy for our server. Because why would I gear up 12/12 to farm Roschest where I can just farm Ghent in Unique gears that I can obtain in like 1 day? I'm sure farming bot would love this.
* Again, these are just in theory. If we actually get it, I'll definitely run some number.

* DFO ExStream is a traditional live stream from the DFOG developer team where they showcase what contents, event, and sale are coming on the following week.
* The following are confirmed to be released on the next weekly maintenance (Dec. 7th).

Content* Watcher in the Rift (aka Watcher of Crack)
+ Basically GoW 2.0. It is designed so that you can acquire not only the epic/mythical equipment acquired in the guide of wisdom, but also the sirocco epic equipment.
+ Clear Watcher to gather Watchful Energy Light then enter Guide of Extinction to get your guarantee epic.
+ Full KDnF note here.

* Farming Improvement Update
+ Full QoL update. Things like dissemble Mythic and Mythic transfer system, BP conversion update. Exiles update. No limit on purchase. Upgrade legs to epic, etc. Every details are in the blogpost. Hopefully we get the budget beads too.
+ Although Operation Hope may differ since you know DFOG Unique Experience.

Events* Ria's Special Cube Laboratory Part 2
+ Basically like part 1, you roll and transmit once per week. Here's the full drop table. Looks like the research contribution reward are Fearsome Eyes.
+ This event also has cube shop so you can convert character-bound to account-bound materials.

* Honey Weekend
+ 10 Mins - 1 Guide of Wisdom Royal Ticket and 1 Watcher in the Rift Ticket
+ 30 Mins - Watchful Energy Box to enter Guide of Extinction
+ 1 Hour - 2 Guide of Wisdom Royal Ticket and 2 Watcher in the Rift Ticket
+ 2 Hours - Unknown

* Juicy Craft - Season 2
+ Gather Melon, Orange, and Strawberry to craft potion. Here's the recipe from years ago. Not sure if this season would be the same.
+ Here's the cumulated rewards, including Ore Despair Boxes (25 and 250 counts),  Petal Quartz Box (25 counts).
+ The final mission "Special Juice" is basically unlimited Warlord's Cry Potion and unlimited Mind's Stimulant Potion
+ These are Everlasting...until event ends

Sales* Arad Pass Season 2
* Avatar and reward unknown. Since we have the Watcher in the Rift, I expect we get free tickets as well. KDnF season 4 did the same thing.

Others* Content Creator Season 3 recruitment
+ Program will last for a year, but you can stop at any time (or you will be replaced if you do bad things). Same positions (streamer/caster/blogger/artist/video creator).

* Tigger's wearing Gucci
* Lost treasure will be updated
* 7th Fanart Content still going

Q&A* In DFOG, we have less people doing old raids, can we have unique buffs like permanent raid entry discount? (Similar to 1, 2, 3 Raid! event)
+ For now, it's hard to adjust it, but we will consider

* Can we get purchase count reset on "Awakened Ones All-in-One Package" from the Webstore?
+ We will check and consider it

* We want Mileage store updates with new items
+ We will look into new items

* Skill level titles/new weapon avatars soon?
+ One of them will be in next sale. Other can be added soon in the future

* With the new damage compression, lots of old damage fonts are weird now, will it be fixed?
+ Hard to adjust image now, but if you can elaborate and send specific example of which font, we can pass it on to the design team.

* People who already had the account bound mats for QoL, can we keep them?
+ It was an error but we releasing QoL anyway, so yes you can keep

* Why not implement system wide survey?
+ We will set up survey on what events and contents were good. Will have meeting with CA later.

* Why did we get spectre pass and not arad?
+ Arad Pass comes with next maint. So Tigger can buy Gucci jacket.

* Korean Gaming Committee (Gov. Agency) has strengthened their "RNG Integrity Law" - (All games must be honest with their in game RNG that involves Real Money Purchases and reveal them) which forced Neople to reveal more of their RNG in game.
* Starting from tomorrow's client patch, the following rate will be revealed in game:
+ Success rate at any reinforcement lv (beyond 10) [hovering over the number will reveal the mercy rate adjustment (the "white/blue/gold frames" if you fail certain lv multiple times)]
+ Success rate at any amplification level
+ Success rate at any refinement level
+ Bind cube
+ Kaleido box
+ Talisman and Runes combination rate)
+ Black Purgatory option change rate

* http://df.nexon.com/POP/probable\_item/ also has list of other things like BP mod conversion rate, talisman / rune combining, etc.

Reinforcement

| From | To | Chance |
| +10 | +11 | 25% |
| +11 | +12 | 15% |
| +12 | +13 | 14% |
| +13 | +14 | 13% |
| +14 | +15 | 12% |
| +15 | +16 | 11% |
| +16 | +17 and beyond | Appear to stay at 10% |

* Reinforcement Proficiency, Chance + Transform, and Kiri's favorite title (or equivalent) give +1 % each.

Amplification

| +1 | +2 | 100% |
| +2 | +3 | 100% |

| +4 | +5 | 80% |

| +6 | +7 | 60% (NOT typo) |
| +7 | +8 | 70% |
| +8 | +9 | 60% |
| +9 | +10 | 50% |
| +10 | +11 | 40% |
| +11 | +12 | 30% |
| +12 | +13 | 20% |
| +13 | 14 and beyond | Appear to stay at 20% |

  
Refinement

| From | To | Chance |
| +0 | +1 | 100% |
| +1 | +2 | 50% |
| +2 | +3 | 50% |
| +3 | +4 | 30% |
| +4 | +5 | 30% |
| +5 | +6 | 15% |

Modifications are not revealedOthers* They also released more info about the Winter Festival on http://df.nexon.com/df/pg/festival2021
+ The event will take place on Dec 19th, 2021 at 1900 (I assume this is Korean Time)
+ You can watch it on their Twitch and YouTube channel.
+ Looks like they will have some kind on raffle for online viewer including things like laptop, computer, rare avatar, gold amp, and new aura

* Black Purgatory Competition is announced. Basically you record yourself clearing BP solo mode at various levels, and those people with fastest time get rewards. They give you rewards including another aura along with "Black Purgatory Master" seal (not sure what these are).

* Just like every MMORPG out there, potions play an important role in the game not only to heal but also provide other buffs. Here's a quick summary of potion, how to get them, and which one to use.

Important* For potions that recover HP and MP, they often share cooldown. So make sure you go to the training center to see which one share cooldown with which one.
* In the example below, Heavenly HP potion and Canna's Homemade Bread share the same cooldown because they both recover 30% HP.

* However, Canna's Homemade Bread doesn't share cooldown with Adventure Recovery potion even though both restore 30% HP because they have different description.

How to Get* Buy from Cera Shop, they can be found under "Item" tab and "Dungeon" sub-tab. While they get the job done, I highly recommend you NOT get potion from here. There're other ways.
* From Neo Premium Vending Machine, her you use Neo Premium Token to as RNG slot machine. Often time you get lots of good potion. The down side is that these Tokens only drop in dungeons if you have Neo Premium Contract (which cost about $10 USD per month).

* From Arad Adventure system, this is a new mini-game added with Sirocco raid. While doing your adventure dungeons, you can encounter Gabriel's shop where you buy Mystery box from him. At the end of each month, I gather about 100-200 Recover Potions from this method.

* From events, Neople continuously give out free potions using event currency. So watch out for those. Here's an example.

* From Alchemy crafting, which is a profession that dedicate to making potions. DFO Wiki has a good page about this topic.

Which One to Use* Beside the HP / MP potions, there are other ones that give you huge boost. The following are commonly used by veterans in end-game dungeons and raids.
+ Warlord's Cry Potion: Attack damage +12% for 60 seconds
+ Mind Stimulant Potion: Reduces the cooldown of all skills by 20% for 10 minutes.
+ Undiluted Strength Potion: Boosts Strength by 175 for 30 minutes
+ Undiluted Intelligence Potion: Boosts Intelligence by 175 for 30 minutes
+ Undiluted Vital Potion: Max HP will increase by 1850 for 30 minutes
+ Undiluted Mana Nostrum: Max MP will increase by 1465 for 30 minutes

* Other non-dungeon potions that often used are:
+ Reinforcement Proficiency Formula: Increases your Reinforcement Success Rate for 30 minutes.
+ Elixir of Fatigue Recovery: Recovers Your Fatigue Level by 30. (You can only use it once per day).

* This is an event that has similar structure as DPL (DFO Premier League) where you compete with other players to clear the dungeon as fast as possible. Here's an example of DFOG 2018 DPL.
* In this event, there're multiple modes you can participate.
+ Pic 1, you can do party 1~4 players or play solo, just joint the appropriate channels (Path of the Strong or Path of the Strong: Proof)
+ Pic 2, you can choose play mode (pvp or solo). So if you want to play solo, do normal dungeon. If you want to compete with other people, do the matching dungeon.

* The following are some of the restriction based on the dungeon type.

* When doing PvP modes, the path can be customized based on the player. 24 bosses from end-game dungeons and raids are randomly added, and each team will take turn placing them on the path (red team goes first). The last boss (Ozma) is fixed.
* There is a buff mark at the bottom right of the boss icon. If you select a boss, when encountering that boss, this buff is applied only to the selected team. (You can check the effect when you mouse over the buff icon).

  
Rewards* This event has daily rewards and cumulative rewards. The event materials are
+ Token of the Strong
+ Medal of the Strong

* Daily missions are as follow:
+ Clear 1 Normal difficulty (Easy/Hard/Challenge). You can only get the the box of the highest difficulty you cleared. You get  /  /
+ Clear 1 Proof difficulty. You get
+ Win 1 Matching Dungeon. You get

* Reward boxes are as follow:
+ Easy Mode: Open will give 30  and 5
+ Hard Mode: Open will give 30  and 10
+ Challenge Mode: Open will give 50  and 15
+ Metal Box: Open will give 40

* Cumulative rewards (by wining 25 matches) are as follow:
+ Path of the Strong: Title Box  (140 Fames, no Stat)
+ Path of the Strong Proof: Aura Box  (315 Fames, no Stat)

  
  
Event Shop* Mythic Kaleido Box: Cost 300  (Limit 2 per account)
* Chaotic Grudge Box (25 Counts): Cost 100  (Limit 1 per week)
* Petal Quartz Box (50 Counts): Cost 100  (Limit 1 per week)
* Kaleido Box (3 Counts): Cost 75  (Limit 1 per week)
* Mind Stim Box (3 Counts): Cost 5  (Limit 5 per week)
* Warlord's Cry Box (3 Counts): Cost 5  (Limit 5 per week)
* 30% HP/MP Pot: Cost 1  (Unlimited purchase)

* Party Frame: Cost 340  (Limit 1 per account)
* Golden Amplification Grimoire: Cost 250  (Limit 2 per account)
* Aura Skin Slot: Cost 100   (Limit 1 per account)
* Kaleido Box (5 Counts): Cost 75  (Limit 1 per week)
* Ozma Emoji: Cost 45  (Limit 1 per account)
* Frigg Emoji: Cost 45  (Limit 1 per account)
* Trokka Emoji: Cost 45  (Limit 1 per account)

March 17th, 2022: New Level 110 Cap

New Dungeons* 8 Normal Dungeons and 2 Advanced Dungeons (like Oculus) will be added. Below are some promotion videos.
+ Saint's War | Noblesse Code | Destroyed Castle of the Dead | Laboratory of Eternal Flame

* The director stated that leveling / base gear farming is too easy and boring, and the gear spectrum is too wide between players (aka newbies vs veterans). Also setting standards on the new and gearless players makes the story boring and meaningless for the rest. So he wants to focus on making the leveling phase part of the content & interesting.
* Therefore, story dungeons will have regular difficulties (normal ~ king). Higher difficulty will give more rewards and EXP to level up. Gears will also drop during the story / leveling phase. Normal will be doable very easily, but king will require powerful gear such as Ozma's graduate.
* Hero difficulty will make a return as the challenging content for the geared players, including new patterns for mobs. This Hero mode will drop account-bound rewards.
* Advanced dungeons will haven no weekly entry limits. Raids weekly entry limit will remains the same. In addition, tickets & play point system will be added. This is where you spend FP for the points, use the points to buy the tickets for the advanced dungeons (tradable tickets can also drop). These tickets do not expire on weekly reset. The point is that you don't have to get your weekly homework done on that week. If you're busy, you can still use the tickets the following week. Achievements and dungeon missions will be added to motivate playing and make grinding a bit less stressing.

* One of the Advanced dungeon, Noblesse Code, will has a system similar to Squad Mode where you can pick and choose which reward you want to give to which alts.
* Can be entered with up to 4 characters, solo is fine if you’re strong enough but each char can only get a fixed number of epics so more chars = more pieces. Will have a very high epic drop rate.


New Gears* New gears are added. It's level 110 cap, but gear will be level 105. Gear’s level does not match characters’ max level because they wanted to try something new.
* He wanted to simplify damage mods. So for DPS, all 6 damage mods (e.g. Smash, Crit Smash, PMI, Str/Int, All, Bonus) will be merged into "Damage Increase" and will be a base option on all gears. For Buffers, all buff options will be merged into a new option called "Buff Power" and will be a base option on all gears.
* He wanted freedom of setups, so the new epic will have no set effects, only single pieces so you can use whatever pieces you want.
* These new epics will be new other options (e.g. increased CDR rate when enemy is in groggy, etc). Some pieces will have fixed effects, others will have modifiable options. These modifiable options can be changed with mats you get from dungeons.
* Option growth: New legendaries and epics will have a variety of options that gain EXP and level up.

* Moreover, you can merge duplicates to gain massive gear EXP.

* Ozma pieces and max Black Purgatory rolled Sirocco pieces (including weapons) are also usable for feeding EXP. The required EXP per level will increase exponentially while stat increase per level will decrease, so ‘maxing out’ won’t be necessary.

* Option transfer: For the pieces with customizable options 1 of the 4 options will be transferable to another piece to replace an option you don’t like. Unsure whether you can just do this for all 4 options at once and finish a piece, but they seem to be implying that you can only do this for 1 option.

* Weapons: There will be 2 different weapons for each kind: 1 focused on damage and 1 focused on skills improvement (similar to Chronicle / Talisman shoes). Drop rate for your own weapon will be much higher compared to others.
* Level 105 Rare/Unique/Legendary Equipment:
+ Rare: Will take over Ghent unique. Fully farmable in 2~3 days.
+ Unique: 2 different kinds, a damage set similar to 100 legendaries and a set that will be an improved abyssal swap. Will drop very rarely in tradable form.
+ Legendary: Similar power as the customizable epics but tradable. Designed to be a jackpot tradable gear to feed / transfer options to your epics.
+ Mythic and PoW: Those that are strong in single piece will be usable in place of the same slot 105 pieces for a while. Due to the remaining discrepancies and changes in systems some Mythics will be rebalanced.

* Others:
+ Inheriting and engraving will stay.
+ Gear rebalancing can happen more often than before to prevent 'crazy setups'
+ CDR will cap at 70% for all skills.
+ In dungeon, gear swapping (e.g. armors, acc and sub) will be restricted.
+ Dungeon selling: too cheap for too great of a return. Fame will limit dungeon entry (similar to exorcism) but the threshold won’t be too high (still under consideration)
+ No more hell / GoW: farm epics regular dungeons



More System Updates* Game’s systems will be drastically changed to reduce reliance on raw damage and improve the ARPG aspect. Will happen across several patches to prevent too many changes happening at once.
* Warlord and mind stimulant removed/nerfed (will no longer be necessary in dungeons).
* Improved TP effect for lower skills (skills below lvl 30): master/max level readjusted, tp redistribution .

* Readjusted defensive capabilities: Defensive abilities, max HP and armor / defense values will be rescaled, mobs will have much less I-frames. Will try to make defensive values and options on gears actually meaningful.
* Incapacitation gauge: A new gauge will be added below mobs’ HP bar to indicate their status effect immunity. Use appropriate attacks & deal with patterns to deplete the gauge and enter groggy or make the boss vulnerable to status effects.

* Revamped status effects: Status effects like freezing and petrification will be changed, they'll stop the enemies on their track but not actually interrupt their pattern. Other changes are also in plan.
* 3rd Awakening Skill Change: Too slow, they'll be reduced to about 3 seconds. Still thinking about what to do for a lotta stuff like animated cut-ins etc., plans might change in the future.
  
* Renewed Reinforcement / Amplification: This is a system unique to 100+ gears. They will have no failure penalty up to +12 reinforcement and +10 amp in exchange for slightly reduced chance and increased cost. Will also have a failsafe system to prevent being stuck at a certain level like +9 too many times.
* Base Element Boost: Element Boost on passives (such as Soul Bender and Female Nen) will be replaced with skill damage.
* Creatures: More dynamic participation in dungeons (creature skills) and artifacts renewal. Skills may be modifiable so that they can be more useful in dungeons. Artifacts will have new and meaningful effects. Details still in consideration.
* Dungeon & Life: A collection of minigames, fun stuff to do outside just running dungeons. Craft/buy items with what you get here including gears. Use mats that you can get from running dungeons to build new buildings & decorate your village. You can also visit other players’ villages. Won’t be a necessary content for progression.

* After Farming Improvement patch was released, everyone has been talking about how difficult it is for new player to progress. So I used some of my alts and ran this dungeon to see what was all the fuss was about.

How Ghent Changed* Before the patch, your daily reward count was at 20 runs, and each run can early up about 280 . So literally you could finish all 12 Ghent Unique pieces in like 2 days of farming. On top of that, all the extra Token you got, you can buy heavy weapon from Lindsey for easy money. It was one of the best method to farm gold for new player.
* After the patch, the daily reward count was changed to 6, and the amount of  you can get per run was severely nerfed.

* So I used 20 of my alts and ran Ghent Palace 120 times full clear on Expert mode with premium contract. I sold everything and also record what Unique dropped. There are 2 things I'm looking for:
1. How much Token and gold can I get?
2. If the Unique drop rate is increased, how long can I get all Ghent Unique pieces?

Data and Observation

* Token and Gold
+ From 20 alts, I got 5,411,818 gold. I also got 7,076 Tokens combining both untradable and account-bound versions. Using those will get me about 17 heavy weapons, which can be resold for 509,184 gold, which will earn me 5,921,002
+ So in average, each time I do my daily 6 runs, I get about 296,050 .
+ If you think about it, 6 runs give me about 300k, 20 runs would give about 986,833 gold. When you compare that to my previous analysis, you're not very far off. Granted this is a very small number of runs (120) compared to that data (400), but I'm sure the number won't be too far off.
+ In conclusion, does Farming patch nerf Ghent as a gold farm place? Not really. However, it's a bit inconvenience that you have to farm it in multiple alts to rack up the Tokens. So for new players, it can be harder to get the gold if they only have 1 character. They can still farm Ghent after the 6 runs, they will just get less gold.

* Character Progression
+ Since we get much less Token now, our primary source will have to be from dungeon drops. In the 120 runs, I got 48 Uniques and 2 Epics. So yeah, 40% unique drop rate is not bad at all.
+ Some observation about these Unique drops though. (1) You don't always get the weapon for your class. (2) Not sure if it was intended but the majority of armor drops seem to match the character's mastery. There was only 4 pieces that didn't match (e.g. Heavy Shoulder on Skirmisher).

How Long to Get 12 Unique Pieces?* It's hard to tell due to RNG. But let say I don't care about armor mastery, and I assumed all the above 20 alts are the same character and from using the above data:
+ Day 1: I would have Top and Shoulder
+ Day 2: I would have Ring
+ Day 3: I would have duplicates
+ Day 4: I would have Shoes and Magic Stone
+ Day 5: I would have Bracelet
+ Day 6: I would have duplicates
+ Day 7: I would have duplicates again. So I would have given up and used 2,474 Total Token to buy the remaining pieces. If this character happens to be Brawler, I would have the weapon on day 1.

* For new player who only have 1 character, it probably will take about 14 days to complete if you don't take drops into account. But if you count the drops, it will be much faster. But yeah, regardless, it will still be much slower than before the patch.

* This is a 4 weeks event that's very similar to the KDnF version a little while back. Here I'll summarize what you need to do to get all the rewards.

How to Get Materials* You can get them from doing daily mission. The first mission is complete any of Hero's Path Normal mode. To get there, simply go to Heroes' Path channel through NPC Allen in Seria Room. The amount of materials you get depends on the difficulty that you cleared.
+ Easy mode will give 30  and 5
+ Hard mode will give 30  and 10
+ Challenge mode will give 50  and 15

* The box you get is based on the highest level difficulty you cleared. As you can see in the picture below, I could only get through Hard mode.
* The second mission is clear Heroes' Path: Testament Normal solo mode. To get there, simply go to Testament channel through NPC Allen in Seria Room. In this channel, your current gear does not matter. You also get to choose your talisman and runes.
+ This mission gives 50  and 15

* The third mission is participate in Heroes' Path: Testament match mode. You don't have to win this part, simply just participate. You can AFK at first room if you want to. Be careful though, if both of you AFK, nobody will get rewards. This mission gives 40

* They also have accumulated reward, simply win Normal channel matches and Testament channel matches to get an extra Title and Aura. If you're Solo-Fighter-Online, you can get these from event shop too.

  
How Long does It take* For Token of the Mighty shop, to get all cosmetic and non-cosmetic, you will need 1,400  total, they're from:
+ 300  for  4 week worth of Kaleido Boxes (3)
+ 400  for  Sign of the Mighty Title Box
+ 400  for  Damage Font Selection Box
+ 300  for  Mythic-Only Option Kaleido Box

* By doing 1st mission on Easy mode, you get 30 , added on to the 50  from the 2nd mission each day, you can get up to 2,240 . Really it will only take you 17.5 days to complete this shop.
* By doing 1st mission on Challenge mode, you get 50 , added on to the 50  from the 2nd mission each day, you can get up to 2,800 . Really it will only take you 14 days to complete this shop here. As you can see, this event is kinda casual.
* For Token of the Mighty Shop, to get all cosmetic and non-cosmetic, you will need 1,375  total, they're from:
+ 300  for  4 week worth of Kaleido Box (5)
+ 340  for  Heroes' Path: Testament Party Frame
+ 300  for  Glory of the Mighty Aura Box
+ 300  for  Spirit of the Mighty Title Box
+ 45    for  Heroes' Path: Testament - Ozma Emoticon
+ 45    for  Heroes' Path: Testament - Frigg Emoticon
+ 45    for  Heroes' Path: Testament - Trokka Emoticon

* By doing 1st mission on Easy mode, you get 5 , added on to the 15  from the 2nd mission and 40  from the 3rd mission each day, you can get up to 1,680 . Really it will only take you 22.9 days to complete this shop.
* By doing 1st mission of Hard mode, you can get 10  instead of 5. So now it will take you about 21.1 days to complete this shop.
* If you're doing 1st mission of Challenge mode, you will get 15 , which will bring your time down to 19.6 days to complete this shop.

TL;DR* Do Heroes' Path Solo mode on EASY
* Do Testament Solo mode
* Do Testament Match mode. Match up and AFK if needed for easy
* Do this 20 out of 28 event day period

Time Encore* This is your basic log in event like Honey Time in DFOG. So AFK and get rewards.

* Himan Stella's One More Encore Song Box - Log in for 16 hrs16 mins 16 sec. Open will give you a random reward out of the following 3 options:

+ Mythical Option Kaleido Box - Allows you to pick and roll one specific line of your mythic options. This works like the one we get from Writings of the Apostles event.

Book of Creation* Remember the Monster Colosseum we had November of 2020? This is basically the version 2.0 of that. Instead of upgrading your monsters, here you upgrade your towers.

Hendon Myre Music Festival* Simple event really, you complete daily quests to get Anniversary coin.

* Himan Stella Emote: Cost 160  (1 per account). See Melody for Adventurers event above for pictures.
* Himan Stella Headband Avatar: Cost 160  (1 per account). See Melody for Adventurers event above for pictures.
* Level 100 Epic Armor/Accessories/Special Equipment Random Epic box: Cost 40  (1 per account per week)
* Disposable Amplifier: Cost 20  (2 per account per week).
* 30 FP pot: Cost 10  (2 per account per week).
* Box of 100 ores: Cost 20  (3 per account per week).
* Himan Stella March: Stella appears and sings a march, greatly increasing the movement speed of nearby members for 60 seconds (can't use in end game dungeons like raids, oculus, purgatory, etc.). Cost 5  (3 per account per week).
* 3 Recovery Potion: Recover 30% HP/MP. Cost 5  (No purchase limit)

* With the release of Black Purgatory, Roschest Outskirts has been in the hotspot of the best place to farm. What were dropped? How much gold can you get?
* Here I clear the dungeon 400 times to see how it's compared to Stormy Route.

Procedure & Data* Roschest is tricky, instead of taking a fixed 8 FP per run like other level 100 dungeon, it takes 1 FP per room. On top of that, the FP required to clear Roschest depends on the mini-boss at room 4. You can follow this Black Purgatory Daily Dungeons Simply Explained for the optimal route of farming. In a nutshell, it can take anywhere from 9~11 FP to clear the dungeon.
* Therefore, to be consistent, I decided to do full clear (12 FP). Below is the data for what I got with Neo-Premium without repair cost (each character represents 20 runs at Normal Mode).

* And here's the data from previous Stormy Route runs from my previous post Stormy Route: Sirocco "Nerf" Debunked. Same procedure, 20 runs, sell all drop, not include repair cost, etc. Jackpot means you encounter the demon dog thingy that drop a bunch of Time's Guide Stones.

Discussion* In term of raw gold: I used market price 25,999 for  and 5,900 for
+ Raw gold means what I got by selling all the drops and selling   in the auction hall.
+ For Stormy Route, you average 1,048,788 gold per 20 runs (aka 6,555 gold per FP)
+ For Roschest, you average 1,600,821 gold per 20 runs (aka 6,670 gold per FP)
+ Note that this Roschest average is based on full run of 12 FP, and you earn about 1.75% more gold than Stormy Route, so if you follow the optimal route through the algorithm, I'm sure you can make even more.

* In term of progression:
+ For Stormy Route, you average 61  per 20 runs (aka 0.38  per FP)
+ For Roschest, you average 27  per 20 runs (aka 0.11  per FP)
+ So, if you want more hell mat to run Guide of Wisdom, Stormy Route is probably better place to farm. In return, you only earn just a little bit less gold.
Final Impression

* Roschest Outskirts:
+ Pros:
- Drops tradable materials like  which can easily funneled into another character. You will make more gold than Stormy Route if you sell these in the auction hall.
- Drops a lot more  than stormy route, which is one of the main complain from lots of players.
- Drops Black Purgatory materials so you can roll your luck.
- Drops epic if you're lucky.

+ Cons:
- Requires a lot more gear to farm effectively. My full Aeterna Berserker can farm Stormy easily. But when I bring him to Roschest, oh man, it wasn't good.

* Stormy Route:
+ Pros:
- Drops more hell mats for Guide of Wisdom.
- Drops a bit more gold, but you will end up making less if you sell all the Aiolites and Time Crystals from Roschest.
- Doesn't require as much gear to clear.

+ Cons:
- Those hell mats are untradable, so hard to funnel to another alt.
- Doesn't drop as much , which pretty needed for everything in level 100. With Ozma raid on the horizon, you're gonna need even more.
- Doesn't drop epic.

Which One I Farm* Neither, I don't farm 1 dungeon mindlessly with 1 character. I do my daily on multiple alts. Think about it, doing daily 4s on 5 alts is the same as doing 20 runs with 1 alt. Plus I get to enjoying playing variety of characters. So, pick your poison bois.

* It has been over a year since the last Gear Progression Roadmap was done.
* That guide was great when 100 cap was first introduced to help players transition from their 95 cap gear. But since then, many many new contents have been added.
* This guide is made to help you progress beyond that point. And it's organized bases on the release date of the contents.
* Before we get started, I'll assume you already read the first addition Level 100 Cap: Guide to Gear Progression and you already start farming Legendary (5+5) and Epic dungeon (2+2).

Table of Contents* 05/2020 - The Oculus: The Sanctum of Resurrection
* 06/2020 - The Oculus: The Abysmal Sanctum
* 08/2020 - Dark Dimension: Signs of a Rift
* 10/2020 - Sirocco Raid
* 02/2021 - The Exile Mountains
* 05/2021 - The Night of Revelation
* 06/2021 - The Continent of Aeterna
* 06/2021 - Sirocco Challenge Mode
* 07/2021 - Black Purgatory
* 09/2021 - Grave Tower
* 10/2021 - Ozma Raid



The Oculus: The Sanctum of Resurrection* Released on May 2020, this is a 4-man dungeon added just right after level 100 cap was released. You can learn how to clear it from this The Oculus: The Sanctum of Resurrection Made Simple guide.
* The whole point of this dungeon is to get gather enough material (Grim Seeker's Dark Soul) to get your Ditto epic piece. It's named after the Pokemon who can change to any other Pokemon.
* As the name suggest, upon completing the quest, you can pick any epic piece you want. You can also change it to whatever as well, it would just cost some materials.
* You can see which piece is the Ditto epic by the star indicator. As you can see, it's a huge help in progressing your character.

* If you don't know which Ditto piece to pick, the Gear Calculator has an option to include Ditto. Just pick that and let the program do the job for you. Note that you will need input enough pieces for this option to work.
  


The Oculus: The Abysmal Sanctum* Released in June 2020, this is a harder version of the regular Oculus. You can learn how to clear it from this The Oculus: The Abysmal Sanctum Made Simple guide.
* This content, in my opinion, doesn't really add much to your progression. Because if you're strong enough to do this hard mode, you're pretty much at the end-game already.
* Most people do this for the epic weapon box  and Product of Wisdom recipes .
+ The  is account-bound so you can farm this on your top geared characters, then use it on your alt since you can choose class specific weapon.
+ The  can drop at low chance and can be sold for a very expensive price.



Dark Dimension: Signs of a Rift* Released in August 2020, this content has good intention. When upgraded all the way, it can be strong. Unfortunately, the farming time is quite long, and the effort required to get to that point doesn't not worth the trouble.
* I have done an analysis about this and you can read about it in this Dark Dimension: An Analysis of Upgraded Level 100 Legendary Equipment


Sirocco Raid* Released in October 2020, this is the next big major step in your progression.
* The main goal of this raid is to get new epic pieces. It also has another Ditto option as well, but here you can only pick in the pull of Sirocco specific pieces.

  
* This raid adds 5 different sets of 3-pieces along with additional weapon upgrade. Each piece can be fused to your existing epic piece to give you more stat.

  
* Each set has their own strengths and weaknesses, and the drops are purely RNG. In the Korean server, they already have Sirocco Farming Improvement added. But in the meantime, it has not reached DFOG server.
* Below is an example of my character having 3 Sirocco Rodos pieces fused to my Bottom, Ring, and Sub Equipment pieces. Unfortunately, I'm still missing the weapon upgrade.
* The Epic Calculator again also has Sirocco option you can choose to see which one best fit for you.

* You can read about how to do this raid in this Sirocco: 7-stages Raid Made Simple guide.


The Exile Mountains* Released in February 2021, this is another upgrade to your character. Here instead of upgrading your actual epic pieces, you're upgrading your talisman. You can think of this content as the next version Pandemonium War.
* The cutline is about Sirocco raid green party. So you don't have to completely grad Sirocco to do this content. This is intended to do side-by-side with Sirocco raid.
* Here of course you upgrade your current P. War talisman to its Capella's Stigma version. You can also upgrade your runes as well from Rare to Unique tier.
* Here's an example of my talisman. As you can see, I still need to upgrade my runes.
* You can learn how to do this content in this Exile Mountains Made Simple guide.



The Night of Revelation* Released in May 2021, this is a side solo content of the Exile Mountain.
* This content is not intended to progress your main character, but rather help you gear up your alts. Think of this as the upgraded version of Pandemonium Meeting.
* I do this content to buy Prey Raid mat to upgrade level 95 gear to level 100 for my alts. You can also buy budget enchant beads as well. They provide similar stat to Sirocco raid enchants, just a bit weaker.
* You can learn how to do this content in this Night of Revelation Made Simple guide.


The Continent of Aeterna* Released in June 2021, this is another side content that is not intended to progress your main character. You do this content is mainly gear up your synergy characters.
* In a nutshell, it adds 8 more epics set to level 100 cap that when used in while soloing, it will activate a set of stat. Then when used in a party of 2 or more, it activates another set of stat. This party stats provide huge synergy effects for everyone else but you (you basically a sandbag here).
* When used appropriately, character that use Aeterna gear can get into end game contents such as Sirocco raid and later contents.
* The best part about this content is can be easily funneled. So when farmed with enough alts, you can gear up character in no time.
* You can read everything about this content in this Aeterna category. It includes guides about how to farm gear, which set to use, how many alts needed to farm, and why you should do this content event for DPS character.


Sirocco Challenge Mode* Released in June 2021 along with Aeterna, in my opinion, it doesn't really add much progression to your main character. Think of this like the Oculus Hard Mode. If you're strong enough to clear Sirocco Challenge Mode, you're already hit the class ceiling.
* Really the main rewards from this mode are Chest of Immateriality, new Product of Wisdom, and a show-off aura.
* Regardless, you can learn how to do this content in this Sirocco Challenge Made Simple guide.


Black Purgatory* Released in July 2021, this is another major upgrade to your character. This content provide 2 type of new materials.
* Ore of Despair , which is used to change the modifier (via rolling) on the equipment slots that can be fused with Sirocco epic (i.e. Weapon, Bottom, Ring, Sub Equip). Each roll will take 165 Ore and 20k gold.

* Fearsome Eye , which is used to maximize that modifier you rolled with Ore of Despair. Maxing each slot will require 13 eyes.

* For example, I rolled the target option for my weapon of Additional Att. Damage. I can use the 13  to max this modifier to 30% at guarantee success rate.

* These stat that you rolled are independent of your sirocco piece's stat. So you can basically roll for whichever modifier you want that best fit your character's needs.
* If you don't know which stat to roll for, again, the Epic Calculator also give you the recommended stats to roll for. It basically tries to equalize all the modifiers your sets provide so you can maximize your damage output.

* Of course for this recommendation to work, make sure you select the Black Purgatory options in the calculator.

* You can learn how to do this content in this Black Purgatory Made Simple guide.



Grave Tower* Released on September 2021, this is another side content that doesn't really add much to your progression. Instead, it's designed to gear up your alts. This tower is extremely hard, so don't expect to get very far.
* The idea is you send your strongest characters here to gather "Old Golden Coin" to buy stuff from the shop. Really the item you want to buy is the epic pot.
* The great thing about this pot is that you can pick and choose which weapon type you want to buy. For example, if I want Zanbato on my Sword Master, I can just buy the Zanbato pot. Since there's only 2 level 100 epic Zanbato, I at least have 50% chance if getting the weapon I want.

  


Ozma Raid* Released in October 2021, this raid is another big step to your progression.
* The concept is similar to Sirocco raid, where you get new epic pieces to fuse to your existing gear. In Sirocco, you fuse with Weapon, Bottom, Ring, and Sub Equipment. In Ozma, you fuse with 5 more slots: Head/Shoulder, Belt, Shoes, Necklace, Magic Stone.
* Ozma raid also comes with its Ditto piece, but the major different is the Holy Grail of Faith system, where you can reroll your pieces while filtering out which pieces you don't want.
* Below are some of great resources for this raid:
+ Ozma Raid Made Simple
+ Ozma of Chaos Raid for Dummy
+ Ozma Raid Tips and Tricks
+ Ozma Epics Made Simple
