* I have been doing Sirocco raid weekly since its release and I still don't have the weapon on my main. If I can't grad Sirocco in 9 months, how long will Purgatory RNG take?
* Luckily with the new farming improvement released in Korea server, you can possibly grad in about 3 months ... if you're whale enough.

Table of contents* What is Purgatory Grad
* For the Casual
* For the Whales
* For the GO ALL OUT
* TLDR



What is Purgatory Grad* In a nutshell, Black Purgatory provides 2 new materials:
+ Ore of Despair , which is used to change the modifier (via rolling) on the equipment slots that can be fused with Sirocco epic (i.e. Weapon, Bottom, Ring, Sub Equip). Each roll will take 165 Ore and 20k gold.
+ Fearsome Eye , which is used to maximize that modifier you rolled with Ore of Despair. Maxing each slot will require 13 eyes.

+ For example, I rolled the target option for my weapon of Additional Att. Damage. I can use the 13  to max this modifier to 30% at guarantee success rate.

* Regardless of how many  you have in your inventory, since you have 4 slots to RNG roll, you will need at least 52  to max their stats.
* So what does it take to get 52 Fearsome Eyes? Let's do some simple math.



For the Casual* Let's say you're the most casual player in the game. You don't farm any daily dungeons at all. The only thing you did is to do 2 Black Purgatory level 1 runs.
* Let's also say you're has the worst RNG in the game, you will get 550  per week (275x2) with no gold  flips.
+ Lucky for you, in the recent KDnF update, you can buy up to 2 Fearsome Eye boxes  per week for a price of 630  each.
+ So with your casual earning of 550 , each week you can get 0.87 . Therefore, to graduate Black Purgatory as an extreme casual with worst RNG, it will take you about 60 weeks (aka 15 months).
+ I'm still collecting data from daily dungeon runs. But so far, each daily normal runs of 4 dungeons gives you about extra 52 . So add that to your 550  will get you about 1.45  per week, which will translate to about 36 weeks (9 months) to grad.

* Let's say you have the best RNG, you get 292  and 1  every level 1 run.
+ 584  will get you about 0.93  per week from , adding 2  from your runs will translate to about 18 weeks (4.5 months).
+ If you add the daily farming, that will bring down to about 15 weeks (3.75 months).

* AND that doesn't take in account for the  needed to roll for the modifier you want. I doubt many people can get it in 1 roll.



For the Whales* When the KDnF update hit live server, each box of 50  was sold in the auction hall for about 1.2 million gold (sauce).

* So really, you don't even have to run the content and just buy those boxes for your weekly 2 . Therefore, to get 52 , it will take you 26 weeks (6.5 months) of buying these boxes.
* AND to buy 52  (aka 32,760 ), you will need to spend 786 million gold.
* AND (of course) that doesn't take in account for the  needed to roll for the modifier you want.

  


For the GO ALL OUT* What if you buy the  and has the best RNG? what then...
* Well, in this case I will assume you do level 4, because whale...
* Both level 4 runs give 936  and 2 . So you only need to spend 7.7 million gold to buy the remaining 324  for the weekly .
* At this rate, you can grad in 13 weeks (3.25 months) and only need to spend about 25 million gold.
* AND (of course) that doesn't take in account for the  needed to roll for the modifier you want.



TL;DR* Casuals:
+ Worst RNG + level 1 BP = 15 months
+ Worst RNG + level 1 BP + Daily = 9 months
+ Best RNG + level 1 BP = 4.5 months
+ Best RNG + level 1 BP + Daily = 3.75 months

* Whales:
+ No BP + Gold only = 6.5 months & 786 million gold
+ Best RNG + level 4 BP + Gold = 3.25 months & 25 million gold

* The Black Purgatory update adds 4 new daily dungeons to your homework.
* Here I summarize the layout of each dungeon, why I think Outskirts of Roschest is good for farming, and how can you farm it effectively.

General Info

* What's special about these daily dungeons is that they don't normally take 8 FP to enter like other level 100 dungeon (e.g. Basement of Pain, Back Shrine). Here they follow the normal pattern like every other dungeon in DFO (i.e. 1 FP per room).
* Below is the map of all 4 dungeons. As you can see, it will take 8 FP to rush to boss. Then they all have 4 extra rooms (highlighted in white).
* The way these dungeons are designed is that there are specific mini-bosses and named champion in specific rooms.

Which Spawn Where* Beside the final boss, there are 3 other type that can spawn.
* The Mini-boss: These ALWAYS spawns in the first intersection (room 4) of every map. They usually drop an Aiolite or Time Crystal.
+ For Outskirts map, they are 3 possible spawns, and we will talk about it in a bit.
+ For the other 3 maps, these mini-bosses are the Followers of the Dark Knights.

* The Intruder: From what I've seen, these spawns about 2 rooms before the boss.
+ If you have played the real Black Purgatory dungeon, these are the boss guarding the crossroad (Jade, Onyx, Venta).
+ Killing these will drop a handful (~10)  and possibly .
* The Fresh Blood (aka Chanpion monsters): These are the one that have the green name above them.
+ They only spawn in the "extra" rooms randomly (aka the one highlighted in white).
+ They drop handful of Aiolites and Time Crystals (really anywhere from 1~10 if not more). These will be your main source of income while farming.
  
How to Farm Effectively* I'll run some number in future post to compare between them and stormy.
* Anyway, beside doing your normal daily clears for the special gold card flips, Outskirts of Roschest will be the best place for you to farm on, for a few reasons:
+ The bosses there are a lot easier to kill, their patterns are not as pain in the ass.
+ It's the only dungeon where you can predict the location the mini-boss, intruder, and the fresh blood, therefore you can spent FP more efficiently.

* When you're at the first intersection (room 4), the boss you fighter there will determine the possible location of other Fresh Blood and whether you will have an Intruder.
+ In the explanation below, the marked rooms are possible locations of Fresh Blood mob. The Red Mark is the direct indicator of Intruder present.

  
* If Onyx Black: Proceed downward!
+ If you see a Fresh Blood in the Red Mark room, that mean you're guarantee to have an Intruder. So kill the Fresh Blood for your batch of  / . Then go back and rush to boss, killing the Intruder on the way and get your extra .
+ If you DON'T see a Fresh Blood in the Red Mark room, that mean you won't have an Intruder (bummer). The next location of Fresh Blood will be one room over (Green Mark). So go there for your batch of  / , then go back and rush to boss.

.embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }
* If Venta: Proceed straight! forward the Orange Mark.
+ That's the only place you will find Fresh Blood. There's no indicator of whether you get Intruder. So clear for your batch of  /  and rush to boss.

* .embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }
If Jade: Proceed straight! to Green Mark instead of going down to Red Mark. Why?
+ If you go to Red Mark first and you don't see a a Fresh Blood (wasted 1 FP), you will need go to next room Green Mark. Whereas if you find a Fresh Blood right at Green Mark, you can just back track and rush to boss.
+ So when you get to the Green Mark and nothing there, go to Red Mark, kill the Fresh Blood for your batch of  / . Then go back and rush to boss, killing the Intruder on the way and get your extra .

* With the release of summer package 2021, we now have a new title that everyone has been talking about.
* Here I'll explain why it's unique and why it's extremely popular, even in Korea.

How It Work* When you get the package, opening the title box will give you 1 of 45 different titles.

* The pool is 45 title because you get a chance of getting 2 type of titles, Normal and Platinum (5 of each kind).
* Of the Platinum title, it's further split into 8 titles (each giving damage to a particular skill ranging from level 30 to level 80). So 8 times 5 is 40, plus 5 normal title, give 45 titles.

Why It Special* 15% damage modifier is nothing special for DFO global, but it's the additional damage to skill level is what make it unique. This is the first time we have had this in global version.
* This type of title is nothing new in Korea. They have had this for multiple packages, and it's one of the most popular title there. If you look at player ranking in Dunfaoff, pretty everyone there has this title.
* So why is it so popular? well, the current meta is more doing sustain damage with Black Purgatory and Ozma raid. So many players are switching to those type of build, which include more Cool Down Reduction (CDR) gears. Adding to the list is talisman, which many of them further increase damage for those skills.
* There you can see, Talisman + CDR gear such as Crossroad set + This title = OP gear.

How to Get It* If you look at the stat for all title, the best one is "A Midsummer Night Dream" due to the 15% modifier. You can RNG reroll this title for the one you want with "Title Change Ticket" for 500,000 gold each.
* Another way to guarantee getting the title with the skill damage you want is through the coin shop.
* For 4 coins, you can upgrade any title into "A Midsummer Night's Dream title". Then for another 4 coins, you can upgrade that title into the Platinum version that has a random skill option.
* Then you can RNG reroll this Platinum title for the skill you want for 2 coin each.

* Really if you think about it, it will take at least 10 coins to get the Platinum you want, and you may need to reroll more for the skill. So Neople put another option in this coin shop.
* For 10 coins, you can buy the "A Midsummer Day Title Box", which basically A Midsummer Night's Dream Platinum version (aka best version title) AND you get to select which skill you want on that too.

Which Skill to Pick* One of our player with explorer club "Dream" has kindly compiled a comprehensive popularity list for every class in the game using Dunfaoff ranking system (basically going into people profile and see which level title they use).
* You can see that list in this BiS Skill Boosting Title For Each Class Excel Sheet. Of course, only use this as reference and don't follow it blindly.
Should I Buy This Title* Our official DFOG Content Creator, Yong\*, has created a great flow chart just to answer this question. It also compares this title with previous ones we had.
* In a nutshell, this title is pretty much for min-maxing your character. Below is an example from KDnF player showing the damage increase.
* In the picture below, both titles give the same 15% modifier, but the one on the left give 10% damage to level 45 skill. This player is a Female Ranger, which level 45 skill (Death Hawk) is extremely popular. This player concluded that the damage increase was only about 2.5%.

Referenceshttps://m.blog.naver.com/tjehdrms0908/222038684051Reddit - Yong\*'s "Should I Buy This Title" Flow Chart  
 Excel - BiS skill boosting title for each class

* We all know that Aeterna is all about synergy gear. We all hear people say "Aeterna is only good for synergy character". But did you know these epics are actually really good for soloing play?
* Here I'll quickly show you how strong these epics are and why you should do this content. Playing as a NOOB berzerker.


.embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }  
What Gear?* Really this character is super barebone. I ran Bee set on him, and in case you don't know, all Aeterna sets when solo will have the same stat.
* I got nothing on him. No enchants, aura, avatar, talisman, pet, insignia. No gear retexture. NOT even swap set. NOTHING.
* The only thing I got is +6 refinement on the weapon.

* With this gear, I was able to clear Black Shrine in about 1m15s with 48% Crit Chance.

Should You Do Aeterna?* 1,000% yes, even if you're playing a DPS character. This content provide a much much much faster progression to your character with very little investment.
* If you're one of those alterholic player, this is great to gear up your dead alts. Farming with enough alts can get you full 11/11 Aeterna epic in a week.
* Take that in contrast with trying to clear 2+2 with full legendary gear. Full legendary will take you anywhere from 2.5~3 weeks of daily 5+5. PLUS you need basic enchants, swap set, crit cap, budget pet and title.

Two Birds With One Stone* Now imaging if you have Aeterna on a synergy character. Really you only need 8 pieces, so that farming time is even shorter.
* While doing daily solo 2+2 to slowly gear yourself up with regular level 100 epic, you can participate in other endgames content such as Pandemonium War, Occulus, Prey Raid, and possibly Sirocco raid. Even in Korea, people are taking Aeterna Syn in Ozma Raid (although you will need a bit more optimization and investment).
* Aeterna really takes away many roadblocks and expedites the gearing progress tremendously.
  
* To learn more about this content, visit this Continent of Aeterna Made Simple.

* This is an event released with the update of Female Gunner 3rd Awakening on June 29th, 2021. It was quickly abused and patched up with an Emergency Maintenance.
* This article explain the situation and hopefully it can be avoided in future events.

What is the Event* You can read the full event page here. But in the nutshell, this is a leveling event where you can pick any character and potentially level it up to max 100 in a very short amount of time.
* This type of event uses a special type of dungeon, where you can fly through everything and level up very quickly.

* The one item that was being abused was the weapon. When your event character hit level 95, they give you a selective level 100 epic weapon that has +12 reinforcement / +8 refined.

How It Was Abused* Before the Emergency Patch, the weapon from this box can actually be transferred to another character using NPC Magar Rosenbach, and you can select event character over and over.
* So what happened was players was using this weapon to attempt +13 reinforcement. If it success, they would transfer it to their main. If fail, they would delete that event character and choose another character in the account as event character. The process is then repeat over and over.

  
Respond from Neople* The problem was quickly brought up to the developer and it was quickly patch
  
* Personally, from my point of view, this was definitely not a bug, but rather just an oversight. It was possibly a simple human error. Regardless, I thought they did a great job at addressing the problem in such a short amount of time.

* This week updates doesn't add new content really. But instead, it adds UI improvement for the chatting system. Here are the highlights.
* Problem: The current chat window is not freely adjustable in placement and size.
+ Solution: You can adjust the size of the chat window, insane size.

+ The chat window can be moved separately from the megaphone window.

+ The default size of the megaphone window is changed from 4 lines to 3 lines.

* Problem: The conversation filter in the chat window was inconvenient to operate and the setting state was not saved properly.
+ Solution: The ability to turn off filters in the System tab at once is added. You don't have to click each one individually.

+ When you're using external chat, you can now hide the "system" chat.

* Problem: Dungeon & Fighter does not have many ways to communicate between adventurers in the game.
+ Solution: Channel chat added. You can talk to people on the same channel. I guess now you don't have to be in the same map area to see other people chat.
+ If you chat more than 10 times in a row at intervals of 3 seconds or less, you cannot use the chat for 30 seconds. I suppose this is a way to reduce spam.
+ You can use the channel chat directly through the shortcut key (/c).
+ New/returning users are displayed in green, and cannot set a separate color change.

* Problem: Due to the nature of the game, where character changes are frequent, guild conversations are often cut off in the middle, making it difficult to communicate with guild members.
+ Solution: You can view the last 20 guild conversations when you log in.

* BONUS: The new "fade" option is added for megaphone chat and regular chat.
+ Since you can freely move them around, you can actually overlap the megaphone chat onto your regular chat, then set the echo chat to "fade".
+ In the example below, this player resize megaphone to the smallest possible, then overlap, then fade. Now you will never have to see megaphone ever again. TADA!!!

* This event was first released as part of KDnF 15th Anniversary contents.
* In this game, you can build and upgrade your town, recruiting more adventures and send them into expedition.
* In this guide, I'll explain how this work, which building do what, and some simple strategies. Be sure to check back on this guide for any edit made in the future.

Basic Concepts* In the beginning, you start with Seria's Tree. This is basically your main command center. The higher level you upgrade, the more buildings are unlocked. Note that you will start out with only a portion of the map as buildable, you will have to upgrade Seria's Tree to uncover more building spaces.
* You will start with 4 Adventures, and you can send them to various missions so you can earn rewards and upgrade your building. The more building you have, the more adventures you can recruit.



Some Housekeeping Stuffs* The game shuts down when you move channel: Unlike Arad Adventure, you will need to open the game up and start it every time you move channel. The good news is that the game will still run when you switch characters.
* When you remove a building, you DON'T get a refund: This is crucially important because gold is tight in the early game. Most people will just build like the picture below.

* When placing a building, only when the road is connected, guests can visit:
+ There are 11 building, and this only apply to the ones that sell stuff (e.g. Bakery, Dress Room, Market). So pay attention to the description.
+ You can build additional path to make sure guest can come in.

* Roads provided by default cannot be removed: The highlighted stone paths are provide by default, so use them to place your building.



Building Related Information* Most of your building can be found in the construction tab. Higher level building will require Soul as well (I'll show you how to get them later).



Seria's Tree* Just like when you run dungeon, your adventures inside this mini-world also consume FP while they're on exhibitions.  Adventures will consume 1 FP for each monster they defeat. Consume 4 FP if they die.
* The higher level Seria's Tree is, the faster your adventures can recover FP.
+ Level 1: Recovers 1 fatigue every 50 seconds (total recovery = 2 hours and 10 minutes)
+ Level 5: Recover 1 fatigue every 46 seconds (total recovery = 2 hours)
+ Level 10: Recovery 1 fatigue every 41 seconds (total recovery = 1 hour 47 minutes)
+ Level 15: Recovery 1 fatigue every 36 seconds (total recovery = 1 hour 34 minutes)



Remedial Basilica* When an Adventure dies, they go here. Higher level will revive them faster.
+ Level 1: 90 seconds to full recovery
+ Level 15: 20 seconds to full recovery



Bakery* This is a place where you craft stuffs to sell to customer that walked in for coins. The basic one is bread.



Adventurer's Guild Office* This is the most important building for mid-late game. This is your ONLY source of SOUL.
* Think of this like a place where you send out hit-list for your adventures. You can send out up to 4 adventures to hunt down those hit-list. As you can see, the higher level these hit-list are, the more gold and higher tier souls you can get.



Linus' Forge* This is where you can make weapon and other equipment to make your adventures stronger. Higher equipment will require higher tier souls.



Sharan's Wizard Guild* Just like "Linus' Forge" where you get your weapon and armor, in Sharan place, you can craft your accessory.



Loton's Alchemy Shop* You can craft potion here to help your Adventures survive longer. They will be consume automatically.


Danjin's Jar Shop* Of course, what is a mini-game that doesn't have RNG gacha machine? Here you basically break pots for a chance of strong equipment.


Adventurer Related Information* You start out with 4 adventures and you get more as you place more building. Each adventure will have 4 equipment slots, and you unlock them as you level up.
* Just like all the old school MMORPG, each level up you get attribute point to put them into 4 possible places: Attack, Defense, Health, and Crit. You can reset attribute as well, it would just cost a bunch of coins.



Which Attribute to Invest* Below is the comparison between Attack (Blue), Defense (Red), and Health (Gray), compiled by the KDnF community. The x-axis is the number of point invested for each stat. The y-axis is the amount of hit needed to kill a mob or the amount of hit needed to kill the adventure. (See EDIT at the bottom for further recommendation)

* As you can see, whichever curve is the stiffest is the one you should invest in. I'll give you some examples.
* Example 1: If you invest 12 points in defense based on adventurer level 21, you need to hit 22 times to kill the adventurer, and you need 2 points to increase one.

* Example 2: At level 31 adventurer, if you invest 11 points in attack power, you need to hit 8 times to kill a mob, and 3 points are required to reduce 1. As you can see, investing on attack power is not as efficient as Defense.

* Example 3: If you invest 16 points of HP based on Adventurer level 41, you need to hit 24 times to kill the Adventurer, and you need 3 points to add 1 more. Again, still not as efficient as Defense.

* So here're the TLDR:
+ Attack Power: Efficiency is high in the beginning, but decreases with investment.
+ Defense: Low efficiency at the beginning, but increases with investment.
+ Health: Shows a certain efficiency, but falls short compared to defense.



What about Critical?* KDnF has a chart for that too. Here are the comparison between Attack (Blue) vs. Critical (Orange). The x-axis is the number of point invested for each stat. The y-axis is the calculated attack power. Here they assume that 1% attack is the same as 1% critical.
* As you can see, there's a huge gap between the two. Unless you can equip that much attack power from epic tier items, it doesn't worth putting point on Critical.



Tips and Tricks* Building:
+ Those building that sell items (e.g. bakery), the entrance of the building must face the path so customers can come in and buy things.
+ The blacksmith & guild office doesn't sell anything, so they don't have to face the path.
+ It is recommended to upgrade the building in the order of Tree → Guild Office → Blacksmith. (Higher level Tree = higher fatigue recovery speed up per hour, Higher level Guild Office = more Soul farming required for building upgrade, Higher Blacksmith = Making higher items necessary for hunting)

* Making Coin:
+ In the beginning, they give you a free bakery, so you just have to send the characters to the goblin hunting grounds, farm the ingredients, and make and sell bread. (25 coins each)
+ There're also Market and Dress Room as well, so use those to make coin the same way as bread. (Market 40 coins each, Dressing room 60 coins each)

* Mob Stat:
+ Goblin: HP 420, Attack 80, Defense 50
+ Tau: HP 2600, Attack 140, Defense 50
+ Bigfoot: HP 3700, Attack 184, Defense 50
+ Walker: HP 5200, Attack 238, Defense 50
+ Kashipa: HP 6500, Attack 323, Defense 50
+ Auca: HP 7700, Attack 373, Defense 50

EDIT 9/3/2021* Another strategy that claimed to work well is the "Glass Canon". It basically says that end game subjugation like Isys and above have so much damage that it's better just dump all your point into Attack. As long as your adventure can do 1 hit, that's all that worth it. The reddit threads are:
+ [Arcade Fighter Online] Sirocco Cleared
+ Week 2 of AFO...Belfast is oof.

* I was interested and reset 4 of my adventures who were level 83, 71, 70, and 69, who were struggling to clear Luke subjugation. It costed be about 150k coins or so and I changed them all to attack. Their gears and stat as follow. Blow in the hole, it seemed to work quite well.
* If you're a player who do all Defense like me right at the beginning, I don't think you wasted your time and coin. I thought the leveling process with Defense went well. It's only the Subjugation part that didn't pay off.

EDIT 9/17/21* I was finally able to defeat Sirocco in subjugation. Below is the proof and my characters stats along with my main building levels.

* What make Sirocco hard is that she does AoE damage and she heals 1,000 HP every few second. What I did to defeat her is basically keep sending adventures over and over. I swapped all my adventures from Defense to Attack.
* As you can see, after defeating Sirocco, 8 adventures were out of FP, and 8 adventures were at about half FP. So make sure you have enough adventures that are at high enough level before you face Sirocco.

Main Changes* To minimize the burden of the necessary equipment farming, the following improvement were added.
* First, 50% of materials acquired from dungeons will be account-bound. This will supports those who plays multiple characters.
* Second, by decreasing the number of entries for weekly non-raid content while maintaining the reward level, they want to ease the playtime required for one character.
* Third, to alleviate the high randomness of farming, the drop rate of some equipment/material items has been increased. Thus Mythic equipment transcendence system is added, runes / talisman shop purchase limit lifted, shop sales/upgrade cost reduction, etc.
* Fourth, the option conversion system of Black Purgatory will be improved, Added 'option transfer' and 'option change' systems.

* Pandamonium War was first released on Feb 11, 2020 with its new addition to the talisman system. To read more about this system, refer to this Pandemonium War: A Guide to Talisman System
* Pandamonium War consists of 5 main dungeons and 1 hidden dungeon.
+ Main dungeons:
- Spire Throne
- Reverse Street
- Silent Chapel
- Bleeding Underground Passage
- The Academy

+ Hidden dungeon
- Gizel’s Laboratory

How It Work* Upon starting the dungeon series, you will see the map above.
* 4 dungeons will spawn around main dungeon, Spire Throne.
* Each of these 4 dungeon has a sigil on top of its name indicating its dungeon type.
+ - Key and Pentacle need to cleared to open up the shield around Spire Throne.
+ - Sword & Shield once cleared will increase everyone's damage by 15% each dungeon clear (up to 30% if clear both dungeon)
+ The dungeon types are randomized between these 4 dungeons.

* Every time you entered these 4 dungeon arounds Spire Throne, there's a chance the hidden dungeon, Gizel’s Laboratory, will spawn.
* Defeat Dark-eyed Sarpoza in Spire Throne will complete Pandemonium War dungeon series.

Dungeon Mechanics  
Reasons to do Pandemonium War* Best in slot card enchantment for Earring.
* Talismans and Runes for your class. They are basically chronicle 2.0

* This is a 4-player dungeon that consist of 4 floors released on May 12, 2020.
* You need to level 100 to enter. You can enter 3 times per week, once per day, but on able to receive rewards twice per week.
* This dungeon doesn't require entry material but will consume 30 Fatigue Points.

Time Limit* There is no real time count down, but when you enter, the Ritual Completion gauge will begin to increase.
* Your mission fails if you let this gauge reach 100%, and the entry you used will be reset.
* Certain Grim Seeker monsters decrease Ritual Completion by 20%.
* You can retry this as many times as you want within the time limit, so long as you stay in the same party.
* You will lose your chance to reenter if you leave the party.
* Life Tokens are limited to 2 per party for the ENTIRE 4 floors.

Dungeon Set-up & Layout  
  
* General Concept
+ This dungeon consist of 4 floors (B1-4). Floor 1-3 each has 15 rooms in a 5x3 grids.
+ Your goal is to go through each floor and ultimately defeat the final boss on the 4th floor to clear the dungeon.
+ Each floor will have a floor boss and named mobs that will provide various buffs and activate different mechanics if you kill or don't kill them.

* Weaken Ward
+ Lone Roseberry and Hellcat Louise are the floor bosses on the B1 & B2 floors.
+ Killing each will reduce ceremony progress by 20%
+ These floor bosses provide damage boost when killed (25% with one, 70% with both)
+ If you don't kill either of these 2 floor bosses, you will activate an alternative harder version of B3 floor boss.

* Defeat Monster
+ Tria Celebrum and Volcano Spider are 2 named monsters in this category.
+ They can spawn anywhere in the map at any floor 1-3.
+ Kill Tria Celebrum will save the merchant NPC, Trainee Nayu, that can sell you useful pots if needed.
+ Kill Volcano Spider increases your max Life Token limit, very helpful.

* Chaotic Effect
+ Blood Ria and Nerolotte are 2 named monsters in this category.
+ They can spawn anywhere in the map at any floor 1-3.
+ Kill both will remove the "Chaotic Effect" from the dungeon and also restoring your party's vision in different stages.
+ The "Chaotic Effect" are "+60% hp, increased atk/def"
